event.name: Masdafarai Presents… Carnival After Party
event.artists: Nathan Flutebox Lee, The Clinic, MDJZ
event.tags: Funk, soul, jazz, hip hop, reggae, beats, breaks, Nathan Flutebox Lee, The Clinic, MDJZ
event.short_description: Ginglik’s 2nd Carnival after party is a real treat. We welcome back Masdafarai for a special night of memorable music with the amazing and unmissable Nathan "Flutebox" Lee and his band The Clinic, supported by DJs Masdafarai, Dan Faceme & Chukk Roxx.
event.long_description: Ginglik’s second Carnival after party is a real treat. We welcome back Masdafarai for a special night of memorable music. It’s been too long… Nathan ‘Flutebox’ Lee & the Clinic: A very rare chance to see this incredible mob of maurading musical mentalists in an intimate venue, The full 6 piece band includes: DJ Tigerstyle, WanDan (Beatbox), Skrein (MC), Mike Pagulatos (Viola), Maquensie (Keys) & Matt Constantine (Cello). Fronted by the living legend that is Nathan ‘Flutebox’ Lee this band needs to be seen to be believed. “Sheer Musical Genius” Mixmag “The Best Bloody Thing I’ve Seen In Years” Howard Marks The Flutebox EP is available now on Swaraj Music: www.flutebox.tv Check out this video www.youtube.com/watch?v=FKONoa4WvBE MDJZ: Masdafarai, Dan Faceme & Chukk Roxx will be keeping the dancefloor moving with a marvelous mishmash of massive tunes, spinning only the finest in funk, soul, jazz, hip hop, reggae, beats & breaks guaranteed to get your rumps shaking all night long. Bring it on!

event.name: Jerico Orchestra
event.artists: Adam Bohman : prepared strings & amplified objects, Chris Cook : sitar, Peter Jones : slides & visuals, Gabriel Keen : keyboards, Graham Mackeachan : double bass, Bob Peachey : alto & soprano saxophones, Paul Shearsmith : pocket trumpet, Paul Taylor : tro
event.tags: Live Music, Open till Late, Cheap Prices, Arts & Music combined
event.short_description: Jerico Orchestra is a collective of musicians and sound artists dedicated to exploring the relationship between visual art and music.
event.long_description: Its aim is to encourage its participants to interact in radically different ways by expanding both the concept and form of a musical score. Our performances consist of three elements united together: the collective mind of the orchestra in action, the projected score, and the response of the audience. Together these three elements create a unique work which must be experienced in its totality, live and living, acting on both spatial and conceptual levels, (moving from feeling into meaning) releasing aesthetic responses into involvement with collective consciousness. We believe there is a close relationship between aesthetics and ethics; and that collaborative creative effort is nothing less than an aesthetic model for an achievable political programme.

event.name: Zumba Class in Stockwell
event.tags: Healthy, Music, Zumba, Dance, Keep Fit, Clean Living, Toned, Six Pack, Fitness, Slim, Slimming, Health
event.short_description: Zumba is a latin-inspired dance fitness class which has great music and works and tones every muscle in the body. 6.30 to 7.30pm every Tuesday! Come and Have Fun, Make New Friends in a Healthy Way! Learn from the Best!
event.long_description: The Hidden Gem of London, The Cavendish Arms in Stockwell explores Music, Comedy, Burlesque & Performance. But now every Tuesday from 6.30pm - 7.30pm we are holding the very popular Zumba Classes. Dance your way Fit! And Enjoy for Free Comedy Virgins after from 8pm - 11pm. Zumba is a latin-inspired dance fitness class which has great music and works and tones every muscle in the body. We make sure the class is effective but really great fun. 6.30 to 7.30pm every Tuesday night in the lovely and Glamorous Backroom at The Cavendish Arms, Air-conditioning and changing rooms £5 per class. Fully qualified Instructor. If you fancy a drink after then the bar is open till 12am! Plus we do a mean (and healthy) Soda and Lime with Fresh Lime Juice and Fresh Mint Leaves!

event.name: Film club presents Thelma & Louise
event.tags: Thelma & Louise, Harvey Nichols, films, classic movies, Harvey Nichols restaurants, 80s films, Susan Sarandon, Geena Davis
event.short_description: Harvey Nichols' Prism Brasserie presents Thelma & Louise at the Film Club - classic 80s American teen movies served up with cocktails and bar bites.
event.long_description: Ridley Scott's classic tells the story of two women (Sarandon & Davis) and their escape in a '66 Thunderbird from both the authorities and society's expectations. The Monday night film club offers a taste of Hollywood glamour, retro comedy, fabulous cocktails and delicious bar bites in the surroundings of Harvey Nichols' Prism Brasserie in the heart of the city. Tickets are £15 including entry, a cocktail on arrival and a selection of bar bites. Dinner reservations can also be made for each evening. For more information or to book, please email Sarah Root at prism.events@harveynichols.com or call 020 7256 3875.

event.name: Where Angels Suffer @ The Underworld Camden
event.artists: Where Angels Suffer, Knock Out Kaine, Silent Divide
event.tags: Rock, Metal, Music, Worlds End, Underworld, Camden, Show, Live
event.short_description:
Where Angels Suffer + Knock Out Kaine + Silent Divide
Where Angels Suffer is a project that is long overdue. This all-star band of Metal Royalty has come together to create a new album, encompassing the essence of great Metal Rock bands.
event.long_description: Where Angels Suffer is a project that is long overdue. This all-star band of Metal Royalty has come together to create a new album, encompassing the essence of great Metal Rock bands. The project came naturally, as previous members of W.A.S.P. the artists share a unique style and talent that will be showcased on this exciting album. The band, comprised of Chris Holmes, Stet Howland, Ira Black, Steve Unger and Rich Lewis, will embrace their metal history while simultaneously astounding their fans with ground breaking original songs that could have only by created by the exceptional chemistry and passion these professional musicians discovered when they came together in their new creative endeavour Where Angles Suffer.

event.short_description: Folk and Dagger is down in the beautiful belly where 5 fine and unusual songwriters and bands musically make waves- clunky, dense, intricate, warm, slicey, jazz-fringed, complex, true, absurd stories and oh so easy on the ear....winning!
event.long_description: ~ Gypsy Moth ~ www.myspace.com/gypsymoththeband errrr...."Pseudo-Historical Post-Alternative Folk Rock..." We're a little hard to pin down but imagine a group of musicians from very different backgrounds who sound like theyve been aged in a few boozy bars in France, a couple of pubs in Ireland and plenty of time swaying on the boat inbetween. ~ Jharda ~ www.myspace.com/jhardamusic ~ Laura Victoria ~ www.lauravictoriamusic.com ~ Matthew Wolf ~ www.myspace.com/matthewwolf

event.name: Zizzi Sessions Presents the Midweek Jam
event.tags: Zizzi, Sessions, Prince's, Trust, Laurian, Consultancy, Bristol, Emily, Wright, Sing, For, Your, Supper, Live, Music, Jam, Jazz, Folk, Singer-songwriter, Rock, Guitar
event.short_description: Zizzi Sessions is a weekly music night, hosted by Emily Wright. This week will feature a jam session with a fantastic band, so bring your instrument, your music or just yourself! 0117 929 8700 to book!
event.long_description: This summer, why not head on down to Zizzi at Clifton Triangle in Bristol for a mid-week jam session? Hosted by jazz singer Emily Wright, the jam session is a chance to show what you can do, whatever style of music or instrument you play. Anyone who plays will automatically stand the chance of winning a free main course, and it's a great way to meet other musicians or practice that new song. If you're not a musician, come down anyway and check out the talents of some of Bristol's musicians - you might hear the next big thing before anyone else! Zizzi Sessions is run by Laurian Consultancy Ltd. The Sessions take place every Wednesday at Clifton Triangle, Bristol, and every Thursday at Central St. Giles, London.

event.name: Feedme Music presents Attack Wednesday
event.artists: Amy Love, Rhys Williams, ZED, Kieran Ayres, Always Scarlett
event.tags: Pop, Rock, Funk, Dance
event.short_description: Midweek-marvellous-music event at Punk Nightclub, your feet will not be able to keep still to this sexy pop night...
event.long_description: Amy Love gives you the diary of an Essex girl mapped out over 21st century rock n roll blueprints kneaded and twisted into a big city fanfare by her team of loyal acolytes. In the studio every knob is twisted to ensure a miasma of fuzz guitar, big beats and dark sci-fi filters to back up her wide screen vocals and unputdownable choruses Live its down and dirty with a supatite punky three piece cutting a swathe through the action as she struts the stage, occupying a space somewhere between vintage Iggy, Debbie Harry and maybe Pink on a good night. Formed in Feb 2010 from a diverse background of musical genres, the London based Always Scarlett combine soaring melodies, catchy guitar riffs and diverse rhythms. A strong, sassy band with great hooks – what more could you want? ZED play electo funk, soul and house and are determined to make the audience dance. Coming from a wide variety of backgrounds including Gospel, Industrial, Electronica and Funk the boys of Zed formed to bring dance to a live arena. They have been gigging throughout London and enjoy creating a party wherever they go. Born in the land down under and raised in London, Kieran Ayres (rhymes with chairs, bears and stairs) brings a sense of innovation to the UK rock and pop scene. After plying his trade in bands from a young age, he has developed an ability to sing and perform with an energy and verve that will cut right to the senses of everyone who likes music of the rocking variety. Rhys Williams - His work was described as ‘striking’ on Radio 4, ‘delightful’ in Q Magazine and ‘horrific’ in the NME. It also led to two internet death threats. Join us for a night of funky pop-rock music on Wednesday 31st August 2011. http://www.ticketweb.co.uk/user/?region=gb_london&query=detail&event=461423&interface=feedmemusic

event.name: Van Downham Feat Jerry Donahue
event.tags: Van Downham, Van Downham band, jerry donahue, live music in london, live music in surrey, live music in godalming, live music in woking, live music in guildford
event.short_description: The Van Downham sound specialises in combining vocal harmonies with great musicianship, producing a result which has been likened to The Eagles.
event.long_description: Van Downham have achieved massive success across Europe over the past 15 years, in particular Eastern Europe where they appeared on Polish TV, including the Miss Intercontinental Contest aired live. Adding to that countless huge festivals and stadium gigs. The band, who's lead singer hails from the North West of England, are now increasing their exposure in the UK and are in talks with Universal Records in America. Joining them t...his summer is the writer, producer and guitar legend, Jerry Donahue, well known for his work in the UK Folk Rock having graced the records of many well known acts that include Fotheringay, Fairport Convention, The Yardbirds, The Proclaimers, Joan Armatrading, Chris Rea, The Hellecasters and The Beach Boys. Jerry Donahue, the "guitarist's guitarist", or as the late great Danny Gatton christened him, "the string bending king of the planet". The Van Downham sound specialises in combining vocal harmonies with great musicianship, producing a result which has been likened to The Eagles. The show features some great songs including Orange Blossom Special, plus self penned tracks from Van Downham. Also in the show expect to hear the great tracks from Donahue including Around The Bend and Rocking The Dog, plus for Jerry fans there will be a special question and answer session where he will take questions from the audience, Jerry comments 'Its' great doing a Q & A session in the show, you never know what your going to have to answer. Last time it was like show and tell at school – I love it!'.

event.name: Jazz London - John Law Trio at Pizza Express
event.artists: John Law (piano), Yuri Goloubev (bass), Asaf Sirkis (drums)
event.tags: John Law trio, Jazz, London, Pizza Express
event.short_description: Jazz in london with the John Law Trio at Pizza Express, the 31st of August.
event.long_description: As a contrast to his on-going Art of Sound trio, which plays exclusively his own compositions, this new trio project will feature, as well as some of John's most melodic trio compositions, also arrangements of jazz standard repertoire and the odd unusual tune from further afield like Sting or Nick Drake. Some interesting new arrangements but with the emphasis on time, swing and grooves, and, in contrast to the AOS (appearing at this year's famous North Sea Jazz Festival in Rotterdam!), which features unusual sounds in the way of added electronic effects and instruments such as the hang and the glockenspiel, this trio goes back to the classic piano, bass, drums format.

event.name: On Piano Sessions present Eric Ranzoni
event.tags: Eric Ranzoni, The Nightjar, Old Street, Cocktails, Live music , Live piano, Wednesday 31 August, Four Roses Bourbon, EC1
event.short_description: Chicago style blues piano and vocals from British Italian Eric Ranzoni.
event.long_description: Blues piano player and singer Eric Ranzoni is a skilled and versatile pianist with a warm singing voice and a knack to entertain. Eric has played the Blues (and Roots music in general) in numerous venues in the UK, with frequent stints abroad. Many of the musicians he's had the privilege to play with have worked with artists such as Eric Clapton, Memphis Slim, Dr. John, Freddie King, Jerry Lee Lewis, Jools Holland and George Harrison, just to mention a few. The evening's entertainment is kindly sponsored by Four Roses Bourbon.

event.name: Mud Morganfield
event.tags: Mud Morganfield, Muddy Waters, Blues, Hoochie Coochie Man, Rollin' Stone
event.short_description: The first-born son of MUDDY WATERS, the original and undisputed 'Father of Blues', is coming to the Jam House from his home in the Windy City, a-swinging and a-grooving with a deep, blue voice bigger than the Mississippi!
event.long_description: Event Details: The first-born son of MUDDY WATERS, the original and undisputed 'Father of Blues', is coming to the Jam House from his home in the Windy City, a-swinging and a-grooving with a deep, blue voice bigger than the Mississippi! MUD will relive some of his pop's legacy, from "Hoochie Coochie Man" to "Rollin' Stone", in a eerily reminicent manner that has been described as "like watching a ghost in the flesh". Don't miss out! Dress code: Smart dress - no trainers, ripped denim. Shirts for gentlemen please. Admission Information: £5 all night.

event.artists: Max Wallis , Nina Bahadur, Andrienne Odasso, Jacqueline Saphra
event.tags: Poetry music publishing brixton ritzy
event.short_description: Celebrating 10 years of Flipped Eye, famous for bringing performance poetry into print without compromising its energy and for making the humble poetry pamphlet cool again.
event.long_description: Flipped Eyed Thursdays at the Ritzy is a three part showcase for the iconic street-led publishing house, Flipped Eye Publishing on the occasion of their tenth birthday. The series will deliver a range of new and classic work in themed line-ups. FE NEW will feature some of Flipped Eye's present-day and emerging stars. Such as Mark Wallis, Nina Bahadur, Andrienne Odasso and Jacqueline Saphra. Hosted by Inua Ellams and Nick Makoha.

event.name: Jazz London- Marius Neset at Pizza Express
event.tags: Jazz, London, Marius Neset, Pizza Express
event.short_description: Jazz in London the 1st of Septembre at Pizza Express with the brilliant artist Marius Neset
event.long_description: Marius Neset is increasingly regarded as a major emerging voice on the European jazz scene, and his second album (released in the spring on Edition Records) more than justifies the acclaim that is coming his way. The Norwegian saxophonist makes his instrument dance like a gazelle and soars like an eagle. It’s not just the virtuoso technique that impresses; although that is already at a level few saxophonists can live with. Nor is it just Neset’s distinctiveness as a composer. Both these aspects are part of a package that is given shape and focus by that indefinable extra factor that adds up to a unique musical personality.

event.name: Remembering Piaf
event.artists: Anna Lowe, Marcus Tilt, Kelly Price
event.tags: Nightjar, Old Street, Ec1, Cocktails, Thursday 1 September, Edith Piaf, Marlene Dietrich, Live music
event.short_description: Anna Lowe reunites with musician Marcus Tilt to perform the heart-wrenching songs of Edith Piaf, with guest appearances from Kelly Price singing Marlene Dietrich. A perfect fit for the Nightjar.
event.long_description: Anna and Marcus first worked together on the Donmar Warehouse production of 'Piaf' when it transferred to the Vaudeville Theatre in London's West End. They have reunited to deliver some of Edith Piaf's most iconic and dramatic melodies. Guest appearing actress Kelly Price who will join them as the dark and sultry German-born songstress Marlene Dietrich. An evening of passionate vocals accompanied by accordion and piano in one of London's best hidden bars. Descend into the Art Deco era and drink cocktails created in the age in which these songstresses rose to fame.

event.tags: Jazz , London, South, Music, Free, Jam, Cocktails, Live
event.short_description: South London's friendliest jazz musician's gathering playing the finest hip swinging grooves around. All professionals welcome to play. A very successful and established night! Always free entry!
event.long_description: Come and join us every Thursday as we get together for a Jam Session. Join our resident band The Collective and get involved, bring your instruments and your voices, your guitars and your tambourines. The Poet is Herne Hill's only cocktail lounge bar offering over 50 exciting cocktails, beer on tap, an extensive wine list and premium spirits too. event.name: Turnpike Glow @ Rockin' In The Free World
event.tags: live music, DJs, Pizza, cocktails, food, angel, london, islington, Turnpike Glow
event.short_description: Djs playing rock n roll, indie, classic rock and alternative from 6pm. Live bands start at 9pm. lisitngs to follow. FREE ENTRY!
event.long_description: "Keep on......Rockin in the Free World" said Neil Young in 1989 22 years later... The Arc has decided to Rock in its own free world every friday night. To start things off at 6pm The Arc's very own Slapstick Djs will serve you up a whole host of indie, rock, classic rock and alternative records. we do take requests...though only good music thank you! ...at 9pm the first of our bands take to the stage. Turnpike Glow Turnpike Glow started life in Rome in a scene marginalised by glossy Italian mainstream pop and insider trading. But with their Pavement-Phoenix inspired sound they soon found themselves supporting acts like Cooper Temple Clause, The Futureheads and The Constantines. In 2007 they started flying over to do live shows in London, Leeds, Liverpool and Manchester. It soon became clear that the UK was where the band could find a receptive audience and so the songwriting core of the band, Sandro and Giuseppe, moved to London armed with just their guitars and lots of European plug adaptors. One rainy Sunday they bumped into Anthony and James busking on the tube in giant sombreros. They talked, they laughed and eventually, they joined forces… + More TBA What's in it for you: good music. the odd free shot of Jager (if you're close to the bar at least) a couple of free slices of pizza £2 Jager fun shelter and hopefully a hangover in the morning! join us! Rockin Noah Captain of the good ship hammered

event.name: Phantom Limb + Size Nine + Nuke Bnana @ STAND!
event.artists: Phantom Limb, Size Nine, Nuke Bnana
event.tags: phantom limb, size nine, nuke bnana, size nine, stand, stand!, fairfield halls, croydon, live music London, Dave Koors
event.short_description: Three great bands take to the stage as STAND! throws a showcasing party night. Enthralling southern soul from Phantom Limb plus horn-fuelled Latin funk from Size Nine AND dance floor beats courtesy of Nuke Bnana.
event.long_description: Phantom Limb, Size Nine and Nuke Bnana Three great bands take to the stage as STAND! throws a showcasing party night. Enthralling southern soul from Phantom Limb plus horn-fuelled Latin funk from Size Nine AND dance floor beats courtesy of Nuke Bnana STOP PRESS DJ Dave Koors will also be appearing to provide the soundtrack for the night! Headlining are Phantom Limb, with their own take on southern soul, carrying some beautiful gospel and country influences with them. Inspiration from Aretha Franklin, the Band and the Staple Singers gives this Bristol based outfit the delicacy to convey the type of honesty that "only comes from singing about the truth". One of BBC London presenter Robert Elms' albums of 2010, it is easy to see why artists such as Candi Staton, Solomon Burke, The Avett Brothers and more recently Rumer have requested Phantom Limb support them. To see and hear more, click here http://www.phantomlimbmusic.co./video/. Support comes from Size Nine and Nuke Bnana Size Nine is an eight piece band from South London. They combine the tightest rhythm section and the rowdiest horns behind the gritty, thought-provoking lyrics and soulful tones of Brixton's finest songstress, Breezy Lee Ethelion. Nuke Bnana is the brain child of another Brixtonian - this time DJ/musician Jonny Bolax. New for 2011 STAND! sought some help from Mr Bolax to describe his band - "With a blend of extreme syncopation, tribal sonics and challenging lyrics, this new group is sure to contort dance floors from here to Uranus." Thanks Jonny! Doors 7pm / First act on stage 8pm / Tickets £7 in advance £9 on the door STAND! at the Fairfield Halls Launching with a new schedule of events, STAND! will be bringing headline contemporary music to the Arnhem Gallery - creating one of South London's largest flat floor music venues. The opening series of gigs features soul, funk, reggae, ska and R&B and clearly shows the commitment to bringing diverse and renown artists to a much needed, genuine mid-sized venue in South London. With new staging, great lighting and sound, plus the Arnhem Gallery bar open, STAND! is not only generating an amazing response from the musicians involved but also great anticipation from gig-goers of some fantastic nights ahead. Keep in touch with all the latest news and buy tickets at www.standatfairfield.com. Or call the Box Office : 0208 688 9291

event.name: It's All Happening presents... Yearbook
event.tags: kings head, It's All Happening, Aftershow Party
event.short_description:
After a summer break It's All Happening are returning to the King's Head on Friday 2nd September, and with Yearbook, Barely Modern & Control on the bill, it's going to be a good one!!
Aftershow party till 2am with DJ and exclusive drinks promos.
event.long_description: After a summer break It's All Happening are returning to the King's Head on Friday 2nd September, and with Yearbook, Barely Modern & Control on the bill, it's going to be a good one!! £4 in advance or before 8, £5 after Tickets from King's Head, It's All Happening, and http://www.wegottickets.co​m/event/127452 Yearbook’s stutter and starts through their angular architecture has prompted numerous comparisons to Bloc Party, but with punk energy rather than pretentious attitudes. Their lyrical dexterity weaved with angst fuelled riffs is available for you to check out in advance, on their EP All Squares & Circle, available to download freeeee. Barely Modern make the kind of scuzzy garage rock that has the music press periodically wetting their pants and predicting a return to the good old days of days of Albion. Originally from Slovenia, they now call London home, and It’s All Happening have already put money on success shaking their way. Control, five lads from South East London play songs that whirl along like bittersweet clouds of confetti, propulsive choruses being carried by catchy melodies. ‘Sea of Doubt’ is as good a place as any to start your listening journey. Yearbook http://ihateyearbook.tumbl​r.com/ Barely Modern http://www.myspace.com/bar​elymodern Control http://controlmusicuk.com/ Aftershow party till 2am with DJ and exclusive drinks promos.

event.name: The Bush Technologists

event.name: Feedme Music presents Future Rock
event.artists: Charly Coombes & The New Breed, Morning Lane, Korda Marshall, Kid Kenosis
event.tags: Rock, Indie, Alternative, Pop, Live Music, 100 Club, London, Charly Coombes and the New Breed, Kid Kenosis, Morning Lane, Korda Marshall
event.short_description: Join us at the legendary 100 Club for a night of awesome rock, pop and indie bands. This is one live music event you do not want to miss!
event.long_description: Charlie Coombes and the New Breed were formed in the summer of 2009 and have been touring ever since. In 2010 they played in Europe and USA, including the SXSW festival. They also released 2 EPs: their debut "Panic" and the second EP "Waves", both to critical acclaim. Charly and the band continue to go from strength to strength as 2011 sees a new release later in the year, summer festival appearances, and a major UK tour. Morning Lane have consolidated their position as one of the best bands on the local London scene and in preparation for 2011, the band are currently in the process of building relationships with industry executives who will promote the band's music to a much wider audience through music placement and shows in front of much bigger audiences. With songs like She Dancer, How It Ends and Wake Up, Morning Lane have found their unique spot in the music scene that transcends their current fan base. With an international appeal and songs that resonate in people long after they leave a Morning Lane show, an air of imminent success is brewing. Take two parts pop, one part rock, add a splash of dance, and then pour over a valve amp. Korda Marshall is a London-based pop rock five-piece, blending infectious melodies with edgy guitars, pumping bass-lines and pounding drums. Consisting of five bold composition students, they knock their collective heads together to give their catchy, mainstream sound a sizzle, with an electrifying live show. Kid Kenosis are an indie-rock band from Northampton who, in their own words enjoy "preparing sounds that go in your ears, make your heart aflutter, and make your body want to jig." You don't want to miss this night!!

event.name: Feedme Music presents Friday Jams
event.tags: Rock, Classic Rock, Live Music, London, 229, Superlungs, Bad Wolf, Jokers Dozen
event.short_description: Want a night of amazing live rock music? Then look no further, this event has it all and it is all wrapped up for you at the super-cool venue, 229. Get ready to rock!
event.long_description: Jokers Dozen - formed in 2009, hailing from scenic east London, this gunslinging 6 piece are out to redress the balance for hard rock and bring the soul back to this ole town. Influenced by rock through the ages, from Zepp to ZZ, Metallica to Muse, and armed with a burning desire to put the spectacle back into live music, Joker's Dozen mean business and there is no rest for this wicked bunch. Led by guitar-driven riffs and a joker up their sleeves in the form of a Hammond, the band are currently undertaking shows in the capital. The ‘Dozen’ are here and they’re ready to show their hand to live fast and save the rest for later. Bad Wolf is a 3 piece rock band from London. If you're a Dr. Who fan, you'll know where the name is from. If you don't, look it up! Enjoying a broad range of influences from Nirvana to Shostakovich, Metallica to The Smiths, Bad Wolf have been likened to "a cross between Muse and Arctic Monkeys on acid fronted by Morrisey". The boys don't necessarily agree with this, especially lead vocalist Simon, who is not from Manchester, has never had a quiff, and refuses to jam flowers in his back pocket. Any Bad Wolf fan will tell you, the band are as wicked as a Scooby-Doo bad guy. Catch them if you can. Superlungs, a young rock band with a story to tell. When Roger Daltrey first heard them he swore. Jimmy Page actually stood up and air guitared! And David Courtney (who discovered Leo Sayer) invited them to perform on his latest album, alongside Sir Paul McCartney and David Gilmour... They were once the youngest signed rock band in Europe, their first single reached No 19 in iTunes worldwide Essentials Chart and their songs have been used in a recent Hollywood production. The band's debut CD, six years in development, was recorded in the same studio and on the same analogue tape machines used by The Pretty Things and Arthur Brown for their most recent studio albums; all produced by Slade’s engineer. Superlungs are now getting stuck into the live circuit to promote their new album 'Nobody' and to establish the Superlungs name throughout the UK. It seems they have a very good head start! Miss it at your peril....

event.name: Love Music Hate Racism (Gil Scott Heron Tribute)
event.artists: The People's Army , Pandit G, 4i2i, Zita Holbourne, Zana Rose, Jamie Joseph , Michael Rosen, Chloe
event.tags: live music, spoken word, Gil Scott Heron, Rap , Hip Hop, Tribute, Love Music Hate Racism
event.short_description: Rich Mix have teamed up with Love Music Hate Racism to commemorate and celebrate the life of musician, poet and activist Gil Scott Heron.
event.long_description: Rich Mix have teamed up with Love Music Hate Racism to commemorate and celebrate the life of musician, poet and activist Gil Scott Heron. This honorary evening will include live poetry performance, music, talks and DJ sets celebrating his life and work. Gil Scott Heron is frequently referred to as the Godfather of Rap, although this is a title he disputed as equally as he disputed the claim that his music is solely about politics. He preferred to refer to himself as a ‘Bluesologist’. Scott Heron’s career spanned over forty years and included collaborations with many talented musicians including Brian Jackson and more recently with Jamie XX. There is no doubt that his music and poetry revolutionised the rap scene in the 1970s and still remains a strong influence for contemporary culture and the recent rise of spoken word. After his death many musicians, including Mos Def and Public Enemy have spoken out about how critical his work has been for the Hip Hop and Rap scenes. He was one of the first artists to use music to attack the apartheid in South Africa and has spoken up against racism, poverty and frequently battled for social change. One of his most famous songs “The Revolution will not be Televised” spoke out against passivity and many of the themes he touched upon in his lyrics such police violence, hope and allusions to television culture are still very relevant today. If we look around the world and even in our own community, the messages and themes that Gil Scott Heron was fighting for are still resonant in the present day. In his own words, here’s “To Better Days Ahead”. Love Music Hate Racism www.lovemusichateracism.com Gil Scott Heron www.gilscottheron.net

event.name: Ben Poole
event.tags: ben poole, blues music in surrey, blues music in godalming, live music in surrey, live music in godalming
event.short_description: Twenty-two year old Ben Poole is currently being described the most exciting young blues guitarist to come out of the UK for a long, long time.
event.long_description: Twenty-two year old Ben Poole is currently being described the most exciting young blues guitarist to come out of the UK for a long, long time. The past year has been an extremely exciting one for Ben, seeing his name crop up regularly in Europe's biggest selling guitar magazine Total Guitar who recently named Ben as "the guitarist to watch out for in 2010". Ben has also realised a lifelong dream to play with one of his favourite living musicians – US guitarist/singer/songwriter Richie Kotzen, touring with him on Richie's October 2009 UK tour. With the release of the five track EP EVERYTHING I WANT, produced by none other than esteemed guitarist Bernie Torme (Ozzy Osbourne, Ian Gillan), Ben Poole will now get his unique virtuoso guitar playing out to a far wider audience and will surely become the name to drop when talking about new, young and gifted blues/rock guitarists. Of the five tracks on the EP, four are from the pen of Ben Poole, the only cover being a blistering rendition of the Paul Rodgers/Andy Fraser penned﻿.

event.name: Rebel Truce (Clash Tribute)
event.tags: Rebel Truce, Clash Tribute, Live Music in Birkenhead, Fisk, Punk music on thw wirral
event.short_description: With a repertoire of some 50 songs ranging from the incendiary blast of “1977” to the assured swagger of “London Calling”. Rebel Truce is a must see, not only for fans of the Clash, but for all lovers of live rock ‘n roll.
event.long_description: Rebel Truce have the visual style and excitement of the Clash, and the same explosive, all action stage presence, with front man Jerry delivering an adrenalin fuelled, foot stomping performance that has won over even the most sceptical Clash fans. Heated Outdoor Pavillion BBQ DJs Shot Girl Drink Offers Great atmosphere! Jagerbomb £2.05 Fisk Shot £1 Revolver is situated near the heart of Birkenhead on The Wirral. This grand building has enough space for 3 stages and 5 music zones; including a smoking area consisting of a large heated outdoor pavillion. It also has Accomodation and free parking available. Revolver is the Premier live music venue on The Wirral. It prides itself on providing high quality tribute acts of all varieties; including rock, metal, punk, indie, soul and even disco; and also on showcasing original and local talent. Although Revolver has always given opportunities to local bands, they have recently teamed up with 7Waves Radio station and also the Vendetta Records Label, and host a monthly event dedicated to the showcasing and promotion of original talent. Revolver also prides itself on the quality and variety of drinks available; from a wide choice of international beers, both bottled and on draught, to a selection of bourbons and rums. And if youre not fussy about your tipple there are always drink offers available! Whether you are looking to dance, chill, rock out or just listen to some great live music, you'll find yourself at home here.

event.name: Liberty Festival
event.artists: Heart n Soul’s Jazztronics with VJ’s , Soprano & concert artist Victoria Oruwari, Graeae’s Rhinestone Rollers , Stand up from Kiruna Stamell , Electrifying rap from Lady MJ , French juggling sensationJuggle Deaf, Deaf Men Dancing with Rachel Gadsde
event.tags: Deaf, Disabled, Boris Johnson, Mayor of London, Free, Music, Cabaret, Arts, Dance, Children, Fun, Family, Entertainment, Southbank Centre, National Theatre
event.short_description: Liberty is a platform for amazing new work from deaf and disabled artists. Come to the Southbank Centre and the National Theatre to enjoy an afternoon of music, cabaret, outdoor arts, dance and fun for children. www.london.gov.uk/liberty
event.long_description: Liberty is a platform for amazing new work from deaf and disabled artists. Come and enjoy a free afternoon of music and cabaret, outdoor arts and dance, and fun for children. For the first time this year, the festival is hosted at London’s Southbank Centre, as part of celebrations for the 60th Anniversary of the Festival of Britain, and the National Theatre as part of the Watch This Space Festival. The two main festival locations are the Clore Ballroom, inside the Royal Festival Hall, and Theatre Square, outside the National Theatre. Liberty is organised to be as accessible as possible for artists and audience and all are welcome to attend. Stewards will be on hand to help people find their way around the site, with information points at the Southbank Centre and Theatre Square. For more information about the event and the accessibility visit www.london.gov.uk/liberty

event.name: The Whybirds
event.tags: Loud + Quiet, NME, Americana UK, BBC 6 Music, The Quietus, The Stool Pigeon, Mojo, Classic Rock Magazine, XFM, Cargo, Shoreditch, Pearl Jam
event.short_description: The Whybirds, from Bedford, bring their Pearl Jam meets The Allman Brothers sound to Cargo in London for a headline show on Saturday 3 September 2011.
event.long_description: Classic Rock journalist Derek Oliver said: “If you are at all interested in alt.country rock then you’ll love The Whybirds. They have it all; songs, musicianship and a sense of maturity that most acts of this kind can’t even comprehend. I’ve lost count of the amount of times that Q, Uncut or Word magazine has banged on about alt-country artists to hear music that sounds like its been recorded in a bathroom by clueless embryonic singer/songwriters. “These guys are the real deal – think Flying Burrito Brothers, Tom Petty and The Band. Better looking than the early Eagles and every inch as determined, you’ll be hearing more of these guys some time soon.” According to Americana UK, The Whybirds “…sound like Pearl Jam having a fist fight with The Allman Brothers in Don Henley’s back yard. But what’s more important is that The Whybirds might just be the hardest working and hardest rocking band in Britain right now – a band destined for greatness”.

They have it all; songs, musicianship and a sense of maturity that most acts of this kind can’t even comprehend. event.name: The Band Of Holy Joy
event.tags: Artrocker, Loud + Quiet, NME, The Quietus, Folk Rock, Rough Trade, Radio Joy, The Borderline, Mojo, Resonance FM
event.short_description: 80's indie cult band The Band Of Holy Joy follow-up their Glastonbury Festival appearance with a London headline show.
event.long_description: Forever changing, consistently unique yet, always somehow the same, The Band Of Holy Joy began life as gutter chansoniers using junk shop instruments to propagate a brute romantic madly literate form of dispossessed urban folk music. Since then the band have scaled a few heights fallen down in one or two gutters, broken up, glued themselves together, toured the world, released a fair few albums for the likes of Rough Trade and fully explored other media by presenting two audio visual song plays: Troubled Sleep at the Shunt Theatre in London 2008 and an Invocation for William Burroughs at the Sorbonne Paris in 2009. They have set up their own label and Internet radio station Radio Joy. These days the junk shop instruments of old are long gone, and guitars, violins and visuals very much to the fore. But the band continues to write about the same outsider concerns with the same measure of spirit and care and man, they still put on a show. The Band of Holy Joy – forever changing, consistently unique, always the same. Join the adventure as they pass through your town.

event.name: Oktoberfest comes to London
event.tags: Oktoberfest, Oompah band, German beer, Oktoberfest London, Bratwurst, Pretzel, Pork knuckle, Beerfest, Bavarian food
event.short_description: An Oktoberfest experience you and your friends will never forget! Our Oompah band will have you standing on your chair singing along and joining in their special Oktoberfest Olympics. Prost!
event.long_description: Celebrate the Oktoberfest comes to London Saturday 3rd September According to TNT and TIME OUT Magazine 'we are the closest thing to Beerfest outside of Munich' as we are the only place in the UK that serves all your favourites – Paulaner, Augustiner, Hofbräu, Löwenbräu, Spaten, Hacker Pschorr and many more. Be entertained by our legendary live brass band 'Oompah Brass' and enjoy our traditional Oktoberfest food such as Pork Knuckles, Bratwurst and Pretzels! We have the best beerfest atmosphere - just like the beer halls in Munich - and import all our beer directly from Germany. Our Fräuleins will serve you in traditional German Dirndls and steins will be overflowing with ice cold German beer - for non-beer drinkers we also have a full service bar with wines, spirits and ciders. We guarantee you will be standing on your chair joining in the fun. Awesome prizes for best Bavarian costume, beer drinking Olympics and a shot of Schnapps for free if you'll come in a costume. Please make sure you book your tickets ahead as spaces are limited Please email www.octoberfestpub.com or 02077365293 Prost und zum Wohl.

event.name: The Animals & Friends with special guest Steve Cropper
event.tags: The Animals & Friends, Steve Cropper, The Alban Arena, St Albans, Live Music, Hertfordshire
event.short_description: The Animals & Friends With special guest the legendary Steve Cropper
event.long_description: Saturday 3 September 7.30pm The Animals original members John Steel, Mickey Gallagher (The Blockheads, The Clash, Paul McCartney), plus John E Williamson (Titanic) and Peter Barton (Mindbenders, Boomtown Rats) return to St Albans to play their greatest hits – House of the Rising Sun, We’ve Gotta Get Out Of This Place,Don’t Let Me Be Misunderstood, It’s My Life, Bring It On Home To Me and Boom Boom. Joining them onstage is legendary US blues guitarist Steve Cropper, who over the course of his illustrious career has been part of Booker T & The MGs and backed Otis Redding, Sam & Dave and Rufus Thomas, before finding cinematic and musical fame as a member of The Blues Brothers Band. In 2003 Rolling Stone magazine named him among the Top 100 Guitarists of All Time. www.playitsteve.com

event.name: Dumplins w/ MFC Chicken (live)
event.artists: Trojan Pete (Dj), Cabstars (Live), MFC Chicken (Live), Marc Ello (DJ)
event.tags: ska, Reggae, Horatia, Highbury & Islington, free, Drinking, Dancing, 2am finish
event.short_description: Dumplins returns to the Horatia for Sept for an eclectic music line up ranging from Ska Hop to Sax fuelled Surf Rock'n'roll w/ the Cabstars & MFC Chicken Live & Trojan Pete on the 1’s & 2’s
event.long_description: Dumplins Ska night fantastic residency returns to The Horatia in Holloway Road eclectic music line up ranging from Ska Hop to Sax fuelled Surf Rock'n'roll. For the September soiree there are two great live acts the Cabstars & MFC Chicken plus Trojan Pete on the 1’s & 2’s and it's free entry Mfc Chicken -Formed on top of the prestigious chicken shop of the same name, MFC Chicken came onto this earth for one purpose, and one purpose only: to resurrect the real rock and roll music and enjoy the finest fried chicken. Alright, that is two purposes. And we might even add a third purpose: to get your beautiful butts out on the dancing floor. Raw, sax-fueled rock and roll/ rhythm and blues tunes are always on the menu, so come down the the MFC Chicken shack and shake it on out with them at Dumplins. http://www.myspace.com/mfcchicken Cabstars - The Cabstrar who hail all the way from original 2-tone city Coventry hit the Horatia tonight the Cabstars start live performances with their explosive mix of ska, dub and reggae. Dj Trojan Pete -If you are into Ska and you go out in London you shouldn't need any further introduction for this legendary skanking rare groover who is the resident of this great night See you down at Dumplins!

event.name: Feedme Music presents Live Music at Purple Turtle
event.artists: Ronda, We Are Embassy, Faith N Fury
event.tags: Rock, Indie, Live Music, Purple Turtle, Ronda, Faith N Fury, We Are Embassy
event.short_description: Want a night of indie-rock Live Music? Then look no further than Purple Turtle on the 3rd September where we have an amazing line-up for you.
event.long_description: Ronda have been creating a real buzz within the West Midlands, supporting the likes of Human League, T'Pau, Berlinda Carlisle. However, Ronda are a 4 piece Indie rock band who claimed the number 6 spot in the BBC Introducing songs of 2010. Ronda appeared at a number of festivals including the Worcester music festival, Wyside music festival (on the same bill as The Strangers) recording live & aired on BBC Radio's Introducing show & SnodFest, recorded live & also aired on BBC Radio's Introducing show. Ronda have been described as Radiohead meets Travis with strong original commercially appealing songs. Andrew Marston of BBC Radio's Friday session 'Ronda have continued producing a high standard of material'. Ronda appeared Live in session on BBC Radio's Introducing programme during 2010 plus have been played many times. The band won the mantle of best band in Herefordshire & Worcestshire as voted by Wyvern FM listeners in 2009. Andy O'Hare of BBC Introducing saying expect big things from this band this year. Sounds of Grandeur from new kids on the block, We Are Embassy. The idea of operatic electronic beats mashed up with thrashy indie sounds a rather odd mix, but somehow Colchester musicians We Are Embassy make it work. Fronted by Matt Wye, We Are Embassy is a motley crew of ages and musical tastes. Bassist Rob norris, drummer Andy Clements and guitarist Mike Crotty complete the line up of the towns hottest new act. FAITHNFURY are a hard hitting 3 Piece rock band from south london. The band quickly took to the stage just a few short months after forming in late 2008. With a huge riffs, addicitive vocal melodies and an attention grabbing stage show that leaves you jumping around whilst wondering how a 3 piece can make such a massive sound, this band has grown from strength to strength and they just keep coming! Steve Leonard heads up this band with his huge voice and guitar skills, perfectly driven by the exciting drumming of Rich Bladon all wrapped up and fronted by Pace on the bass and backing vocals. This band have a close linked and very professional dynamic that never fails to impress. Constantly recording and gigging with bigger venues, crowds and events always in the pipeline this band is something you just have to check out!

event.name: BLUESMIX
event.tags: Blues, funky, funk, jazz, troubadour, saturday, september, london, earl's court, live, live music, fun, dancing
event.short_description: This month's instalment of the always exciting Bluesmix is a night of fun to be had by all. Get on your dancing shoes and a cool Blues suit. (Blues suit not compulsory attire)
event.long_description: Bluesmix play an original blend of funky, soulful blues. Their second album, Biding My Time, was released with great acclaim with radio airplay across Europe, including BBC Radio 2's Paul Jones show. 11 Foot Sack are a powerhouse of energy and passion, led by vocalist, songwriter, saxophonist and harmonica player, Paul Hughes. BC Blues' laid back style is undeniably soaked in Blues & Roots, yet has a fresh touch, particularly with Beth's wonderfully phrased vocal melodies. Bluesmix's gigs are usually sell outs so be sure to book ahead!

event.name: NMC & Focus Organization
event.artists: El Crisis , Left Step Band , Chippeur, KMT, Oya Bun
event.tags: Live Music, Hip-hop, R’n’B, DJ, Dance
event.short_description: Focus Organization and New Microphone Cyphas continue to grow from strength to strength, combining their dynamic energy to host a series of events which put the spotlight on music from the African diaspora and edutainment through the arts.
event.long_description: Focus Organization and New Microphone Cyphas continue to grow from strength to strength, combining their dynamic energy to host a series of events which put the spotlight on music from the African diaspora and edutainment through the arts. On Saturday 3 September, Focus and NMC return to the eclectic East London venue Rich Mix, to host an evening of urban beats and booty-shaking bass. El Crisis (Word Power and Sound Artist) EL Crisis has recorded with some of London's top Hip hop Artists, including Roots Manuva, Blak Twang, Estelle and more, chanting the lead hook on a track called 'Rise Up' that was released in Germany as part of the Brothers Keepers album. Left Step Band (Wildstyle/Ska/Hip Hop) MC'ing meets singing and swaggering beats meet soulful hooks - all imbued with a sense of timeless storytelling and adept lyrical narrative. Chippeur (Modern African Dance) The number 1 African Dancer in the UK will be teaching the basic dance moves of Coupe’ Decale’, Ndobolo and other modern African rhythms. DJ's: KMT (Freedom Teacher) and Oya Bun (Focus) KMT* (Freedom Teacher) uses the culture of Hip-Hop for social cohesion and to raise awareness of social issues. He specialises in UK black/urban music fusing Hip-Hop, R’n’B, Dance Hall, Neo Soul, Soul, Broken Beats, World, Grime and Pop. He has worked on radio and stages throughout the world for over 12 years, playing in venues like Cargo, Shunt, Fabric, Stoke Rochford Hall, African Cup of Nations 2008 (Ghana), and Glastonbury. Born and raised in the Ivory Coast and later moving to Paris, Oya Bun's musical taste has been heavily influenced by both African tradition and the emerging sounds of the African diaspora. His sets incorporate Soukouss, Kuduro and Kwaito, with a special focus on Coupe' Decale'. PLUS •Photographic Exhibition by Alec Moses The Power of a Woman •Painting Exhibition by CCC Art Cinzia Mancini - modern, original handmade acrylic and gel canvasses. El Crisis www.myspace.com/elcrisis Left Step Band www.myspace.com/leftstepband

event.name: Ghetto Lounge presents Afrik Bawantu
event.tags: Live music, DJs, Party, Afro-beat, Reggae, Funk, Mash-up
event.short_description: Afrik Bawantu are in the house at last bringing us powerful drumming, banging bass lines and a fat horn section guaranteed to take you to another level.
event.long_description: Afrik Bawantu are in the house at last bringing us powerful drumming, banging bass lines and a fat horn section guaranteed to take you to another level. 9 piece Afro Funk outfit from Ghana/UK. Formed in 2008 in Hackney East London, this is the most remarkable band at the moment. Led by master drummer from Ghana, Afla Sackey and his international troops playing super heavy weight Afro Funk and Afrobeat. Powerful drumming, groovy bass line and fat horn section will take you to the another level for sure. plus introducing "Afrobuddha" London based Japanese producers Kay Suzuki & Koichi Sakai's new project. Back to back DJ set of Afro, Disco, Reggae and beyond. Upstairs DJs; Nik Weston (Mukatusku Records) Richio Suzuki (Version Excursion) Inumikaku (DoggyTaste)

event.name: Strobe Circus with DJ Wombat
event.tags: Drum + Bass, Dub, Reggae, Electronica, World Fusion
event.short_description: Live showcase of this talented new band fusing the styles of Drum + Bass, Dub and Reggae. Well worth checking out and its all for FREE
event.long_description: Strobe Circus are a 7 piece band who combine drum and bass, dub, reggae and electronic styles guaranteed to move any crowd. Formed in 2009, Strobe Circus have been bringing audiences fresh and interesting sounds and ideas through beautiful, delicate melodies waiting to drop into enormous, tight, dirty drum and bass lines. Each instrument takes a turn to boast its potential before synchronising once again to provide big sounds, great variety and resonating digital effects to an excited, dancing crowd. With initial inspiration drawn from reggae and dance hall, Strobe soon began incorporating the very best of various musical styles and digital effects which compliment the eclectic vocals. DJ Wombat :Expect Balinese Gamelans & Southern Soul amongst the delights from Moodswinger grant showbiz - never predictable even 2 himself the only certainty will be a lack of Heavy Metal & hopefully more than one moment when your synapses smirk & chortle and the Joy of it All.

event.name: JUJU! Feat. Amira Kheir Sat 3rd Sept
event.tags: ritzy, brixton, live music, saturday night
event.short_description: Our favourite night Upstairs with DJ Volta45 Chief Commander Yaaba, showcasing the finest hand-picked selection of true roots music from the heart & soul of Africa.
event.long_description: Sudanes and Italian singer/songwriter Amira Kheir creates a sound inspired by traditional Sudanese singing and instrumentation, blended with elements of Jazz, Soul, East/West African and Middle Eastern music. The result is a unique amalgamation of arrangements that give tasters of Sudan's rich musical and cultural heritage whilst being reflective of our ever-merging world. Amira draws from her own multicultural background to create music that explores themes of home, belonging and transcendental spirituality. To follow, as ever, we have the finest selection of Afrocentric dance floor killers will then take you (and your nyash) into the early hours of Sunday.

event.name: Arabic Music Night at Caffe Concerto
event.tags: Live, music, arabic, night, evening, restaurant, entertainment, sunday, westfield, september, egyptian, lebanese
event.short_description: Post-Ramadan, our exquisite Arabic duo continue their Sunday nights at Caffe Concerto Westfield
event.long_description: Julia is a sensational Russian singer specialising in Arabic music. She released her album "Bin El Sharq' w bin El Gharb" with Lord Sound summer 2010. In spring 2011 being supported by Lycamobile Julia fimed her first music video and had it distributed on most popular Arabic music channels such as Mazika, Rotana, MTV etc In May 2009, she successfully got through to the semi- final of Britain's Got Talent and then went on to be interviewed on different programs such as GMTV, Richard & Judy at Channel 4 and BBC, ITV 2, Kanal D, Al-Jeras etc Now her songs are played at various radio stations, namely Al Jaras, Libanstar and Al Noujoum and her news are published in all major magazines and newspapers around Midle East. Abdul Salam Kheir studied music at the Lebanese Conservatoire, specialising in Mouwashahat (classical Arab song) as a singer and oud player. There he also focused on composing in various musical idioms, which has enabled him to travel all over the world performing and promoting Arab music in live concerts and with ensembles of many nationalities. In August 1994, Abdul Salam was invited to arrange three songs for Led Zeppelin, which he performed in a live concert on GMT. In 1995, he was involved in the composition of the soundtrack of the French Film 'Marie de Nazareth'. Later that year, Abdul Salam worked with the renowned flamenco guitarist Juan Martin and his group, a collaboration which culminated in the release of Musica Alhambra, a CD exploring Flamenco, Arab, Moorish, Indian gipsy and Sephardic music. This CD was performed live during several tours throughout England, Scotland, Ireland, Algeria, Oman and Turkey. In 2004, Abdul Salam took part in a Channel 5 Documentary about Andalusian music with the Spanish singer Clara Sanabras. In 2005, he joined the Ex-Cathedra Choir in Birmingham for a concert of Christian and Islamic music. Also in 2005, he was one of the soloists for the 'Big Voice Festival' in Birmingham, for which a choir 1000 singers came together. In the same year, he performed with the lute player David Miller in the Kilkenny International Festival in Ireland. With his 'Arabic Group', Abdul Salam performed in many festivals throughout the UK, including the Worcester Festival and the English Heritage Festival in Cheswick. In 2006, Abdul Salam performed for His Highness Prince Charles and Prince Mohammed of Saudi Arabia in the Llangollen Festival in Wales. Later that year, he released the album 'Convivencia' with the famous soprano Catherine Bott, lute player David Miller and percussionist Stephen Henderson. As a performer and teacher of Arab singing and oud, Abdul Salam has a longstanding association with Dartington International Summer School. As a composer, Abdul Salam has written songs for many of today's famous Arab singers, including Sabah.

event.name: Flag promotions presents; sad lovers & giants + guests
event.tags: flag promotions, Sad Lovers & Giants, pop, electro, psychedelic, 4th september, purple turtle, camden, crowndale road, mornington cresent, goth
event.short_description:
flag promotions presents:
Sad Lovers & Giants
+ guests
event.long_description: Sad Lovers & Giants SAD LOVERS & GIANTS play classy, alternative pop music. their multi-layered, many-faceted songs have been described by such words as ‘psychedelic’, ‘moody’, ‘exciting’, ‘wistful’, and ‘brooding’. Sweeping keyboards and dramatic piano; chugging, chiming, and eclectic guitars; inventive, melodic bass lines and steady drums with colourful embellishments all contribute to the depth of their sound. integrated into this are the vocals; sometimes confidential, sometimes forceful; always balancing the mood of the charismatic, often mysterious, lyrics. Like the music, the lyrics work on many levels. Just when you think you've unravelled the meaning of a song, another possibility presents itself… SAD LOVERS & GIANTS’ music is food for the imagination, a film without pictures, to transport you to other, but very real, worlds; or another dimension of our own. Commonplace, everyday situations are studied from different viewpoints at a tangent to reality.

event.name: Swingin' Utters @ The Underworld Camden
event.artists: Swingin' Utters, Moral Dilemma, The Exposed, JD & The FDC's
event.tags: rock metal music punk thrash hardcore live worlds end the underworld
event.short_description: Swingin' Utters + Moral Dilemma + The Exposed + JD & The FDC's
event.long_description: One of the more traditional-sounding of California’s punk revival bands, Swingin’ Utters formed in the late ’80s around a first-name-only lineup of vocalist Johnny, guitarists Max and Darius, bassist Kevin, and drummer Greg. Originally based in Santa Cruz, these street punks later moved to San Francisco and recorded for several different labels, including Side One, IFA Records, and New Red Archives. The group first released 1992′s Scared as Johnny Peebucks & the Swingin’ Utters, but things really started to happen for them three years later with their full-length The Streets of San Francisco. The album garnered the band much attention, including Best Debut Album at the Bay Area Music Awards, and Swingin’ Utters soon found themselves on the first annual Vans Warped Tour.

event.name: Land In Focus presents Package Deals: Finland
event.tags: Films, Finland, experimental
event.short_description: Package Deals: Finland premiered June 16th, 2010 at Scandinavia House in New York City and it is currently on its world tour.
event.long_description: Package Deals: Finland premiered June 16th, 2010 at Scandinavia House in New York City and it is currently on its world tour. Join the Land In Focus team on Sunday 4 September as they present the UK premiere of the experimental film package alongside live Finnish music acts such as Mikkokoo. Suomi: Helsinki, Tampere, Turku, Oulu – what lies in the urban centers of the off-the-radar yet historically rich Nordic nation of Finland? We venture there and encounter freak folk, heavy metal, contemporary art, new media, salmiakki, reindeer, and perhaps even a Sami or two. Package Deals travelled across Finland to source the latest in its ongoing instalment of geographically-curated cinematic gems and now Land In Focus is bringing them to you right here in London. Package Deals: Finland toasts the freshest in Finnish film, video art, and museum videos. It's a perfect package connecting the best of visuals and music under the Finnish denominator, offering a bit of everything, from experimental film space to animation. ??Package Deals: Finland premiered June 16th, 2010 at Scandinavia House in New York City and it is currently on its world tour. Join the Land In Focus team on Sunday 4 September as they present the UK premiere of the package alongside live Finnish music acts such as Mikkokoo. Facebook: www.facebook.com/landinfocus Twiiter: http://twitter.com/LIFOCUS Land In Focus: www.landinfocus.com Package Deals: www.landinfocus.com/events/packagedealsfinland

event.name: Monday Night Film Club presents Suddenly Last Summer
event.tags: Elizabeth Taylor, Katherine Hepburn, Tennessee Williams
event.short_description: The Monday Night Film Club presents Tennessee Williams' Suddenly Last Summer starring Elizabeth Taylor and Katharine Hepburn.
event.long_description: Elizabeth Taylor stars in the film adaptation of Tennessee Williams' one-act play. Taylor plays Catherine Holly, a young woman who has lost her mind after witnessing her cousin Sebastian's mysterious death while on holiday. Katherine Hepburn is Sebastian's mother, a woman so protective of her son's good reputation that she is prepared to go to extreme lengths to cover up the circumstances surrounding her son's death. The Monday night film club offers a taste of Hollywood glamour accompanied by fabulous cocktails in the surroundings of Harvey Nichols' Prism Brasserie in the heart of the city. Tickets are £15, and include entry, a cocktail on arrival and a selection of bar bites. For more information or to book, please email Sarah Root at prism.events@harveynichols.com or call 020 7256 3875. Dinner reservations can also be made at the time of booking.

event.name: Movimientos Live
event.artists: DJ Cal Jader, DJ Arias, Remolino Quieto (Live), 7 Suns (Live), Namvula Rennie (Live)
event.tags: Latin , Salsa, Cumbia, Tropical, Reggaeton, Latin bands, Notting Hill Arts Club, Free CDs, Movimientos
event.short_description: Launch of Beginner’s Guide to Latin America with copies of the 3CD comp to give away on the night! DJs Arias & Cal Jader play the freshest Latin beats from Salsa and Cumbia, to Tropical, Urban, Folkloric & Electronic beats. Plus the finest live acts.
event.long_description: Movimientos Live @ Notting Hill Arts Club Tuesday 6th September Launch of Beginner’s Guide to Latin America on Nascente Records compiled by Movimientos’ own Cal Jader with copies of the 3CD comp to give away on the night! DJs Arias & Cal Jader play the freshest Latin beats from Salsa and Cumbia, to Tropical, Urban, Folkloric and Electronic beats Live acts: 7 Suns: Afro-Latin, Caribbean, funk, jazz & rock Remolino Quieto: Cuban and Latin rhythms with reggae and folk Namvula Rennie: Mixing jazz, folk and African Entry: £5 7pm – 2am 19-21 Notting Hill Gate W11 3JQ Tube: Notting Hill Gate Tel: 020 7460 4459 http://www.nottinghillartsclub.com http://www.movimientos.org.uk Following July’s roadblock affair Movimientos return for another packed night of Latin and Tropical dancefloor beats, upcoming bands from the scene, specially curated Latin themed drinks menu and pure good vibes. We also celebrate the launch of Nascente Record’s Beginner’s Guide To Latin America – a 3CD exploration of some classic and contemporary Latin American rhythms compiled by Movimientos’ very own Cal Jader, with copies to give away on the night. DJs Cal Jader and Arias continue to make Movimientos one of the most forward thinking Latin nights in the capital with their selection of new and old school Latin rhythms from Salsa and Cumbia to Tropical bass, Brazilian, Urban and electronic beats. Live music comes from a diverse selection of London based acts from the Latin and global music scene. 7Suns is a group whose music is an energizing blend of Afro-Latin, Caribbean, funk, jazz & rock with strong melodies and up-tempo rhythms and played with a deliciously danceable quality and fantastic rock intensity. Remolino Quieto is the brainchild of established Cuban singer and songwriter Ramsay Estevez whose band, featuring some of London’s top Cuban players, combines his Latin spirit with folk and reggae influences http://www.soundcloud.com/ramsayandthereptiles Namvula Rennie is a singer songwriter who explores her Zambian-Scottish roots through her music. Her evocative songs speak of love and life, belonging and wandering, musically combining jazz, folk and African music. http://www.soundcloud.com/namvula

event.name: Spooky Mens Chorale, Kate Rowe
event.promoter: Pull Up the Roots / Electroacoustic Club
event.tags: Spooky Mens Chorale, Kate Rowe, folk, roots, country, a capella, Queen, Union Chapel, acoustic, live music, gig, show, London, Pull Up The Roots, Electroacoustic Club, N1, Highbury, Islington, Angel, Aussie, Australian, chorale, comedy, humour
event.short_description: The Spooky Men's Chorale have entertained audiences across the globe with dry-witted songs about power tools, idiosyncratic arrangements of Queen songs, as well as traditional Georgian music, which forms a major influence on their compositions.
event.long_description: An all-ages show. Based in the Blue Mountains in New South Wales and led by Stephen Taberner, the Spooky Men's Chorale is a vast, rumbling, steam powered, black-clad behemoth, seemingly accidentally capable of rendering audiences moist eyed with mute appreciation or haplessly gurgling with merriment. Based on the twin pillars of grand foolishness and the quest for the perfect subwoofer-rattling boofchord, the Spooky Men seek to commentate on the absurdity and grandeur of the modern male armed only with their voices, a sly collection of hats and a staggering diversity of facial hair configuarations. They have performed to general delirium at most Australian festivals, conquered the inner sanctums of the ABC, and also pillaged the UK to even more devastating effect in 2006 and 2007. They now have two CDs to offer an unsuspecting public, "Tooled Up", and "Stop Scratching it". It is unclear what is more dangerous to your general equilibrium, missing them, or not.

event.name: Andrea Vicari Trio live at Hideaway, Streatham

event.short_description: Andrea Vicari is one of the hottest young jazz musicians in the UK at the moment. A top pianist and composer highly aclaimed by both BBC Radio 2 and the Guardian for her post-bop era style.
event.long_description: Vicari is a master of sharp, improvisation, with a style that is thoughtful, intense, probing and generating a seemingly endless flow of ideas - Andrea Vicari has worked with the cream of the UK jazz scene including Phil Bent, David Jean Baptiste, Don Weller, Dick Pearce, Mornington Lockett, Tim Whitehead, Tim Garland, The Vortex Foundation Big Band etc., plus US trumpet legend Art Farmer and US sax experimentalist Eddie Harris. http://bit.ly/oZY3j3

event.name: Global Local
event.tags: Live Music, Electro-dub, Drum & bass, Asian , Sufi
event.short_description: From Roma to rumba, Latin beats to Afro funk, new folk to no folk, Global Local brings you the best emerging musical remix talent the UK has to offer.
event.long_description: From Roma to rumba, Latin beats to Afro funk, new folk to no folk, Global Local brings you the best emerging musical remix talent the UK has to offer. We pride ourselves on rooting out the finest cutting-edge sounds which blend innovation and tradition. Produced by Continental Drifts Music and its partners, this ground breaking project consistently brings some of the best music around to festival stages throughout London and beyond. Continental Drifts continentaldrifts.co.uk Engine-Earz Experiment A fusion of traditional Asian beats with booming dubstep and screaming guitars. The Engine-Earz Experiment are smashing what they see as 'glass divides between genres and ideologies'; fusing indigenous musics from around the world with dubstep and elements of drum'n'bass, electronica and alternative rock. Celt Islam Celt Islam creates Sufi inspired Global Grooves to create a Meditative Dub that transfixes everybody who comes across it, to Electro-Dub driven Drum and Bass to satisfy the dance world. He is probably best known to date for his work in the Sufi-Dub genre which he is probably alone in trying to create and to help define as a sub-genre.

event.name: Live piano Old Street cocktail and jazz bar
event.tags: Four Roses Bourbon
event.short_description: A night of Chicago-style piano blues with musician and vocalist Eric Ranzoni, kindly sponsored by Four Roses Bourbon at the Nightjar.
event.long_description: The Nightjar is delighted to host Master Blender Jim Rutledge from Four Roses Bourbon to enjoy our special cocktail of the evening in his honour. Live music will be presented by our latest resident pianist and singer Eric Ranzoni serving up Chicago-style blues. Eric Ranzoni is a skilled and versatile pianist with a warm singing voice and a knack to entertain. Eric has played the Blues (and Roots music in general) in numerous venues in the UK, with frequent stints abroad. Many of the musicians he's had the privilege to play with have worked with artists such as Eric Clapton, Memphis Slim, Dr. John, Freddie King, Jerry Lee Lewis, Jools Holland and George Harrison, just to mention a few. Other than with his own projects, Eric is also in great demand as a Blues session pianist, backing live top international musicians and singers, such as Mud Morganfield (the eldest son of Muddy Waters), Big Joe Louis, Bill Hurley ('The Inmates' singer) and guitar ace Otis Grand, besides several London-based Blues bands. http://www.ericranzoni.co.uk/ http://www.myspace.com/ericranzoni

event.name: Tidal Concerts presents: Cannabis Corpse + guests
event.tags: purple turtle, camden, tidal, cannabis corpse
event.short_description: tidal concerts presents: cannabis corpse + guest
event.long_description: tidal concerts presents: cannabis corpse Cannabis corpse was formed in the summer of 2006 as a way to express our love of smoking weed and listening to Cannibal corpse. We thought that combining the speed and intensity of death metal with outlandish stories involving marijuana monsters, weed cults ect. would be a fresh take on the genre. The songs for our first album "Blunted at birth" were recorded in Weedgrinders kitchen on a boss BR-600 in Richmond Va by Landphil and his brother Hallhammer on a shoestring budget. Some friends liked the sound of the demo so much they offered to put it out as the first release on the fledgling record label "Forcefield Records" and it received alot of positive feedback from the Death metal community. The band had its first live gig on April 20 2007 ( 420 ) enlisting axeman Nickropolis the following year and everyone in the band enjoyed playing the music so much more gigs followed. That same year production on the second full length album "Tube of the resinated" began and was released in 2008 by Forcefield records as well as Robotic empire. The band started to play live much more often at this point doing several tours of the east coast with bands such as Skeletonwitch and Infernal Stronghold. They also got the opportunity to play a role in the Movie " In The Loop" a satirical comedy staring James Gandolphini performing the song "sentenced to burn one" at the Black cat in Washington D.C. in 2009 the latest E.P called "The Weeding" was released on Tank crimes records, The Oct. of 2009 saw the band going on its first full U.S tour with the band RammingSpeed and in Feb. 2010 there first tour of Europe and the UK. Expect to see alot more from Cannabis corpse in the future and Smoke weed everyday!

event.name: Moss Project
event.artists: Moss Freed, Alice Zawadzki, Marek Dorcik, Ruth Goller, Moss Project
event.tags: Camden, camden, Moss, moss, Project, project, Jazz, jazz, Freed, freed, Ruth Goller, Marek Dorcik, Alice Zawadzki
event.short_description: Moss Project, featuring Moss Freed on guitar, fusing sounds of Indie and jazz
event.long_description: Doors open at 7:30pm, music begins at 8pm Loyalty Card Holdlers - this concert applies to our loyalty card scheme “Exciting guitarist Moss Freed leads his Radiohead-tinged outfit through moody, cinematic sounds that blur the lines between folk, rock and jazz with imagination and flair.” TimeOut www.myspace.com/themosssextet THE MOSS PROJECT Moss Freed - Guitar Ruth Goller - Bass Marek Dorcik - Drums Alice Zawadzki - Voice/Violin Moss Freed formed The Moss Project whilst studying composition and performance at the renowned Berklee College of Music in Boston, to provide a platform for progressive and exciting new music. On returning to his hometown of Manchester, he established a group there under the same name who quickly established a monthly residency at Matt & Phred’s Jazz Club. Their debut album, Vision, was released in 2009 on Apsara. The album won much critical praise being described as “a real achievement” by Bill Bruford and as “a fascinating and hypnotically satisfying album which demands repeated plays” by All About Jazz. The band has performed regularly in the UK and Europe over the past three years including the London Jazz Festival and Manchester International Jazz Festival and have completed several successful tours in the UK (Jazz Services supported) and Germany. They have also achieved radio play on Jazz FM, BBC Manchester and ALL FM. In September 2009, Moss made the move to London and quickly established himself as part of the thriving jazz scene. A new quartet evolved featuring several of the UK’s rising stars such as Acoustic Ladyland’s Ruth Goller, drummer Marek Dorcik and vocalist/violinist, Alice Zawadzki. The quartet plan to record a new album in September.

event.short_description: The Brixtown Sessions celebrates one year hosting unique music talent with special guest, The Cinematic Orchestra vocalist, Heidi Vogal.
event.long_description: Brixtown Sessions have gone from strength to strength attracting the highest calibre of talent and regularly drawing the attention of several music industry bodies as well as music lovers. Heidi has worked with a huge variety of acts including The Brand New Heavies, Isaac Hayes, F-ire Big Band, Pororocas, Cleveland Watkiss and will be performing tracks from her new Album ‘Lagrimas De Um Passaro’ (Fly Like A Bird Records).. Neo-Soul singer-songwriter, Trudi Mosiamo brings the Brixtown Sessions to life with her warm and energetic style. Winner of the Glastonbury best unsigned act of the Jazz World, Trudi oversees an evening of music ranging from Jazz, Soul, and Funk, to Country, Latin and Blues, with a sprinkling of comic relief between performances. Upstairs at the Ritzy is the lovely bar and exciting venue above the Ritzy Cinema. We're open 7 nights a week and we pride ourselves on being a well-known & well-loved cultural hub for Brixton. Our stage show-cases a consistently high standard of live music, from Reggae, Afro-beat & Vintage-Swing, to World-Jazz, Folk, Blues, Balkan & beyond! Plus we bring a monthly comedy feast, open mic, performance, workshops & all sorts of exciting group activities. Full menu served all day till 8.30pm – so there’s eats to be had too! event.name: The Fauns
event.artists: The Fauns, Blindness, You Coma, La Bete
event.tags: Loud + Quiet, Artrocker, NME, BBC 6 Music, The Stool Pigeon, XFM, Mojo, Club AC30, Creation Records, Shoegaze, Bristol, The Telescopes, Sonic Cathedral, Nambucca, Steve Lamacq
event.short_description: The Fauns, Bristol's premier exponents of Dream-Pop, return to London for a headline show at Nambucca ahead of the release of their second album.
event.long_description: The Fauns formed in the summer of 2007, initially a three piece the band is now established as a six piece fronted by vocalist Alison Garner. This Bristol based band reference the shoegaze acts of the late 80s and early 90s with a 21st century slant. Their sound is characterized by heavy use of distortion and feedback mixed with delicate vocal harmonies delivered with a pop edge. Their 2009 self titled debut album received across the board critical acclaim. Tracks were featured on Steve Lamacq’s BBC Radio 6 show and on Gill Mills’ Best of Myspace podcast. The band recently toured Germany, Denmark and Norway with ex Creation label legends The Telescopes. There are tours planned for the US, UK and mainland Europe later in 2011 to coincide with the release of their highly awaited second album.

event.name: Kiscsillag @ The Underworld Camden
event.tags: Rock, Music, Live, Show, Performance, Underworld, Camden
event.short_description:
Kiscsillag + Mindpilot
Formed by well-known Hungarian musicians, Kiscsillag often labels itself as “a hobby-band taken seriously”.
event.long_description: Formed by well-known Hungarian musicians, Kiscsillag often labels itself as “a hobby-band taken seriously”. All four members used to play at one point for the band called Kispal es a Borz, who gave an unforgettable live performance in London last year. Kiscsillag will team up with Mindpilot, a recently formed British alternative rock trio featuring Tom Clarkson, András Simonits and Marty McCloskey (Sweet Savage). Their music is known for strong psychedelic vibes and innovative progressive elements. The improvisations and a wide dynamic and rhythmical range make their live shows entertaining and memorable. Expect a clash of generations and rock ‘n’ roll cultures on stage @ Underworld.

Wayne Hernandez is one of those fantastic singers who has been using his considerable talents for many years to make others sound good, and remains a first choice vocalist for stars such as Tina Turner, Gorillaz, Tori Amos, Blur, Grover Washington, Roberta Flack and Madonna.
