event.name: The Monto Presents: Rotten Hill Gang
event.artists: Rotten Hill Gang, The Black Crayon Theatre, Bible John & The Reptiles, Beta Rays
event.tags: £8 on the door
event.short_description: You're entering the Dickensian hip-hop world of Rotten Hill Gang, with tales of old & new London - stories as putrid as decaying vegetables at the end of a day in Portobello Road market & as uplifting & elevating as the sun rising over the Westway.
event.long_description: Look out! Who's that behind you? Watch your pockets..! You are entering the Dickensian hip-hop world of the Rotten Hill Gang, with tales of old and new London - stories as putrid as decaying vegetables at the end of a day in Portobello Road market and as uplifting and elevating as the sun rising over the Westway. It all began with Dirty White's project, the "Rotten Hill Sound System"......Dirty White on the decks and local badman street poet, Reds on the mic. The several musicians involved in this labour of love had first come together when George Vjestica of Groove Armada had presented a weekly night at Ladbroke Grove's Pelican pub.With their crazy beats, they created an atmosphere like no other and caught the attention of Keyboard player/producer, André Shapps. The Rotten Hill Gang was born! Putting together - among other sources - snatches of such movie soundtracks and dialogue as Scarface and Once Upon A Time in America, mixed together with classic rock 'n' roll guitar-riffs, this crew of like-minded musical souls understood they were creating a sound that was utterly original, hugely compelling, and definitely addictive. With the sultry tones of Hollie Cook of the Slits and Hayley Smith, and with Mallet on the drums, the sound was complete. The creativity of the musicians caught the attention of Mick Jones, Charlene Spitteri and Hugh Morgan to name but a few. Going with the theme of "anything is possible", Dirty White approached celebrity jeweller, Stephen Webster to manage the band. He thought it was a joke......it wasn't. The Rotten Hill Gang debuted at the first Carbon Casino night. Even though on that occasion they only played a pair of songs - "Pick a pocket" and "Fed Up" - their unique sound was enhanced by a glamorous image of late 1890's loucheness, an element of which featured André Shapps as king of moustache waxing. That night at the first Carbon Casino, Andre played on a borrowed set of keyboards; unable to obtain them, he moved over to guitar for the subsequent six Carbon Casino shows. Very quickly, the Rotten Hill Gang had become one of the great live road-shows, comparable with soul outfits of the 1960s, or - more appositely - George Clinton's Funkadelic/Parliament. Their material dealt with the dubside of life in Notting Hill, reality with rhythm. With Special Guests: The Black Crayon Theatre, Bible John & The Reptiles, Beta Rays Doors: 7 p.m. Tickets: £8 on the door

event.name: Substance at The Spice of Life
event.artists: Victoria Green, Elle Jay , Richie Syrett
event.tags: Substance, soho, spice of life, live music, R&B, Soul, acoustic
event.short_description: A night of R&B / Soulful pop
event.long_description: A night of R&B / Soulful pop Victoria Green - 10.00pm R&B / Soul Elle Jay - 9pm Elle started out vocally singing jazz lead, solo musical theatre pieces and vocals for a Christian band. Writing my own songs and completing a 1st class degree in English Literature, I started playing/singing my own original material and covers at acoustic cafe nights in Liverpool. I recorded two demos and in 2008, started gigging and showcasing original material around London with guitarist Dan Storey and an acoustic band. In December 08 I sang for David Grindrod and Lord Andrew Lloyd Webber, being shortlisted for a BBC show. In January 09 I formed my full electric band and we have since played all over London including at Café de Paris, The Spice of Life and at The Cavern, Liverpool. My Lucky One (2009) and Addicted (2010) EPs are on sale from itunes, www.cdbaby.com, www.amazon.com and more and have received nationwide radio play and numerous featured artist slots. I have a forthcoming release with Elation records later this year. My biggest pop influences are Madonna, Britney Spears, Pink, Jewel and Delta Goodrum. My songs are catchy, moody, heartfelt and assertive. My ballads are likened to Delta and my dance tracks are likened to Madonna the most! I work with Elation Music, Deuce Promotions, UpAllNight, Substance, DeadOrAlive and Micky P Music Promotions. I currently also lead vocals at a Mayfair church and at private events. Check my page and website (www.thisisellejay.com) for upcoming shows and to buy my music!! Richie Syrett - 8.15pm Richie Syrett is a singer/songwriter currently plying his trade in Manchester, UK. His style, like his personality is characteristically laid back, blending mellow melodic guitar tones to distinctive vocals and harmonies. Richie’s music manages to maintain an accessible originality of it’s own whilst saluting a wide range influences across the Folk/Rock and Roots genres in particular, and retains a novel lyrical quality that avoids well-worn clichés and subject matter. Currently unsigned, he gains his following via a good deal of internet coverage and playing live whenever and wherever he can. He looks set to build on this after having recently independently released his debut album, which is now available Admission:£5 http://www.substancegigs.com/showdetails.php?sid=88&vid=&pa=2 The Spice of Life is a Soho landmark, historic music venue and the perfect meeting place in the heart of London's West End. Renowned for it's sound , the venue holds 100 "One of the best little venue in London" Evening Standard

event.name: Adriano Adewale Quartet
event.artists: Adriano Adewale Percussion/vocals , Kadialy Kouyate - Kora/vocals, Marcelo Andrade - Sax/Flute, Rabeca Nathan Thomson - Double bass/Flute/Kalimba
event.tags: Camden Forge, Forge on Delancey Street, camden forge, north london music venue
event.short_description: Join us for an evening with percussionist and composer Adriano Adewale’s global fusion.
event.long_description: Adriano Adewale Percussion/vocals Kadialy Kouyate - Kora/vocals Marcelo Andrade - Sax/Flute/Rabeca Nathan Thomson - Double bass/Flute/Kalimba Doors open at 7pm for diners, music starts at 8pm Throw aside preconceived musical prejudices, abandon all attempts to catalogue: a rich chemistry of cultural influences is at work when the Adriano Adewale Group gets together on stage. Rooted in the musical traditions of Nigeria, Angola and Brazil and infused with contemporary European classical and jazz styles, percussionist and composer Adriano Adewale’s music is a global fusion of musical influences. He performs with his outstanding ensemble of international musicians: Australian Nathan Thomson on double bass and flute; Senegalese Kadialy Kouyate on kora and vocals; and Brazilian Marcelo Andrade, on flute, sax and rabeca. “Adriano Adewale boasts an imposing collection of firepower yet deploys it with rare restraint.” The Times Adriano formed the Adriano Adewale Group in 2007 to explore his own compositions with other accomplished musicians. Their music explores issues of history, identity and nature. The group has released their debut album SEMENTES (Seeds) in September '08. Produced by international Jazz ledgend Gilad Atzmon the album features Gilad Atzmon and virtuoso guitarist Antonio Forcione. Dine with this event? There are a limited number of tables available for dining during this event. Purchasing a ticket for the music does not automatically reserve a table to dine. To book a table, please ring Caponata Restaurant on 020 7387 5959 or click here Please note that you MUST book tickets in advance for this event if you are booking a table to dine. It is possible to dine during this performance. Diners and non-diners welcome contact@forgevenue.org

event.long_description: Come and be a part of the start of something BIG. J.A.M. is the the place where new artists exploring the genres of Grime, Hip Hop, Pop, Uplifting Rap (and more) want to showcase their work, where people come to be entertained. Food and Drink Sold till Close!

event.name: Jamboree
event.artists: Nigel Burch & his Flea-Pit Orchestra, Green Diesel
event.tags: Sea shanties, dark ballades, jigs for dancing, Nigel Burch & the Flea-Pit Orchestra, Green Diesel, Limehouse, East end, Live music
event.short_description: Dark ballades, sea shanties, jigs for dancing and Cockney- Brechtian folk-punk cabaret from Burch
event.long_description: Two exceptional bands, authenic musicians, speaking about the truth and live in London, the pubs and the sea.. sung and performed in the irresistable atmospheric haunt of old London town. This is exactly what a night out in the heart of old London town should be! Green Diesel "Why be a poor man on the land, when you'd be king at sea?" Green Diesel began irritating the neighbours in 2009 and have consistently torn Kentish venues apart with their energetic take on folk-rock. Inspired by the darker side of English folk, the band mix influences from across the musical spectrum and bring them to bear on tales of doomed Kentish ghost ships, cuckolded noblemen and more besides. Dark ballades, sea shanties and jigs for dancing. http://www.myspace.com/thegreendieseltheory plus Nigel Burch & his Flea-Pit Orchestra Twisted skiffle, spit-and-sawdust vaudeville and Cockney-Brechtian folk-punk cabaret from Burch, the banjulele-bashing bard and his musical misfits including Dylan Bates, typsy gypsy fiddler extraodinaire, the Paganini of Penge. Manic minstrel Burch delivers his dark and gritty bittersweet ditties with wit and a vitriolic fervour. Violinist Bates adds an entertaining jazz-tinged playful poignancy - ...all underpinned with the slightly unhinged rythm section of Richard Lee (double bass) and Steve Blake (drums) http://www.reverbnation.com/nigelburchandthefleapitorchestra

event.name: RAMMLIED The UK’s 1 Rammstein Tribute at Bogiez Cardiff
event.tags: rammstein, cardiff, bogiez, rock bar, south wales, heavy metal, industrial, rock music, rammlied
event.costs: £7 for band (inc free entry to afterparty) / £4 for club night only.
event.short_description: RAMMLIED – The UK’s #1 Rammstein Tribute performing live at Bogiez Rock Bar & Nightclub, Cardiff, Wales UK.
event.long_description: RAMMLIED – The UK’s #1 Rammstein Tribute Friday 9th September @ Bogiez Tickets £7.00 – Doors 8:00pm – Band on at 9pm – 18+ Show Free entry to club night afterparty for ticket holders. The UK's #1 Rammstein tribute will be playing live at Cardiff's only dedicated rock and metal bar and nightclub. The band will be followed by the infamous Dark Party club party with DJ's spinning the finest selection of music from the darkest reaches of time and space (rock, industrial, trad goth, batcave, synth, nu-wave, new romantic and more).

event.name: AKASHA
event.tags: LIVE
event.short_description: Akasha Play Live plus Support
event.long_description: Wig out to some cosmic jazzy grooves from Akasha and psychedelic their six piece band before taking the floor with Steve Hellier's carefully selected soul bangers. Whacked out projections and guitar loopery from Steve Kemp in support. www.myspace.com/akashamusic Doors 8pm until 1 am £5 entry

event.name: Abi Moore
event.tags: abi moore, the farncombe cavern, live music in surrey, live music in london, live music in godalming, live music in guildford, abi moore gigs
event.short_description: With her foundations rooted in acoustic music, Abi’s songs are well crafted, accessible and full of warmth, reminiscent of the 60’s/ 70’s songwriters.
event.long_description: The Farncombe Cavern is pleased to welcome back Abi Moore, who performed here last on the on the 17th of September 2010. With her foundations rooted in acoustic music, Abi’s songs are well crafted, accessible and full of warmth, reminiscent of the 60’s/ 70’s songwriters - Elton John, Sting, Lennon and McCartney, Joni Mitchell, Fleetwood Mac, Bob Dylan and Simon and Garfunkel. Add in Abi’s modern- day relevance, cynical grit, a glance to Kate Bush, Sheryl Crow and Karine Polwart and then lace it all up with thought provoking, observational, truthful and socially aware lyrics. If that doesn’t get you hooked, her astounding voice and luscious vocal harmonies certainly will. Staunchly independent, Abi’s music is made without compromise and without barriers. She self- released both of her albums, “The Aftermath of ‘96” in 2006 and her second album “Things We Should’ve Said” along with a live DVD in 2009. She completed a massive 70- date national tour as Artist of the Month for Café Nero in the summer of 2009 and her albums were played in all 360 of their UK branches. 2010 saw the opening of her new record label “Honest Records” and she is currently working on her third album.

event.name: Introducing Charlotte Mckay at Caffe Concerto
event.artists: Daniel Benisty, Ollie Metcalfe, Charlotte McKay
event.tags: live, music, jazz, opera, restaurant, soul, pop, ballad, evening, friday, september, westfield, entertainment, bar, service, outing, shepherds , bush, notting, hill, west, london, piano
event.short_description: Daniel Benisty opens for brilliant jazz duet Charlotte and Ollie
event.long_description: Daniel Benisty is an eclectic in the truest sense of the word, switching from Giuseppe Verdi to Kings of Leon to Ray Charles to Michael Buble in a matter of minutes. His favourite interpretations are currently close to Billie Holiday, Diana Krall and Nina Simone. Charlotte McKay and Ollie Metcalfe are outstanding young graduates from the London School of Musical Theatre. They will be performing a range of Ella Fitzgerald and Musical Theatre favourites from 830. Charlotte's singing is quite beautiful. Close your eyes and you will think Ella Fitzgerald or someone of her effortless talent, lyrical wizardry and sublime vocal control is in the room.

event.name: South Of Heaven Live Metal music on the Wirral
event.tags: Slayer tribute on the Wirral, live metal music in birkenhead, Fisk
event.short_description: South of Heaven are a Midlands Based Tribute to Slayer and the next best thing to seeing Slayer Live. Slayer Fans will be impressed!
event.long_description: Beer Garden DJs BBQ Shot Girl Drink Offers Jagerbomb £2.05 Fisk Shot £1 Revolver is situated near the heart of Birkenhead on The Wirral. This grand building has enough space for 3 stages and 5 music zones; including a smoking area consisting of a large heated outdoor pavillion. It also has Accomodation and free parking available. Revolver is the Premier live music venue on The Wirral. It prides itself on providing high quality tribute acts of all varieties; including rock, metal, punk, indie, soul and even disco; and also on showcasing original and local talent. Although Revolver has always given opportunities to local bands, they have recently teamed up with 7Waves Radio station and also the Vendetta Records Label, and host a monthly event dedicated to the showcasing and promotion of original talent. Revolver also prides itself on the quality and variety of drinks available; from a wide choice of international beers, both bottled and on draught, to a selection of bourbons and rums. And if youre not fussy about your tipple there are always drink offers available! Whether you are looking to dance, chill, rock out or just listen to some great live music, you'll find yourself at home here.

event.name: "Back to School" with Andie Measure
event.tags: live, music, andie, measure, london, city, one, new, change, shopping, centre, food, italian, restaurant, piano, bar, service, jazz, buble, legend, stevie, wonder, musician, event
event.short_description: Andie Measure resumes his friendly and familiar Friday night residency at Caffe Concerto St Pauls, after a sneaky Mediterranean getaway
event.long_description: Andie Measure, veritable rising star of Caffe Concerto, sings like Seal, Freddie Mercury and Michael Buble, plays piano like John Legend, Elton John and Billy Joel. It wont be long before he is snapped up to tour the worlds great stadiums, so come along and say you saw him here first.

event.name: LowBrow Free Art and Music Festival
event.artists: Mel Merio, Albert Gold, Nedry, Micachu, Rattus Rattus, Mystro, Colin Dale, Skipple, Crises, Sai, Joao Brasil, Mr Shiver, Joe Le Groove, The Bumps, Logic, Kane, soulprovyder, Jordan V
event.tags: Free Festival, Pop Up Gallery, Live Graffiti, HipHop, House, Techno, live music, Drum n Bass, East London, Soul
event.short_description: Free Art and Music Festival in Shoreditch/ Dalston
event.long_description: Saturday Sept 10th will see Haggerston Park, Shoreditch/ Dalston transformed for one day into a free music and art extravaganza showcasing some of London’s hottest audio and visual talent. Situated 10 mins walk from Shoreditch High St, Haggerston Park sits on the border between Shoreditch and Dalston, 2 of London’s most creative areas. In the music marquees we have a broad selection of genres including Mel Merio Music star, MTV host, television talking head, fashion model and personality, radio commentator, event producer, Micachu from the widely acclaimed Micachu and the Shapes, Mystro and Logic established names from the UK hiphop scene, Colin Dale Techno pioneer and ex Kiss FM DJ, Mr Shiver who's DJed in pretty much all London's biggest venues the last one being him headlining for Wet Yourself at Fabric in July, Rattus Rattus from the Urban Nerds, Nedry with rave reviews by Radio 1 and the Guardian and much more. In the art area we have live graffiti from Rowan Newton whose visually strong take on street art has caught the attention of many, leading to many exhibitions in New York (Red Dot Art fair, Affordable Art Fair), Miami (Bridge Art Fair), Paris (Affordable Art Fair), Amsterdam (Affordable Art Fair) as well as his home town of London. Also Otto Schade whose distinctive style adorns the 333 club interior and exterior and has also exhibited his work in Concepcion (Chile),Berlin (Germany), Moscow (Russia) , New York (US), Amsterdam (Netherland) and finally to London (UK), where he is currently living and working. In the playground area we have HungaMunga is a creative collective who organise fun parties where you are invited to make stuff, make friends and make a mess. Each party is filled with a plethora arts and crafts materials and hundreds of things to make and do. Also the charity Whizz-Kidz provides disabled children and young people with vital mobility equipment - such as powered wheelchairs - opportunities to meet and have fun, and training to help them gain skills and look forward to a bright future.

event.name: Tomorrow's Warriors at Gail's Garden Party 2011
event.tags: jazz, Tomorrow's Warriors, Gail's
event.short_description: At this year's Gail's Garden Party there will be a special presentation by young musicians from Tomorrow's Warriors, a leading UK organisation for jazz music education and professional artist development
event.long_description: This year will be the 6th year of running our annual food festival, The GAIL’s Garden Party, in Hampstead on September 10th. We'd like people to return to their high streets to shop at their local butchers, fishmongers, greengrocer and cheesemongers, which used to be the heart and soul of a community; a distinctive place where people come together to meet, shop and interact. The Garden Party is our way of bringing the community back together and saying ‘thank you’ for welcoming us to Hampstead, our first shop, all those years ago. A number of stallholders will set up on Oriel Place to sell their beautiful food and we’ll have live music and facepainting. This year, we’re teaming up with the Gayton Festival, so you can buy your foodie treats at the Garden Party and head down to Gayton Road where there will be plenty of fun and games to keep the kids happy and burn off some energy.

event.name: The Monto Presents: Assembly
event.tags: Cargo, East London, Assembly, Beggars Canyon, live music
event.short_description: Having played the London circuit for a while, Assembly have built up a reputation of delivering high- energy shows, combining folk melodies with an indie-rock drive, and hammering out "hook-laden songs".
event.long_description: Assembly are an amalgamation of two Liverpool bands from the early 2000’s. After separating and leaving their home city to go to university, each pursued other musical projects, until paths crossed again in London. Having played the London circuit for a while, they've built up a reputation of delivering high- energy shows, combining folk melodies with an indie-rock drive, and hammering out "hook-laden songs". With an increasing fan base, some great press reviews, and an unquenchable thirst for playing live, this band is "guaranteed to leave a lasting impression!" With Special Guest: Beggars Canyon Doors: 6:30 p.m. Tickets: £8 on the door

event.name: Hells Bells The AC DC Tribute at Bogiez Cardiff
event.tags: ACDC, Cardiff, Bogiez, rock club, south wales, tribute, rock bar
event.short_description: The world (in)famous HELLS BELLS crash into Bogiez on Saturday 10th September for a show of truly epic proportions!
event.long_description: The world (in)famous HELLS BELLS crash into Bogiez on Saturday 10th September for a show of truly epic proportions! Hells Bells are an accomplished AC/DC Tribute Band who have performed all over the UK as well as Portugal, Austria, Russia, Belgium, Czech Republic and the Middle East. If you love AC/DC then you’ll love our high energy performance – a show not to be missed. Check out the Gig Guide to find out when we’re playing near you and we’ll see you there! Band will be followed by the Bogiez Saturday club party.

event.name: Jazz Duo Daniel Benisty and Vilija Leitanaite
event.tags: Live, music, swing, jazz, duo, daniel, Vilija Leitanaitė, benisty, caffe, concerto, westfield
event.short_description: Daniel Benisty, resident jazz pianist at Caffe Concerto, invites superbly talented young Lithuanian Jazz Singer Vilija Leitanaitė
event.long_description: Daniel Benisty and Vilija have performed across London at a number of high profile venues and events. Their favourite repertoire comes from the American Songbook, including Billie Holiday, Ella Fitzgerald, Frank Sinatra, Antonio Jobim, as well as Nora Jones and Eva Cassidy classics.

event.name: This Feeling Ft. Special Headline Act To Be Announced!
event.tags: Indie , Rock & Roll, Club Night, DJs, Shoreditch, Special Guests
event.costs: £6 before 9pm, £8 after 9pm, Limited advance tickets at http://www.thisfeeling.co.uk/
event.short_description: Monthly residents This Feeling return to Queen of Hoxton with a very Special Secret Live Headline Act to be announced. Expect big names in indie, rock and roll and Special Guest DJs.
event.long_description: Referred to by Noel Gallagher as ‘a colossal club night’ This Feeling are back with yet another stellar line up of bands playing the best indie and rock & roll this country has to offer. Don’t take Noel’s word for it; get down early to see what the fuss is all about!

event.name: Ready the Horses
event.tags: The Elasticated Waste Band
event.short_description: A raggle-taggle, travelling minstrel ensemble of Banjo pickers, Howlin' Slim Harmonica Lickers, ukelele flickers, Fiddle diddlers, Louisianna style rag-time Punk-Band!
event.long_description: The Elasticated Waste Band are a London-based nine piece acoustic band. A raggle-taggle, travelling minstrel ensemble of Banjo pickers, Howlin' Slim Harmonica Lickers, ukelele flickers, Fiddle diddlers, crooners, swooners that all make for a veritable old-timey, medicine show of a freaky, Louisianna style rag-time Punk-Band! Their sound is a drunken but majestic pile-up of pre-war blues, show tunes, hillbilly ska, foot-stompin' bluegrass and classic pop which will leave you grinning from ear to ear. They'll have you singin’ your heart out and dancing your feet off - a good time is guaranteed! Martyn Bonanza (ResonanceFM) Band Members Tony Rowlett - Vocals / Harmonica Bernard Kelly - Guitar / Vocals Trevor Parsons - Fiddle / Vocals Ed Grace - Ukulele / Vocals Russ Ashford - Banjolele / Vocals Andrew Hillier - Concert Ukulele / Vocals Bob Kane - Bass / Vocals John Burgess - Banjo Martin Murray - Drums

event.name: Lyrix Organix
event.artists: Lyrix Organix, The Hip Hop Shakespeare Company
event.tags: Hip Hop, Spoken Word, Poetry, Folk
event.short_description: One-off collaboration between two groundbreaking forces of lyrical Hip Hop (Lyrix Organix & The Hip Hop Shakespeare Company).
event.long_description: One-off collaboration between two groundbreaking forces of lyrical Hip Hop (Lyrix Organix & The Hip Hop Shakespeare Company) - headlined by Mercury-nominated TY, hosted by UK’s finest emcee AKALA - exploring parallels between Shakespeare and Hip Hop. Featuring special guests, DJ’s and stalls. With a huge show at Glastonbury Festival 2011 (at Bassline Circus) already causing a palpable buzz, Lyrix Organix returns to Rich Mix with a ground-breaking live experience rooted in Hip Hop and Spoken Word. Potent poetry, revolutionist Hip Hop, spine-tingling Folk and raw Soul collide in a palette of innovative live shows – packed with surprise collaborations, beat boxers, DJ’s, live visuals, urban art, fashion and charity (Medecins Sans Frontieres) coming together to conjure a unique and vibrant atmosphere. A reputation for diversity, cutting-edge talent and ethical ethos has seen Lyrix Organix rise to become one of the most talked-about promoters in the UK. Lyrix Organix works closely with and raise awareness for several important causes, including international humanitarian aid charity Médecins Sans Frontières (to whom we have donated all our profits to date). Pushing boundaries. Broadening minds. Raising consciousness. Lyrix Organix: www.lyrixorganix.com

event.name: London African Music Festival: feat Diabel Cissokho
event.tags: Live Music, Saturday night, Ritzy, Brixton
event.short_description: Master of the Kora & Ngoni (west African lute), and is a phenomenal singer & composer. His virtuosic talent, expression and sensitivity puts him on a whole other level. With full band he’ll be playing tracks from his new album.
event.long_description: Master of the Kora & Ngoni (west African lute), and is a phenomenal singer & composer. His virtuosic talent, expression and sensitivity puts him on a whole other level. With full band he’ll be playing tracks from his new album on which he fuses his love of West African, Saharan & traditional Blues music, drawing inspiration from his Griot family heritage. This man will make you speechless. Now in its ninth year, the London African Music Festival finds a new home Upstairs at the Ritzy alongside 5 other key London venues. Get set to celebrate some of the best in music from across Africa, ranging from Gospel to Soukous, Soul to Funk, Acoustic Blues, to raw Roots Music. See www.joyfulnoise.co.uk. Upstairs at the Ritzy is the lovely bar and exciting venue above the Ritzy Cinema. We're open 7 nights a week and we pride ourselves on being a well-known & well-loved cultural hub for Brixton. Our stage show-cases a consistently high standard of live music, from Reggae, Afro-beat & Vintage-Swing, to World-Jazz, Folk, Blues, Balkan & beyond! Plus we bring a monthly comedy feast, open mic, performance, workshops & all sorts of exciting group activities. Full menu served all day till 8.30pm – so there’s eats to be had too! Follow us on Twitter: http://bit.ly/fi4bIz Add us on MySpace: http://mysp.ac/g3A3Egy

event.name: FLORENCE JOELLE’S KISS OF FIRE
event.tags: LIVE
event.short_description: FLORENCE JOELLE’S KISS OF FIRE
event.long_description: FLORENCE JOELLE’S KISS OF FIRE Super fine and sassy Joelle, who melds a Tarantino-esque sense of cool with a vocal style that infuses both Peggy Lee and Edith Piaf with touches of blues, jazz and rock 'n' roll. Her fine band includes guitarist/songwriter/film director Huck Whitney Plus Thomas Lavelle 40’s 50’s Boogie Woogie Piano Man http://thomaslavellemusic.com/home.html A FREE night of live music and fun plus DJ Dan Newman playing Boogie Woogie tunes until 1am

event.name: Earwicker Presents... Cape Fear
event.tags: kings head, earwicker, feeder, cape fear, inxs, aftershow party
event.short_description:
Another chance for you to catch this fantastic band after recently playing alongside the likes of FEEDER and INXS with support from Big Truck.
Earwicker after party downstairs until 2am! featuring Live DJ and drinks promotions. Bring your badges!
event.long_description: Earwicker is proud to present the return of CAPE FEAR! Another chance for you to catch this fantastic band after recently playing alongside the likes of FEEDER and INXS! Having worked with producer Greg Haver (Manic Street Preachers & Lost Prophets) on previous projects, Cape Fear are now back in the studio to record brand new material for release later this year. Accessible, genuine and refreshing, Cape Fear's prolific live show has won them many fans, and their hard-working ethos, powerful anthems and soaring melodies will surely see them win thousands more in the future. With national club and university tours planned for this year, as well as hometown sell-outs and successful international dates to their name (alongside the likes of The Foo Fighters, Incubus, Nine Inch Nails and Marilyn Manson), Cape Fear look set for a big year in 2011. http://www.capefear.co.uk/ http://www.myspace.com/cap​efearsite http://www.twitter.com/cap​efearband http://www.youtube.com/cap​efearvideo http://www.reverbnation.co​m/capefear Plus support from - Big Truck BIG TRUCK are a four-piece line up with soaring guitars, driving bass, solid drums and choruses that have you singing along before you even know the words. They hail their influences from a variety of contemporary and classic bands - Foo Fighters, The Who, Muse and Jimi Hendrix to name but a few. http://www.myspace.com/big​truckmusic Live music from 9pm. FREE ENTRY! Exclusive Earwicker after party downstairs at The Kings Head until 2am! featuring Live DJ and drinks promotions. Bring your badges!

event.tags: Jimi Hendrix Tribute on the Wirral, Live Rock Music in Birkenhead, Fisk
event.short_description: Are You Experienced are a Tribute to Jimi Hendrix (and the Jimi Hendrix Experience) were formed over twelve years ago and in that time they have become widely regarded as just about the best JIMI HENDRIX tribute show you will see.
event.long_description: The band are proud to be playing the timeless music of Jimi Hendrix, providing some nostalgic moments for those lucky people who actually witnessed Jimi in the flesh and recreating some of the magic for a new and eager audience. Come down to Revolver on the 10th September and relive the excitement and explosive stage show of the JIMI HENDRIX EXPERIENCE. Let the band take you through all the favourites like ‘Hey Joe’, ‘Voodoo Chile’, ‘All Along The Watchtower’, ‘Foxy Lady’ and ‘Little Wing’, culminating in the guitar-burning finale of Wild Thing. "Wow! I mean wow! John Campbell's set was a revelation" Darren Redick PLANET ROCK Heated Outdoor Pavillion BBQ Shot Girl Drink Offers Bottle Becks £1.89 Sngle Bulliet Bourbon £1.50 Revolver is situated near the heart of Birkenhead on The Wirral. This grand building has enough space for 3 stages and 5 music zones; including a smoking area consisting of a large heated outdoor pavillion. It also has Accomodation and free parking available. Revolver is the Premier live music venue on The Wirral. It prides itself on providing high quality tribute acts of all varieties; including rock, metal, punk, indie, soul and even disco; and also on showcasing original and local talent. Although Revolver has always given opportunities to local bands, they have recently teamed up with 7Waves Radio station and also the Vendetta Records Label, and host a monthly event dedicated to the showcasing and promotion of original talent. Revolver also prides itself on the quality and variety of drinks available; from a wide choice of international beers, both bottled and on draught, to a selection of bourbons and rums. And if youre not fussy about your tipple there are always drink offers available! Whether you are looking to dance, chill, rock out or just listen to some great live music, you'll find yourself at home here.

event.name: Jazz London- TINA MAY at Pizza Express
event.tags: Tina May, Music , JAZZ, London, Pizza Express
event.short_description: Jazz in london with Tina may at Pizza Express.
event.long_description: The evening is the long-awaited launch of the second album by Tina May and her Parisian Quintette entitled 'No More Hanky Panky', named after a Dexter Gordon piece which Tina has given lyrics – along with Dexter's 'Cheesecake'. This will be a real Parisian Jazz Party!

event.name: Chambre69 Presents Layo & Bushwacka!
event.tags: Chambre69, Shake It!, Layo & Bushwacka!, Glasgow, Party, LIVE
event.short_description: Chambre69 proudly Presents Layo & Bushwacka! on the 10th Sept. Layo & Bushwacka haven’t played the city since May'07, they said “Can't wait to play Glasgow again, we miss the energy of the crowd, very very happy to be coming back to the UK Detroit!”
event.long_description: Chambre69 Presents Layo & Bushwacka! Chambre69 10th September 2011 11pm-3am £10 Chambre69 proudly Presents Layo & Bushwacka! on the 10th September, bringing their esteemed club night ‘Shake It’ to Glasgow to drop an exclusive 4hour DJ set! Layo & Bushwacka haven’t played the city since May 2007, when asked about their return, they said “Can't wait to play Glasgow again, been way too long, really miss the energy of the crowd, very very happy to be coming back to the UK Detroit!” Layo & Bushwacka!’s reputation as two of the world’s foremost DJ duos is rock solid. Three artist albums have proven them remarkably talented producers - capable of mixing styles, tempos and genres to create enduring and engaging electronic music. Their trio of mix albums and international club residencies have shown they are masters of the turntables; sonic connoisseurs who can guide a dance-floor on an epic journey through the many facets of their sound. Their label Olmeto, meanwhile has become a bastion for quality - a label that much like it’s figureheads, has become a stamped seal of class. Chambre69 is Glasgow's latest edition of the kitsch ‘underground' venue. Standing firmly and proud in their ‘450' capacity league and fully loaded with a Funktion One Soundsystem. Chambre69 has already played club host to the likes of The Japanese Popstars, Andy Weatherall (Primal Scream Afterparty), Martyn, Braiden and Billy Woods plus a whole host of credible Glasgow’s club promoters including No Sleep, Deadly Rhythm, Vitamins and Ange Noir. Chambre69 is a hub for both emerging and established acts and talents. You’ll find Chambre69 tucked in between Urban Outfitters and American Apparel, down the cobble lane on 69 Nelson Mandela Place. Only 30 seconds from Buchannan Street Underground, or a 2 minute walk from Queen St and Central Station. Buses also stop right across the road at George Square. See Layo & Bushwacka! in action... www.youtube.com/user/ShakeItLondon?blend=10&ob=5 Links: www.chambre-69.com www.olmetorecords.com Twitter - @chambresixty9 http://www.facebook.com/pages/Chambre69-Glasgow/121264381276756 Tickets: Tickets are available from www.ticketweb.co.uk or 24/7 on 08444 77 1000 and also at Ticket Scotland. Direct ticket link for tickets...www.ticketweb.co.uk/user/?region=gb_scotland&query=detail&event=462567&interface= For all enquires contact: hello@raiseasalute.com

event.name: Keys & Coffee Series: Christina McMaster
event.tags: Christina McMaster, christina mcmaster, classical, Classical, Pianist, pianist, Camden, camden
event.costs: £9/7 online (incl tea/coffee), £10/8 on the door (incl tea/coffee)
event.short_description: Beginning this season of Keys and Coffee, pianist Christina McMaster brings us a wonderful hour of Debussy, Chopin and Finch
event.long_description: This concert runs from 11am-12pm with no interval Tea and coffee will be available in the glazed courtyard from 10:30-11:00am Young British Pianist Christina McMaster has been described by Piers Lane as a musician of “Maturity and Profundity” Her passion for performance has resulted in numerous successes and prizes including at Jaque Samuels Intercollegiate, Il Circolo and The Cavatina Chamber Music competitions. Christina loves to collaborate and has collaborated with a number of wonderful musicians including ‘The Brodowski Quartet’, Soloists from ‘Orchestra of Age of Enlightenment’, and as member of the prize winning ‘Maestoso Trio’.

event.short_description:
Human Disease presents:
Pombagira album launch show
w/

event.name: Smile Acoustic
event.tags: Live Music, original songs
event.short_description: Smile is an acoustic night with free cake, free entry, a good bar and great original songs from real musicians who like to give a bit back on a Sunday evening off.
event.long_description: It's that song you had in your head though you never heard it before It's those words that couldn't be said cos they needed a little bit more It's something new and though you haven't a clue you hum along all the while Cos you feel in tune with others in the room and it's starting to make you SMILE Smile is an acoustic night with free cake, free entry, a good bar and great original songs from real musicians who like to give a bit back on a Sunday evening off. It’s diverse, thoughtful, pleasant and fun, with new music from everyone. You might have seen the musicians before, on a big stage or rocking the floor, but Smile is where they come to chill out, to play songs that say what it’s all about. We keep the sets short to keep the music fresh, there’s always something coming up next. But they all get up and play a little more, and before you know it we’ll have to kick you out the door. Don’t worry you can come again, you’ll probably want to bring a friend… Arthur Lea arthurlea.co.uk

event.name: Arabic Music Night at Caffe Concerto Westfield
event.tags: Live, arabic, music, oud, singer, sunday, westfield, caffe, concerto, village
event.short_description: Our Sunday night residents perform Arabic Music classics, from Egypt, Lebanon and Iraq
event.long_description: Julia is a sensational Russian singer specialising in Arabic music. She released her album "Bin El Sharq' w bin El Gharb" with Lord Sound summer 2010. In spring 2011 being supported by Lycamobile Julia fimed her first music video and had it distributed on most popular Arabic music channels such as Mazika, Rotana, MTV etc In May 2009, she successfully got through to the semi- final of Britain's Got Talent and then went on to be interviewed on different programs such as GMTV, Richard & Judy at Channel 4 and BBC, ITV 2, Kanal D, Al-Jeras etc Now her songs are played at various radio stations, namely Al Jaras, Libanstar and Al Noujoum and her news are published in all major magazines and newspapers around Midle East. Abdul Salam Kheir studied music at the Lebanese Conservatoire, specialising in Mouwashahat (classical Arab song) as a singer and oud player. There he also focused on composing in various musical idioms, which has enabled him to travel all over the world performing and promoting Arab music in live concerts and with ensembles of many nationalities. In August 1994, Abdul Salam was invited to arrange three songs for Led Zeppelin, which he performed in a live concert on GMT. In 1995, he was involved in the composition of the soundtrack of the French Film 'Marie de Nazareth'. Later that year, Abdul Salam worked with the renowned flamenco guitarist Juan Martin and his group, a collaboration which culminated in the release of Musica Alhambra, a CD exploring Flamenco, Arab, Moorish, Indian gipsy and Sephardic music. This CD was performed live during several tours throughout England, Scotland, Ireland, Algeria, Oman and Turkey. In 2004, Abdul Salam took part in a Channel 5 Documentary about Andalusian music with the Spanish singer Clara Sanabras. In 2005, he joined the Ex-Cathedra Choir in Birmingham for a concert of Christian and Islamic music. Also in 2005, he was one of the soloists for the 'Big Voice Festival' in Birmingham, for which a choir 1000 singers came together. In the same year, he performed with the lute player David Miller in the Kilkenny International Festival in Ireland. With his 'Arabic Group', Abdul Salam performed in many festivals throughout the UK, including the Worcester Festival and the English Heritage Festival in Cheswick. In 2006, Abdul Salam performed for His Highness Prince Charles and Prince Mohammed of Saudi Arabia in the Llangollen Festival in Wales. Later that year, he released the album 'Convivencia' with the famous soprano Catherine Bott, lute player David Miller and percussionist Stephen Henderson. As a performer and teacher of Arab singing and oud, Abdul Salam has a longstanding association with Dartington International Summer School. As a composer, Abdul Salam has written songs for many of today's famous Arab singers, including Sabah.

event.name: MAP Trio
event.artists: double bassist Marcus Penrose, saxophonist Alam Nathoo , drummer Peter Ibbetson
event.tags: Live Music, Cool Music, Open till Late, Hoxton Shoredicht Live Music Jazz
event.short_description:
Press:
'Extraordinary technique, developing an interesting and individual voice'- Sebastian Scotney
'Nathoo's tone was warm but his sound surprisingly powerful'- Chris Parker
'Nathoo's patient development was impressive'- John Fordham
event.long_description: MAP Trio brings together three of London's finest improvisers in double bassist Marcus Penrose, saxophonist Alam Nathoo and drummer Peter Ibbetson. An evening of original music, which collects twisted grooves, hard swing and dynamic improvising of the highest calibre. Line Up: Alam Nathoo - Tenor/Alto, Marcus Penrose - Piano, Peter Ibbetson – Drums, + Special Guest Richard Turner - Trumpet "Oustanding" The Guardian Press: 'Extraordinary technique, developing an interesting and individual voice'- Sebastian Scotney 'Nathoo's tone was warm but his sound surprisingly powerful'- Chris Parker 'Nathoo's patient development was impressive'- John Fordham Some comments about 'Pluralism': 'Spacey, highly melodic groove-based modal jazz' - Timeout 'A promising young band, they draw on the likes of Outhouse and the Julian Siegel UK/US trio's angular approach to composition and soloing.' - Timeout

event.name: The Orain Series Feat. Dougie MacLean
event.tags: The Orain Series, Folk, Bethnal Green
event.short_description: Autumn 2011 marks the debut of The Orain Series - a new non-profit project of registered charity St. Margaret's House showcasing three of the most widely acclaimed folk artists in the UK - Dougie MacLean, Heidi Talbot and James Yorkston.
event.long_description: Dougie MacLean is one of Scotland's most successful, respected and popular musicians. Singer-Songwriter, Composer and 'magical' Performer, he is also a fine guitarist and fiddle player. From his home base in Butterstone near Dunkeld in the beautiful Tay Valley in Perthshire Scotland, MacLean tours the world with his unique blend of lyrical, 'roots based' songwriting and instrumental composition. His moving song Caledonia and melody The Gael (used in The Last of the Mohicans) have been recorded by hundreds of artists and enjoyed by millions worldwide. "...a Scottish phenomenon...with his exquisite guitar style, expressive voice and honest performance, his songs conjure up remarkably vivid imagery of our world" (The Performing Songwriter, USA) Door open at 6:00pm, show starts at 7:00pm. Tickets available online at http://www.seetickets.com/Tour/DOUGIE-MACLEAN

event.name: Allsortz
event.tags: Open mic, Live music, Sing, Spoken word, Gig
event.short_description: An evening packed with energy and talent. Showcasing the very best the capital has to offer in up-and-coming performers.
event.long_description: An evening packed with energy and talent. Showcasing the very best the capital has to offer in up-and-coming performers. Are you a singer, rapper, dancer, comedian, or spoken word artist looking to take that next step and perform in front of a live audience? If so then Allsortz is for you! Take to the Big Stage at Rich Mix and show us what you’re working with! We’re still looking for acts to perform in the first show, so if you know somebody or you are that somebody then get in contact. And don’t feel left out if you’re not chosen for a gig, there’s still an opportunity for you to step up and look sharp in our Wild Card half hour, where anything is possible…. Rock up with a CD, your poetry book, or some of your best gags and we’ll give you 3mins to rock the crowd! Up for the challenge – we’ll see you there! If you would like to be involved please email a brief description of your work, and any relevant links (e.g. soundcloud, myspace, youtube) to programming@richmix.org.uk Please note that although we try to make this event accessible for all ages, we cannot guess what acts will choose to take part in our 'Wild Card' session - however, this will always take place after 9pm, so if you are concerned about content please schedule your visit accordingly.

event.name: Man Man + La Shark
event.artists: Man Man, La Shark, White Heat DJ's
event.tags: Man Man, La Shark, Cargo, East London, live music
event.short_description: He was right - they're one of the best bands I've ever seen live. Here's a bit of that Uncut review: "Man Man's sound recalls Tom Waits in both his lovesick Troubadour and gothic hotelier guises, as well as the phantasmagoria of Danny Elfman"
event.long_description: Man Man is joining us from Philadelphia. They're over in Europe for a few weeks and making a two-date foray into the UK. It got sold to me like this: "Finally the wild and exciting MAN MAN will come back to Europe with a new album on ANTI Their new record "Life Fantastic" is recorded by Mike Mogis (Bright Eyes, Monsters of Folk) First review (uncut) attached. No more explanation needed I think..." He was right - they're one of the best bands I've ever seen live. Here's a bit of that Uncut review: "Man Man's sound recalls Tom Waits in both his lovesick Troubadour and gothic hotelier guises, as well as the phantasmagoria of Danny Elfman" We're putting this show on at Cargo because the Lexington's not really quite big enough... With Special Guests: La Shark & White Heat DJ’s Doors: 8 p.m. Tickets: £11 in advance

event.name: Red Sky At Night
event.artists: Dakota Jim & friends, Le Skeleton Band, Garance Louis
event.tags: Le Skeleton Band, Dakota Jim, Dancing, Limehouse, Live music, Garance Louis, Gig
event.short_description: A night with americana, cajun, gypsy folk style live music
event.long_description: Every Monday again we invite you to our amazing Red Sky At Night Host Dakota Jim & his Family with a night of americana, cajun, gypsy folk style live music Bands such as 'Dakota Jim & his Family, Louisa Jones, Garance Louis our french chanson musette, Brook Sharkey, Franky & the Jacks, TJ Johnson and 'The General play regulary on this night. And always with a spectacular guest band. This weeks special guest band Le Skeleton Band Le Skeleton Band is a great sonic for the sad Pere Lachaise soul. Let us pass Chopin, Wilde & Morrison & spy on slow night skeletons scattering amongst the tombs. It truly works, I’d contentedly dance mad & liberated beneath casting momentary silhouettes within the sphere of LSB. Their debut album ‘Preacher Blues’ is complete, well structured and consistent in its message. It is sad but at the same time encouraging. They seem like a younger sibling of their compatriots Noir Desir but hopefully the follicley challenged lead singer will not bludgeon his girlfriend to death with a pottery penis – then again perhaps this passion is why Noir Desir have the beards & LSB the butt fluff. www.myspace.com/alexandtheskeletonband 8- 11pm Only £3

event.name: Substance and Goo Music at The Bowery
event.artists: General Bye Bye , Young Aviators, Megafauna
event.tags: Substance, Goo Music , live music, indie, New Oxford Street , Free Entry
event.short_description: Substance and Goo Music present a free night of Indie
event.long_description: Substance and Goo Music present a free night of Indie General Bye Bye - 10.15pm “Still, the songs take on a particular lilt, the phrasing and syntax unusual enough to set tracks like “Alphabet” (”I give you L for Lullaby, I give you O for Oh my my, I give you V for Vanity, I give you E for you and me”) apart from the current deluge of indie-pop offerings. The simple sweetness of General Bye Bye’s songs are also a clue to the band’s accessibility, and what has inspired fans to fund the U.S. tour.” — Alli Marschall, MOUNTAIN X-PRESS Young Aviators 9.15pm Alternative / New Wave / Surf Megafauna - 8.15pm "The group has it all, wrapped in a small three-person-package, and it's weird and haunting and erratic and inspiring and wonky and frightening and wonderful all at once." — Cannibal Cheerleader "Neff’s fragile vocals may set you in a trance, but she’ll quickly jolt you back to life with the snap of her axe." — The Austinist "Remember the shock of seeing Jucifer for the first time? The adrenaline jolt of seeing lead singer Amber Valentine shred her guitar in a one-million-notes-a-second blast of power? If that experience is worth reliving, be sure to check out Austin’s Megafauna." — Flagpole Magazine "Neff pulls off several of the moves that eventually required Eddie Van Halen to undergo hand surgery. Will Krause and Cameron Page’s brimstone rhythm heed to solos that will melt the seals off seven scrolls." — San Antonio Current "Their songs are confident enough to take long detours through quiet sections before exploding in blood-curdling, burning-flesh guitar solos... One of the most original bands in Austin." — Big Western Flavor "Led by the smooth vocals and jagged edge of guitarist Dani Neff, their “Fun at the Apocalypse” and “Machines in the Sky” ride the wild rails of early 1990s Austin punk." — Austin Chronicle "Epic yet fiercely catchy." — The Deli Magazine More details at http://www.substancegigs.com/showdetails.php?sid=87&vid=&pa=3 Plus late DJ's A Substance venue, this newly opened intimate venue in the heart of London is 260 person capacity spread over 2 floors. The upstairs bar (110 capacity) combines a Bohemian look and style inspired by New York beat poets such as Jack Kerouac, is ideal for drinks before and after a show or after a hard day at work. While the basement venue (150 capacity) hosts some of London’s finest live music, comedy and club nights 7 days a week.

event.name: The War on Drugs + Alexander Tucker
event.artists: The War on Drugs, Alexander Tucker
event.tags: The War on Drugs, Alexander Tucker, Cargo, live music, East London
event.short_description: On their debut, the life-affirming Wagonwheel Blues, and the follow-up EP, Future Weather, Philly’s "The War on Drugs" seemed obsessed with disparate ideas, with building uncompromised rock monuments from pieces that may have seemed like odd pairs.
event.long_description: On their debut, the life-affirming Wagonwheel Blues, and the follow-up EP, Future Weather, Philly’s The War on Drugs seemed obsessed with disparate ideas, with building uncompromised rock monuments from pieces that may have seemed like odd pairs. Folk-rock marathons come damaged by drum machines. Electronic and instrumental reprises precede songs they’ve yet to play, and Dr. Seuss becomes lyrical motivation for bold futuristic visions. Now, Granduciel has done it again, better than before: Slave Ambient (Out Aug. 16), their proper second album, is a brilliant 47-minute sprawl of rock ‘n’ roll, conceptualized with a sense of adventure and captured with seasons of bravado. Doors 7:30 p.m. Tickets £7.50 + bf adv.

event.short_description: Tonights live performance is special because it is also the night Alex launches his debut album 'Serpent'. Alex is one of the UK's most in demand session players and has played with the likes of Jools Holland, Van Morrison and Paul Weller.
event.long_description: One of the most talented saxophonists in Britain, Alex Garnett is perhaps best known on the jazz scene for his superb work with Ray Gelato’s Giants, but can equally well be found in settings that range from Jools Holland to Van Morrison. To apply for a slot, e-mail brassroots@richmix.org.uk with your MySpace for more information.

event.name: The Animals & Friends: With the legendary Steve Cropper
event.artists: Steve Cropper, John Steel, Mick Gallagher, John E. Williamson, Peter Barton
event.tags: Animals, John Steel, Mick Gallagher, John Williamson, Peter Barton, Steve Cropper, Guitar
event.short_description: Following their multi-million selling anthem, House of the Rising Sun, The Animals acheived over twenty top ten records, many reaching Number One. After over forty years the legend still grows and the raw energy continues to burn in their souls.
event.long_description: Legendary musicians unite. Original Animals join ultimate forces with John Steel and Mick Gallagher (The Blockhead, The Clash, Paul McCartney), John E. Williamson (Titanic), Peter Barton (Wayne Fontana's Mindbenders, Boomtown Rats) and Steve Cropper of Booker T and the MGs. As Co-writer of (Sittin' On) the Dock of the Bay, Knock on Wood and In the Midnight Hour, Cropper's work is immortal. Ranked second only to Jimi Hendrix by Mojo Magazine as the number two guitarist of all time, his much anticipated new solo album features guest performers Lucinda Williams and Keb Mo.

event.name: Jazz @ The Cavern With Stan Sulzmann
event.artists: Stan Sulzmann, Marianne Windham, John Elliott, Tom Fyfe
event.tags: jazz in london, jazz in surrey, live music in godalming, live music in surrey, live music in guildford, live music in london
event.short_description: Stan Sulzmann is without question one of the most highly respected musicians in the UK today, admired by musicians and audiences for his instantly recognisable sound, and boundless creative imagination.
event.long_description: Stan Sulzmann is without question one of the most highly respected musicians in the UK today, admired by musicians and audiences for his instantly recognisable sound, and boundless creative imagination, and is a source of inspiration to many of Britain's emerging young musicians. His career stretches back to the 60’s when, as part of a uniquely talented crop of British musicians, he played with Graham Collier, John Taylor, Kenny Wheeler and Gordon Beck, as well as leading many groups of his own. His forty years in the business have seen him work with Gil Evans, Mike Gibbs, the New York Composers’ Orchestra, Michael Brecker and the NDR Big Band (alongside Chet Baker). Further musical partnerships have developed with British pianist Nikki Iles, American keyboard player Marc Copland and the trio Ordesa – a drumless, bassless combination with Kenny Wheeler and John Parricelli. A prolific and widely respected composer, his music can be heard in small and large ensemble settings alike, having written for the London Trombone Quartet, the London Jazz Orchestra, the Guildhall School of Music Jazz Orchestra and The European Jazz Ensemble. “An accomplished and distinguished composer…his music has been described in glowing terms 'ravishing, delicious, powerful and direct…meticulously written, sometimes echoing the imaginative and much missed orchestra of Michael Gibbs” The Guardian Joining Stan at the Cavern will be the trio of Marianne Windham (bass), John Elliott (keyboard) and Tom Fyfe (drums).

event.name: Jazz London - Antonio Forcione at Pizza Express
event.tags: Antonio forcione, Jazz, London, Music, Pizza Express
event.short_description: Jazz in London with Antonio Forcione at Pizza Express.
event.long_description: Join Antonio Forcione + special guests for a sneak preview of his new album ‘Sketches of Africa’. Inspired by recent travels to the Continent this is Antonio’s first new recording in five years. A beautifully captured concoction of world music with an emphasis on what African music does best: rhythm and melody. Antonio Forcione is a master of his game, not only as one of the great acoustic guitarists but globally respected for his compositions. This new album buzzes with originality, craftsmanship and passion. This is an album low on instrumental self-indulgence and packed with stunning melodies and toe-tapping beats such as the evocative Madiba's Jive, composed as a tribute to Mandela.

event.tags: Music, Theatre, Late Night, Bar, Inn, Drinks, Dinner, Show, What’s On, Night Out, London, Comedy Club, Live, Entertainment
event.short_description: The Josie Lawrence & Steve Edis Trio present "Some Songs Fast Some Slow"
event.long_description: Josie Lawrence and Steve Edis have been working together on and off since the 80's but only a few months ago decided to stop messing about and get serious about writing songs and creating a show - so now they are The Josie Lawrence & Steve Edis Trio! On the 15th Sept they will perform "Some Songs Fast Some Slow". Some songs are newly written and others are cover versions with a twist.Some will make you smile and some will make you shed a tear. In between they'll be a little chat from Josie and who knows just what she's gonna say. So there you have it - 14 songs in a fast paced and varied show plus a little help from a young chap called George. Josie and Steve would love you to be there - it's one thursday evening you will never forget. Book here: http://www.comedycafe.co.uk/index.php?id_page=274&id_gig=9421 Or Call on 020 7739 5706

event.name: Lily Neill
event.tags: Lily Neill, lily neill, harp, Harp, Camden, camden
event.short_description: Lily Neill presents an original musical blend of classical, jazz and folk traditions along with her own compositions for a performance that is truly unique.
event.long_description: Lily Neill - harp Doors open at 7pm, music begins at 7:30pm Loyalty Card Holdlers - this concert applies to our loyalty card scheme Lily Neill has performed around the world in cities as diverse as Dublin, Helsinki, Kazan, London, Moscow, New York City, Paris, Saint Petersburg, Vilnius and Washington, D.C. She has had the honour of performing for the former U.S. President Bill Clinton and for Ireland’s President Mary McAleese. Lily’s repertoire is a combination of original compositions and music from folk traditions and her appearances, from performances in concert halls and arts centres to shows at clubs and festivals, have allowed her to bring the harp to new audiences. In addition to her solo work, Lily has performed and recorded with rock, pop and folk groups including the Irish super group “The Chieftains” alongside the legendary Derek Bell. Critics have praised Lily’s superb technique as well as her musical versatility and the uniqueness of her musical style. Celtic Beat has written of Lily, “If ever a harper made a harp dance it is Lily Neill” and Irish Music Magazine called her work “...part of the new Harp revolution extolling aspects of harp music never previously heard”. Lily’s original compositions reflect her travels around the world. Her knowledge of the music of Ireland, the Nordic countries and beyond has helped to shape her universal sound. Lily has released two solo CDs, “Without Words” and “The Habit of a Foreign Sky” to strong acclaim. In a review of “The Habit of a Foreign Sky”, the Irish American News calls Lily one of the top harpers today and Irish Music Magazine writes, “The Habit of a Foreign Sky lives and breathes with a musical and artistic freedom which is boundless in its possibility and contagious in its energy and passion”.

event.name: Afterglow Electric featuring Flux
event.artists: Killa Kela , Ami Carmine , Flux , Aggi Dukes , Ash King
event.tags: Live Music, DJ, Rap, Hip Hop
event.short_description: Afterglow Electric builds on the unprecedented success of its acoustic sibling.
event.long_description: Afterglow Electric builds on the unprecedented success of its acoustic sibling. While Afterglow gave you the pleasures of an intimate and close up gig, Afterglow Electric will blow you away with full on never before heard sets from Ash King, Aggi Dukes, Flux and a very special guest. Killa Kela vs Ami Carmine (The Dual Project) Having toured all over the world Killa Kela is the most recognised and respected beatboxer in the industry. Killa Kela has released 3 full-length albums exploring genres far beyond beatbox and his talent has seen him tour the world and perform alongside the likes of Prince, Pharrell and N*E*R*D, Justin Timberlake, Super Furry Animals, De La Soul and Plan B. Killa Kela has now created a new live performance entitled The Dual Project which sees him spitting lyrics and battling it out with live DJ and vocalist, Ami Carmine (formally known as Ami Drum, lead vocalist for Bassment Jaxx). The mix of beatboxing and live vocals teamed with massive tunes from an array of genres excites audiences creating a combination that has something for everyone to enjoy. Flux With a well-earned reputation for making music that is intricate, beautiful and genre-defying, Flux are becoming one of London’s most exciting bands. Made of 6 members who all have flourishing individual careers, Flux are a band of cutting-edge quality. After a great year of performances at Glastonbury, Southbank Centre, The Great Escape and Indigo 02, Flux return to Rich Mix with their newest and unheard music. Aggi Dukes Aggi Dukes is quickly establishing himself as the hardest working genre-free songwriter, rapper and producer around. With performances at multiple festivals over the last two years including Secret Garden Party, Hip hop Kemp (Czech Republic) and Glastonbury 2011 and with collaborations alongside Chicane, Frankmusik, Killa Kela, Wiley, Westfunk, Chase and Status, and composer Shammi Pithia, Dukes comes back to Rich Mix to perform tracks off his debut album LEGACY which will be released late 2011. Ash King Ash King is one of the few singers that has enjoyed commercial success in the Indian film industry, middle Eastern and south Asian charts around the world. He most recently hit number 1 on Asian radio stations with the film song Te Amo and has sung major songs for musical giants A R Rahman and Prtiam as well as appearing on an official remix of Lady Gaga’s Just Dance. Tonight, with the support of his band, Ash King will be singing songs from the debut album he is currently recording. Flux Collective www.myspace.com/fluxcollective Shammi Pithia www.shammipithia.com Aggi Dukes www.aggidukes.co.uk Ash King www.myspace.com/ashkingmusic Killa Kela www.killakela.com

event.name: The 9th London African Music Festival
event.tags: Algeria, France, Music, Maghreb, Iness Mezel, world music, concert, world music promotion, southbank centre
event.short_description:
MOJO MAGAZINE 4**** David Hutcheon
« Mezel has both the vocal chops and the songs. »
THE GUARDIAN 4**** Robin Denselow
« Iness Mezel's French and north African fusion blues makes for an impressive set »
event.long_description: INESS MEZEL is a perfect modern fusion artist. French-Italian mother, Berber-Kabyle father she was raised in Both France and Algeria. From this wonderful cultural mix emerged a sharp musical mind coupled with a passionate vocal style. Her new Justin Adams produced record « Beyond the Trance » (Wrasse Records) is a fearlessly modern blend of North African Berber, soul, funk and R&B. Mark Hudson of the Telegraph referred to it as « a master class in visceral post-folk ». Tonight Iness Mezel and her band bring their North African and French fusion blues to London for her only UK show in 2011.

event.long_description: Mill Rythe Jump Jive & Boogie Weekend, Hayling Island Friday 16 - 19 September 2011, £169 pp half board. Mill Rythe is set in over 30 acres of grounds, with comfortable chalet accommodation starting at just £169 for 3 nights half board. The price includes a three course evening meal and full breakfast and has extensive leisure facilities, a large dance floor and a second room for late night sessions, practice sessions and additional dance classes. We've got a great line-up with Oo-Bop-Sh'Bam, Ricky Cool & The Hoola Boola Boys, Richie Milton & The Lowdown, The Zoltans. The Jivin' All Stars and The Piccadilly Bullfrogs plus dance classes, clothes and shoe stalls and late night DJ sessions in the fabulous late night venue Hudsons. Terry Elliott is MC/DJ for the weekend. Mill Rythe is now owned by Away Resorts, who are undertaking a major refurbishment of the venue. We liked it before, and now it is even better! There is no special code for this weekend, but don't forget to tell them you're from Boogaloo. To book ring Mill Rythe on 02392 460044

event.name: Halfway To New York
event.artists: Halfway To New York, Healer/Monster, Fly By Nature
event.tags: BBC 6 Music, Loud + Quiet, Artrocker, XFM, NME, The Stool Pigeon, The Quietus, Clash Magazine, Mojo, Drowned In Sound, Cargo, Shoreditch
event.short_description: London bands Halfway To New York and Healer/Monster launch their new singles with a co-headline show at Cargo.
event.long_description: Halfway To New York are quickly gaining notoriety on the indie music scene with their original mix of contemporary guitar driven rock, reminiscent of The Doves and Snow Patrol – with a slash of Stereophonics for good measure. Healer/Monster are three men unleashing their own musical Jekyll and Hyde onto the world. They are, to a man, the thinking person’s dumb ass rock and roll satyrs for the new nuclear age. The overall mood is reminiscent of the Pixies or a ballsier Pavement. Like all good bands though Healer/Monster cement their own style. The more one listens, the more reference points evaporate with such a prominent funk and psychedelic sound.

event.short_description: The founder of British Nu-Soul plays a rare gig at Hideaway, SW16. It's his only gig in the capital in September and he'll be playing hits from the 90s. The gig is to celebrate the re-release of album Sing (If You Want It) and new single Dancing.
event.long_description: Omar, the founder of nu-classic British soul, brings his vocal talents to the same stage as this hard-swinging quartet, whose last album featured a superb, soulful rendition of Stevie Wonder’s ‘Smile Please’. Hugely respected by fellow musicians around the world with Stevie Wonder proclaiming himself a fan, Omar has worked with the likes of Estelle, Common and, of course, Motown superstar Stevie Wonder himself! Together with Quentin Collins and Brandon Allen Quartet this promises to be an unmissable night. http://bit.ly/qyepra

event.name: The Bluetones Official Aftershow Party & Final Farewell
event.artists: Mark Morris, The Final Few, The Harlots, Honey Dog
event.tags: Indie, pop, rock, Mark Morris, The Final Few, The Harlots, Honey Dog
event.short_description: After a sold out farewell tour at the O2 Empire The Bluetones venture to Ginglik for the aftershow party featuring live acts, DJ’s & a rare DJ set from frontman Mark Morris. This is a chance to say goodbye in an unusually intimate setting.
event.long_description: After their sold out, farewell tour at Shepherds Bush Empire The Bluetones boys venture across the road to party at Ginglik. After 17 years of touring and 6 studio albums, they are the band responsible for music that defined the Brit Pop era. Their debut album impressively shot straight to number one – back in the days when that meant people, other than just family and friends, had bought it! The Bluetones legacy has almost spanned two decades and they have now decided it’s time to say goodbye. In the autumn the guys will tour the UK playing their last ever gigs, expecting and hoping to go out with a bang! The aftershow will feature live acts, DJ’s and a rare DJ performance from their frontman Mark Morris. This is a chance to rub shoulders with the guys, see them off, and say good bye in an unusually intimate setting. The Bluetones frontman Mark Morriss DJ set Mark will be playing a Britpop to modern day Indie set giving you guys a slight return to 90′s. Final Few An Indie/Blues outfit with an all out 70′s rock vibe. Destined for big things, fresh back from a recent support with Basement Jaxx. The Harlots A fresh new indie band with Beatle esque melodies and lots of energy. Honey Dog Acoustic tunes with gravelly vocals, backed by side guitar and interesting extras. Tickets www.ticketsource.co.uk/event/16603 www.ginglik.co.uk

event.name: 20th Century Foxes
event.tags: ’50s New York Clubs, golden age of glamour , swing music, Lindyhop dance
event.short_description: Back to the golden age of glamour and cool for an evening of lively cabaret that whisks you smoothly from smoky ’50s New York Clubs to ’60s Sunset Strip on the strains of swing music driven by a superb six-piece band and the finest crooners.
event.long_description: Take yourself back to the golden age of glamour and cool for an evening of lively cabaret that whisks you smoothly from smoky ’50s New York Clubs to ’60s Sunset Strip on the strains of swing music driven by a superb six-piece band and the finest crooners. Relax in vintage style with the Foxes' unique brand of laid-back, off-the-cuff humour and rousing musical performances that soar way beyond the ordinary. Expect Hollywood glitz with a soundtrack to match. Lindyhop dance sensations Hoppin’ Mad will get the whole joint jumping, and share a few moves with the uninitiated. Dress to impress, because there’ll be prizes for the best glad rags, as well as the most enthusiastic dancers. event.name: Ready the Horses
event.tags: Marama Cafe Band, Live music, Gypsy Hot Club Jazz, Romanian musicians, French musicians, Limehouse, Bar, Jamboree
event.short_description: Gypsy hot-club jazz, a mix of British, French and Romanian musicians
event.long_description: Gypsy hot-club jazz, a mix of British, French and Romanian musicians who started playing together in 2000 as accompanists for the Romanian singer Ileana Rozavlea. Since then they have developed their own style which includes modern and inventive interpretations of Gypsy Swing, French Café Music and Chanson and East European folk as well as original arrangements of Benny Goodman tunes and their own arrangements.

event.name: Afri-kokoa presents: FOKN Bois Live!
event.tags: Live music, Pidgen music, African music
event.short_description: AFRI-KOKOA presents FOKN Bois (Wanlov,M3nsa and DJ Edu (1 Xtra). When it comes to the Pidgen Music Super Duo known as the FOKN Bois, the two “h”s in Hiphop stand for “Humour” and “Hilarious”.
event.long_description: AFRI-KOKOA presents FOKN Bois (Wanlov,M3nsa and DJ Edu (1 Xtra). When it comes to the Pidgen Music Super Duo known as the FOKN Bois, the two “h”s in Hiphop stand for “Humour” and “Hilarious”. One half is Wanlov the Kubolor; the other half is M3NSA the Magnificent. Both recently MOBO nominated for “Best African Act”, the FOKN Bois are credited for creating the first Pidgen Musical film in the world dubbed “Coz Ov Moni” which has premiered to high patronage in Ghana the UK and the USA. The film itself premiered in the UK and the US, has been accepted at the Rio International Film Festival (Brazil), and at the Pan African Film Festivals in Los Angeles and Cannes. It was screened at the Black August Festival in New York, where M3NSA blessed the stage with Hip-hop icons Dead Prez and Talib Kweli. They are being compared to duos like Outkast, Redman & Method Man, Kid N Play and Aki & Porpor or Laurel & Hardy, but their fans know to expect anything from this insane super duo who balance lyrical skills with satire and sarcasm. Their style of Hiphop is raw, braggadocios, witty and eccentric. The FOKN Bois are currently working on their next album “FOKN Wit Ewe” which they claim they are making as politically incorrect as possible to lose all their fans and replace them with air conditioners. This is not an African thing...just do the FOKN thing! DJs: AJ Kwame (Afri-kokoa), Volta 45 (Afrospot) & Chief Commander Yaaba Playing a super funky selection of afrobeat, highlife, hiplife, afro-mashups….. Afro-Market: Kayobi clothing and T shirts (‘Make Fufu Not War’) Afri-kokoa www.afri-kokoa.com Afri-kokoa on Myspace www.myspace.com/afrikokoa

event.name: Introducing Kristina Lao at Caffe Concerto Westfield
event.artists: Kristina Lao, Angelo Mateus, Oliver Metcalfe, Daniel Benisty
event.tags: live, music, london, westfield, caffe, concerto, friday, september, west, guitar, piano, singer, songwriter, featured, guest, event, entertainment, culture, whats on , new, live, music, shepherds, bush, notting, hill
event.short_description: Daniel Benisty opens for the wildly talented lyrically gifted singer-songwriter that is Kristina Lao.
event.long_description: Daniel Benisty, resident pianist, host and musical director at Caffe Concerto, takes great pleasure to introduce some of London's brightest new song-writing and performing talent. Kristina Lao has been seeping into the veins of London’s live music scene since leaving her hometown of Hong Kong, where she launched her EP ‘Into the Woods with a Cardboard Box’. Her catchy, folk-pop infusions are inspired by the likes of Johnny Cash, Regina Spektor and the Moldy Peaches, culminating in mellifluous, moody melodies, quirky lyrics and sufficiently splendiferous storytelling. She will be playing with the wonderful Angelo Mateus (guitar) and Oliver Metcalfe (violin) at Caffe Concerto on the 16th of September, 2011.

event.name: White Wizzard & JETTBLACK @ The Underworld Camden
event.tags: Metal, Rock, Music, Hardcore, Live, Gig, Worlds End
event.short_description:
WHITE WIZZARD & JETTBLACK
White Wizzard hails from Los Angeles CA, formed to bring the songwriting, melody and good times back into metal and rock.
event.long_description: White Wizzard hails from Los Angeles CA. Tired of the same old down-tuned metal that seems to be everywhere these days, Jon Leon formed White Wizzard in the summer of 2007. The goal was simple – to bring the songwriting, melody and good times back into metal and rock. A 7 song EP was recorded in the fall of 2007 with the first line up and was well received and is about to be released worldwide. White Wizzard then released in early 2010 the album ‘Over the top’ with a changed line up.

event.tags: Jazz, Soul, Funk, Jools Holland
event.short_description: The vibrant and charismatic Derek Nash of the Jools Holland Orchestra leads the award-winning jazz ensemble Sax Appeal at Hideaway.
event.long_description: Derek Nash is equally at home leading the award-winning jazz ensemble Sax Appeal to Funky Heights, or swinging his way to a British Jazz Award for best CD of the year 2000 with Spike Robinson. He has appeared live and on TV with with many top performers including David Sanborn, Mavis Staples, Eric Clapton, Paul Carrack, Lulu, Tom Jones, Jamie Cullum, Will Young, Ruby Turner and Sam Brown. “Sax Appeal astounded me with their power and strong soloists; the band could be one of the biggest jazz/funk bands this country has ever produced.” Jazz News http://bit.ly/nK4ztd

event.name: One Night Of Queen
event.tags: Gary Mullen, One Night of Queen, Live Music, Tribute, The Alban Arena, Hertfordshire, The Works, St Albans
event.short_description: Gary Mullen & The Works Perform One Night Of Queen
event.long_description: Saturday 17 September 7.30pm In 2000, Gary Mullen won ITV’s “Stars In Their Eyes” Live Grand Final, with the largest number of votes ever received in the shows history. The record of 864,838 votes was more than twice that of the runner-up. Gary began touring on his own, and in 2002, formed a band, The Works, to pay tribute to the rock legends that are Queen. Since May 2002 Gary Mullen and The Works have performed in the UK, USA, Europe, South Africa and New Zealand to sell-out audiences. They have also twice rocked the prestigious BBC Proms in the Park, in front of a very enthusiastic crowd of 40,000. Gary Mullen and The Works perform One Night of Queen, a spectacular live concert, recreating the look, sound, pomp and showmanship of arguably the greatest rock band of all time. This show will ROCK you! http://www.garymullenandtheworks.com/
