event.name: Folk Set In Sandstone present Miriam Backhouse
event.tags: folk, acoustic, world,
event.costs: Miriam Backhouse £8, Campervan or caravan £5 per night
event.short_description: Mim's roots go back to the UK Folk Scene of the '70s when she was likened to Joan Baez, and ranked alongside Maddy Prior and other revivalists of the time. At Bickerton Village Hall Tickets www.cheshirefolk.com 01606 834969 or 077 900 82523
event.long_description: Mim's roots go back to the UK Folk Scene of the '70s when she was likened to Joan Baez, and ranked alongside Maddy Prior and other revivalists of the time before she emigrated to South Africa. Then, she played a significant role in the folk revival, appearing at most of the Folk Clubs and Festivals of the time, including Edinburgh and Cambridge, with acclaim from all the leading critics of the day. Miriam's interpretation of traditional and modern folk songs are unique, and her ability to lead a Folk audience into chorus singing, particularly, 'Keys of Canterbury' at Cambridge Folk Festival 1976, is the stuff of legends. UK Tour Sep-Dec, details and bookings lynne@amandalynnemusic.com tel 077 900 82523

event.name: London African Music Festival Feat. Yaaba Funk
event.tags: Live, ritzy, brixton
event.short_description: This multi-cultural Brixton-born band’s live shows have made them one of the must-see bands on the African Underground music circuit.
event.long_description: This multi-cultural Brixton-born band’s live shows have made them one of the must-see bands on the African Underground music circuit. Their fusion of Hi-Life & Afro-Funk is driven by fat analogue basslines, blazing horns and a mixture of sparkling African and gritty rock guitars. Punky Afro-roots music for the 21st Century. Upstairs at the Ritzy is the lovely bar and exciting venue above the Ritzy Cinema. We're open 7 nights a week and we pride ourselves on being a well-known & well-loved cultural hub for Brixton. Our stage show-cases a consistently high standard of live music, from Reggae, Afro-beat & Vintage-Swing, to World-Jazz, Folk, Blues, Balkan & beyond! Plus we bring a monthly comedy feast, open mic, performance, workshops & all sorts of exciting group activities. Full menu served all day till 8.30pm – so there’s eats to be had too! Follow us on Twitter: http://bit.ly/fi4bIz Add us on MySpace: http://mysp.ac/g3A3Egy

event.name: Numbi
event.tags: Live music, Cross-cultural, African Disapora, Somali
event.short_description: Art Film, Music & Spoken Word from the Diaspora NUMBI live shows are a series of cross-cultural events from the Diaspora.
event.long_description: Art Film, Music & Spoken Word from the Diaspora NUMBI live shows are a series of cross-cultural events from the Diaspora. The programme aims to bring a visible African Diaspora especially Somali cultural presence into London's landscape through collaborations and cultural dialogue. NUMBI will include music, spoken word, dance, visual arts and electronic media (Film) (this event will be the main Launch of 'Scarf' kudu arts cross cultural magazine) elements. NUMBI is influenced and inspired by traditional and contemporary Somali culture as well as the fusion of forms created by artists from the Somali diaspora and those collaborating with them. Much of the work will rely less on language, aiming to make NUMBI accessible to diverse participants and audiences. The elements of Somali and English spoken word will be based on common linguistic experiences of the Somali diaspora and we are very proud to have been working this year in partnership with the poetry translation centre who have translated the work of two very talented Somali poets to English and their work will be performed for the first time at this event. The principal artists include Faysal Aw-Cabdi and Caasha-Luul Maxamuud and many more. Music: DJ Nikki Lucas, DJ Oli Numbi music Jam featuring guests Macallow, The Seeds of Creation, Frends of Designe, Siemy Di Sestem. Mixed media, performance, visual artists: Max Boufathal, Nathalie Mba Bikoro, Kinsi Abdulleh. Kudu Arts kuduarts.org

event.name: Movimientos
event.artists: Wara (live), AJ Holmes and The Hackney Empire (Live), Fur (Live), DJ Cal Jader
event.tags: Latin, Tropical, High Life, Hip Hop , Funk, Hootananny, Movimientos, Wara
event.short_description: Movimientos inject a dose of Tropical and Latino vibes into Brixton’s Hootananny. Latin revolutionaries Wara, AJ Holmes and the Hackney Empire and Fur all live. DJ Cal Jader drops the freshest Latin beats and Tropical bass.
event.long_description: Movimientos @ Hootananny  Saturday 17th September Live acts: Wara + AJ Holmes and The Hackney Empire + Fur DJ: Cal Jader + guests  Free entry  8pm-3am  Hootananny Brixton  95 Effra Road, SW2 1DF  Tube: Brixton   Movimientos inject a dose of Tropical and Latino vibes into Brixton’s no.1 destination for roots and global live sounds. Cuban Funk and merged with London flavours from London's new Latin revolutionaries Wara. Slammin new electric high life, rumba and soukous from AJ Holmes and the Hackney Empire and Afro-dub influenced party Hip Hop from Fur. Plus DJ Cal Jader drops the freshest Latin beats and Tropical bass rhythms. Having played a packed summer season of festival shows and always jumping high profile London gigs Wara showcase material from their new EP on Movimientos Records which introduces the band with four tracks, musically merging Cuban Funk, Cumbia and Afro-Latin beats with Hip Hop, Jazz, Soul and even Dubstep and Drum and Bass. Wara have created a musical genre of their own with strong Cuban roots, taking influences from Timba (like Salsa but musically and lyrically stronger) and new bands feeding in fun and Afro Cuban styles... A true melting pot of identities, the band members live in London with backgrounds from all over the world, from Cuba, Argentina, Venezuela and Chile to Ghana, Congo, Spain and the UK. Fur play all live post-dilla conscious hip-hop with beats and instrumentals inspired and riding the west-african, west-jamaican and a bit of east (and west) london frequencies. And from the depths of Hackney come a band that are taking over the world with the unique Afro-pop sound of The New Electric High Life. They are A.J. Holmes & The Hackney Empire. This five-piece are destroying everywhere they play, the ultimate Afro party disco machine. http://www.movimientos.org.uk/ http://www.hootanannybrixton.co.uk/

event.name: Whirl-y-Gig Global Disco Launch Party
event.tags: Whirly
event.short_description: WHIRLYGIG Global Disco Launch Party DJ Monkey Pilot with a Classic Sound System Set with TRANSGLOBAL UNDERGROUND. The 4th CD release from Whirl-Y-Music.
event.long_description: Whirl-y-Gig embodies the spirit of community in a carnival atmosphere. Bathed in rainbow rippling lights and wrapped in exotic décor, it is a festival of delights for people of all ages and places. Dance to the Whirl-y-Beat and journey through Whirl-y-Gig's unique electronic landscape, where many diverse elements blend into one cohesive and unifying experience. From heavy dub and funky drum'n'bass to tropical house and uplifting tribal trance, the Whirl-y-Mix embraces flavours of global and celtic, classical and psychedelic, rock and even pop, roots and radical. Whether it be African or European, Arabic or Asian, Whirl-y-Gig finds inspiration from around the world, yet is rooted firmly in the here and now of London's alternative club scene. Whirl-y-Gig is an event difficult to describe and a moment difficult to miss. With a strong and loving life force, the Whirl-y-Sound is a musical heartbeat for a future global family.

event.name: Salsa Party - El Rumbon Cubano with Proyecto Viva Cuba
event.tags: Cuban salsa, Merengue, Mambo, Latin Fusion, Reggaeton
event.costs: £10 on the door (including dance class), £8 in advance (not including dance class)
event.short_description: Don’t miss this authentic Cuban night where you can dance the night away to top DJs playing the cream of Cuban salsa, timba & reggaeton & listen to the best of Cuba’s UK based musicians playing live. This month – the dynamic Proyecto Viva Cuba.
event.long_description: El Rumbon Cubano - one of London’s original Cuban salsa dance parties will return from its summer break on Sunday 18th September at Club Costa Dorada. An authentic Cuban night where you can dance the night away to top DJs playing the cream of Cuban salsa, timba, son & reggaeton and listen to some of the best of Cuba’s UK based musicians playing live. Now in its fourth year the party includes live music from Rene Alvarez’s new 5 piece band Proyecto Viva Cuba playing a unique repertoire of ‘salsa fusionada con merengue-mambo’ or salsa fusion with merengue-mambo. This energetic band director always lights up the stage with his performances - so don’t miss the chance to welcome the band to the next El Rumbon Cubano. DJ Javier will be on the decks playing an assortment of the best Cuban music including salsa, timba, and reggaeton. The Rumbon always features a dance class and in September Cuban dancer and member of the dance troupe CubanaDanza, David Martinez will be teaching one of his very popular salsaton classes. Be sure to get there early to guarantee a place! 7.30 pm – 8.30 pm. All levels welcome. Enjoy the warm, Cuban atmosphere at Nueva Costa Dorada, in the heart of London where delicious Spanish & Cuban food and great cocktails are available till late. Doors open 7 pm – till late. Advance tickets bookable via website registration or email to info@cubacheche.co.uk Club Nueva Costa Dorada 47-55 Hanway Street London W1T 1UX Tube – Tottenham Court Road – Central/Northern Lines Buses – 29,24,134,73,38,55,25,98,390,10,7,8 Please note Until 25th November Northern Line trains will not stop at Tottenham Court Road tube. Customers for the Northern line should use nearby Goodge Street or Leicester Square stations. Goodge Street (5 mins) or Oxford Circus on the Victoria line (8 mins). You can also use Holborn or Leicester Square (10 minute walk each) For further details ring: 020 8883 3610 or email info@cubacheche.co.uk

event.artists: Chris Farlowe & The Norman Beaker Band
event.tags: Chris Farlowe, Norman Beaker, Hand Bags, Glad Rags, Out Of Time
event.short_description: The Legendary blues man appears live at The Half Moon for a very special evening of Blues and Rock accompanied by The Norman Beaker Band. Performing all of his classics including "Out of Time", "handbags and Gladrags", "Stormy Monday" and many more.
event.long_description: Probably best remembered for his version of the Jagger-Richard composition 'Out Of Time' and 'Handbags And Gladrags', later being covered by Rod Stewart and The Stereophonics. In the 1970s he also sang in the hard rock supergroup Atomic Rooster. Chris will be performing with One of the top Blues bands in the North West, The Norman Beaker Band have been at the forefront of the UK blues scene for over 3 decades working with a who's who of Blues stars such as BB King, Buddy Guy, Alexis Korner, Jack Bruce, Van Morrison, Chuck Berry and many more.

event.long_description: His debut album "One" (basho records) features Seamus Blake on saxophone, Aaron Goldberg on piano and Orlando Le Fleming on bass. His new music has been described as "electric jazz with a modern feel", reflecting some of the influences Chris has had over the years playing with rock and pop artists, as well as his love for jazz. "up-to-the-minute and frighteningly accomplished" - The Observer

event.name: Memphis May Fire @ The Underworld Camden
event.artists: Memphis May Fire, The Color Morale, Dream Dreamer, Collapse The Control
event.tags: Rock, Band, Music, Metal, The Underworld, Camden, Worlds End
event.short_description:
Memphis May Fire + The Color Morale + Dream Dreamer + Collapse The Control
Memphis May Fire is a southern rock/post-hardcore band from Dallas, Texas, United States.
event.long_description: Memphis May Fire is a southern rock/post-hardcore band from Dallas, Texas, United States. The band formed in December 2006 as ‘O Captain, My Captain!’ In February of 2007, the band changed its name to Memphis May Fire. They soon recorded and self-released an EP, which caught the attention of Josh Grabelle, president of Trustkill Records, who commented that the EP was the most compelling EP he had heard since Welsh heavy metal band Bullet for My Valentine’s Hand of Blood. They were quickly signed to Trustkill who re-released their self-titled EP in December 2007. Though the band wanted their first studio album by summer of 2008, they soon had to postpone it due to the departure of their vocalist Chase Ryan, who left to care for his newborn child. Soon after, bassist Austin Radford too left the band. He was quickly replaced by Cory Elder and they began to record the instruments with producer Casey Bates. Matty Mullins was soon chosen as the new vocalist and was rushed to the studio to finish tracking vocals for their new album Sleepwallking. The album was released July 21, 2009 under Trustkill Records. The song “Ghost In the Mirror” was featured in the soundtrack for the movie Saw VI. Soon after, drummer Jeremy Grisham left the band and was replaced by Eric Molesworth. After the release of Sleepwalking, the band signed to Bullet Tooth Records and released their second EP Between the Lies on November 2, 2010. Their song “Action/Adventure” was featured in the video game Rock Band 3. Drummer Eric Molesworth then left the band and was replaced by Jake Garland. On January 17th, 2011, Rise Records announced that Memphis May Fire had signed to the label and was releasing an album in the spring. The album was recorded at Chango studios in Orlando, Florida, United States. Their second studio album, The Hollow was released on April 26th, 2011, on Rise Records.

event.name: Reggie Washington Trio
event.tags: Great Artist, Super Jazz Star, A Must See Event
event.short_description: Featuring: Gene Lake, Jef Lee Johnson & Reggie Washington. Three musicians who, besides the fact that they’re all three extremely talented virtuosi, have two other things in common: they are exceptionaly versatile and they count more musicians.
event.long_description: REGGIE WASHINGTON TRIO Here are three musicians who, in fact, need no further introduction. Three musicians who, besides the fact that they’re all three extremely talented virtuosi, have two other things in common: they are exceptionaly versatile and they count more musicians than non-musicians amongst their fans. For decades they have been too busy performing as sidemen with countless big names in studios as well as on all the biggest stages worldwide. Reggie Washington’s previous track record should speak for itself with over more than twenty years recording, collaborating and/or touring with Cassandra Wilson, Don Byron, Oliver Lake, Me’shell N'degeOcello, Ronnie Cuber, Lester Bowie, World Saxophone Quartet, Mike Mainieri & Steps Ahead, Will Smith, M-Base Collective, Ute Lemper, Jean-Paul Bourelly, Uri Caine and Cheick-Tidiane Seck plus performing at almost every jazz and music festival worldwide with artists such as Roy Hargrove, Branford Marsalis, Steve Coleman and Chico Hamilton just to name a few. Reggie was also a participant in Bass Day '97 in NYC with Oteil Burbridge, John Patitucci, Billy Sheehan & Tony Levin. Over the last 5 years, Reggie has eventually found enough time to expand his horizons as a leader. His debut CD "A Lot of Love, LIVE!" (Jammin’colorS) is comprised of two live trio concerts with saxophonist Ravi Coltrane and drummer Gene Lake and Belgian musicians saxophonist Erwin Vann and drummer Stéphane Galland. The CD has received very positive reviews internationally and accolades from journalists & colleagues worldwide in the music business. Jef Lee Johnson, claiming early influences as diverse as Herb Alpert, Eric Dolphy and Vanilla Fudge, is well-known as a session musician, playing for everyone from pop stars like Aretha Franklin and Billy Joel, to smooth jazz vocalists like Phyllis Hyman and Rachelle Ferrell, from pianist legend George Duke to fearless experimentalists like Ronald Shannon Jackson and McCoy Tyner. His solo albums, ranging from 1996's « Blue » to, more recently, « Longing Belonging Ongoing » (with his Aka Rainbow Crow project) are equally wide-ranging affairs, veering from straightforward pop songs to guitar-noise experiments that recall both Sonny Sharrock and Sonic Youth. Gene Lake, who is mostly heard as a jazz and funk drummer, has been playing for more than two decades with a stunningly diverse range of artists: from r&b group Surface in the 1980s to the “new wave” of r&b acts such as Me’shell NdegeOcello, Maxwell, and D’Angelo in the 1990s; from jazz innovators Steve Coleman and Henry Threadgill, to fusion legends Joe Zawinul and Marcus Miller; from jazz/rap group Opus Akoben to acts that are impossible to label, such as Dave Fiuczynski’s wildly original rock/funk/jazz fusion group Screaming Headless Torsos. Put these three musicians together and one can only guess what kind of music will result from this, but one thing’s for sure : their sonic trip will blow away every single member of the audience –musicians as well as non-musicians-, in an unforgettable way

event.name: 6 Billion Ways presents…
event.tags: Food system, Film, Asian Dub Foundation’s John Pandit , Live music
event.short_description:
Reclaiming our food system.
An evening exploring the idea of food sovereignty through short films, speakers and discussion, followed by DJ set by Asian Dub Foundation’s John Pandit.
event.long_description: Reclaiming our food system An evening exploring the idea of food sovereignty through short films, speakers and discussion, followed by DJ set by Asian Dub Foundation’s John Pandit. While 1 billion people go hungry, hundreds of thousands suffer obesity and food producers in rich and poor countries alike struggle to make a living. The global food system is dysfunctional – but there are solutions. Our evening will explore the idea of food sovereignty, a way of putting both people and the planet first, and challenging the corporate dominance that makes our food system so unsustainable. We’ll have four short films, interspersed with expert speakers and discussion. Then Asian Dub Foundation’s John Pandit will kick up some tunes while you dance, chat or find out about our latest global justice campaigns. 6 Billion Ways www.6billionways.org.uk Facebook: www.facebook.com/6billionways Twitter: @6billionways

event.name: Buddy Mondlock
event.tags: Buddy Mondlock, live music in london, live music in surrey, live music in guildford, live music in godalming, the farncombe cavern
event.short_description: Buddy Mondlock writes songs. He does it so well that some great songwriters have recorded them on their own albums; Guy Clark, Nanci Griffith and Janis Ian, to name a few.
event.long_description: Buddy Mondlock writes songs. He does it so well that some great songwriters have recorded them on their own albums; Guy Clark, Nanci Griffith and Janis Ian, to name a few. But there’s nothing quite like hearing the writer sing them. His third album, Poetic Justice, brought him to wider attention in the UK; Bob Harris began playing the album and he toured here for the first time. More recently he’s collaborated with the legendary Art Garfunkel, together with Maia Sharp, writing and recording the album Everything Waits to Be Noticed and touring all over America and Europe. Buddy’s out touring solo again, showcasing the songs as only he can. Look forward to a new album in 2011.

event.name: PD3 featuring Dick Pearce live at Hideaway, Streatham
event.artists: Peter Downes - Guitar, Dick Pearce - Trumpet, Andy Coe - Double Bass, Tim Bruce - Drums
event.tags: Jazz Fusion, Jazz, UK Jazz
event.short_description: Peter Downes, an incredible talent and one of Europe's leading jazz fusion guitarists teams up with Dick Pearce on trumpet, a musician who plays with a sophiticated command of harmonic improvising. This promises to be a night full of British talent.
event.long_description: Peter Downes is one of those incredible talents that only surfaces once in a blue moon. Completely self taught, he is rapidly becoming one of Europe’s leading guitarists in the modern jazz fusion genre. Already established on the jazz scene in the UK and Italy with a string of regular appearances culminating with a packed audience at Glastonbury Festival where they played the Jazz Lounge. Dick Pearce - A player with an equally formidable reputation completes the line-up. Pearce was notable for being the kind of straight ahead player who might well have appeared on the London jazz scene twenty years earlier. He has a sophisticated command of harmonic improvising, although, as with his self-confessed (and disparate) trumpet heroes - Chet Baker, Art Farmer and Don Cherry - his playing comes across as anything but contrived. http://bit.ly/q31g1b

Her music has evolved to become a fusion of folk with French, Reggae and Gypsy influences underpinned with heartfelt lyrics. Upstairs at the Ritzy is the lovely bar and exciting venue above the Ritzy Cinema. We're open 7 nights a week and we pride ourselves on being a well-known & well-loved cultural hub for Brixton. Our stage show-cases a consistently high standard of live music, from Reggae, Afro-beat & Vintage-Swing, to World-Jazz, Folk, Blues, Balkan & beyond! Plus we bring a monthly comedy feast, open mic, performance, workshops & all sorts of exciting group activities. Full menu served all day till 8.30pm – so there’s eats to be had too! Follow us on Twitter: http://bit.ly/fi4bIz Add us on MySpace: http://mysp.ac/g3A3Egy

event.name: Cole Stacey & Odi
event.tags: singer & songwriter, Acoustic Music
event.short_description: A writer of memorable melodies Cole performs live with Guitar ,Vocals & Piano & is almost always accompanied by one or two supremely talented multi-instrumentalists for his live shows.
event.long_description: Cole Stacey, hailing from Devon, is a singer & songwriter with a rapidly growing reputation across the UK Acoustic Music scene who has toured extensively in the last 18 months with headline shows nationwide. Having opened sell-out shows for Cara Dillon & Sam Lakeman, Steve Knightley, Martin Simpson & Chris Wood & performed live sessions for BBC Radio, his debut album ‘Changing Faces’ has been very well received bringing a full interview in ‘Acoustic Magazine’ (Dec Issue). Odi is an Irish singer/songwriter whose music combines folk, acoustic, pop, rock and indie. Cole Stacey A writer of memorable melodies Cole performs live with guitar ,vocals & piano & is almost always accompanied by one or two supremely talented multi-instrumentalists for his live shows. Currently very much in demand, Cole will be continuing to Tour throughout 2011 taking in major Festivals, venues & radio along the way whilst continuing to write songs inspired by the likes of Paul Simon, James Taylor & Jackson Browne. https://www.colestacey.net Odi Odi releases her debut album, Maslow's Songbook this summer. Recorded on location in Dingle, County Kerry and produced by Karl Odlum (Fionn Regan, Kila) the album features the magical violin playing of Com Mac Con Iomaire (The Frames/ Swell Season). Since playing her first gig four years ago, ODi has developed her craft in the live arena touring extensively and winning many fans across Ireland the UK and Europe. Along the way she has been invited to support the likes of Seth Lakeman, Eleanor McEvoy and Tom Baxter. Maslow‘s Songbook has been playlisted on Irish national radio RTE1 and is already a favourite of BBC Radio 2’s Bob Harris. ODi was also named in the top 3 Female Vocalists in the 2010 FATEA Magazine awards. ‘a lovely, lovely record’ Bob Harris BBC Radio 2 ‘Glorious vocals bring this stunning album to life’ **** Maverick https://www.odimusic.co.uk TICKETS http://www.chapelarts.org/events/?regevent_action=register&event_id=108&name_of_event=Cole+Stacey+&Odi WEBSITE http://www.chapelarts.org

event.name: KEY
event.artists: Brian Charette – Organ/keys, Bill Mudge – Organ/Keys, Chris Nickolls - Drums
event.tags: Live Music, Cool Music, Hoxton Shoredicht Live Music Jazz , Open till Late
event.short_description: KEY is the hot new collaboration between keyboardists Bill Mudge and Brian Charette. Both are accomplished Hammond Organists who also embrace the colour of electronics.
event.long_description: New York based Brian has recorded four albums as a leader for SteepleChase Records and performed with top artists like Joni Mitchell, Chaka Khan, and Lou Donaldson. Bill plays with with many London groups, including the Paul Jordanous Quintet, Mick Hanson's 'Organic Matters', and has performed recently at Ronnie Scott's with the Nigel Price Trio. His new album, 'Skylight' provides the framework for the group; funky organ groves with interesting electronic textures infused with exotic harmony from the middle east and contemporary classical music. Bill holds down the groove with the organ and bass pedals while Brian floats on top with an array of keyboards and effects - then they switch. Rounding out this keyboard power trio is one of the most in-demand drummers on the London jazz scene, Chris Nickolls. Chris leads his own critically acclaimed group 'The J Word' and plays regularly with many top London jazz acts.

event.name: Warrior Soul @ The Underworld Camden
event.tags: Rock, Live, Band, Show, Performance, Camden, Underworld, Worlds End
event.short_description: Through his band, Warrior Soul, the Detroit native concocted his own Stooges / MC5-style blend of political activism and art rock tendencies, gave it a ’90s spin, and tried to impart it upon Generation X (the kids, not the band)
event.long_description: Kory Clarke wanted to be the Iggy Pop of the ’90s. Through his band, Warrior Soul, the Detroit native concocted his own Stooges / MC5-style blend of political activism and art rock tendencies, gave it a ’90s spin, and tried to impart it upon Generation X (the kids, not the band), but they never listened. Their first album, 1990′s Last Decade, Dead Century, was a critical sensation, especially in the U.K., who readily embraced the band’s political invective and insurrectionist rantings as the next big thing. But while Clarke certainly had the potential to become Gen X’s leading mainstream-bashing poet, the metallic hard rock sound he chose as his vehicle ultimately lost out to Nirvana’s nihilistic post-punk/alternative style. 1991′s Drugs, God, and the New Republic took their anarchist leanings even further, but not even a nationwide stadium tour supporting Queensryche could help further their cause. Forgoing their overt political message, the band decided to charge forth with thunderous punk rock energy on their stellar 3rd album 1992’s Salutations From the Ghetto Nation. Geffen refused get behind the band, claiming that punk rock didn’t sell, Clarke was livid and months later stormed into the label’s offices with a copy of Rolling Stone magazine, the cover story feature Green Day and proclaiming the return of punk rock. Eventually, Clarke resorted to an all-out war, telling all who would listen that the release of 1993′s artistically striking Chill Pill had been purposely botched by Geffen in order to merely fulfill their contractual obligation, after which the band was promptly dropped by the label. Clarke then sought to reinvent Warrior Soul as self-appointed cyberpunks for their fifth album, 1995′s Space Age Playboys, released on the independent Futurist label before disbanding Warrior Soul later that year. This time around, there are no hidden meanings or agendas in the lyrics, they tell it how it is and call a spade a fucking shovel with equal parts of brutality and precision. Kory’s ever present gravely vocals makes the band unique and immediately identifiable. "Destroy The War Machine" is Warrior Soul’s first studio album in 14 years.

event.name: Alpha-ville Festival Opening Concert
event.tags: Live Music, Electro-acoustic , Polska Music , Deaf Center
event.short_description: Alpha-ville Festival opening concert presents an exclusive night with Polish electro-acoustic composer Jacaszek and Norwegian musician Svarte Greiner who is best known as one half of the duo Deaf Center.
event.long_description: Alpha-ville Festival opening concert presents an exclusive night with Polish electro-acoustic composer Jacaszek and Norwegian musician Svarte Greiner who is best known as one half of the duo Deaf Center. Jacaszek will perform with Ignacy Wisniewski (harpsichord) and Andrzej Wojciechowski (clarinet) while Svarte Greiner will present a very special Live AV show. This concert is supported by the Adam Mickiewicz Institute as part of the Polska Music grant programme and by the Polish Cultural Institute in London. Part of the 2011 Alpha-ville Festival of Post-Digital Culture. Alpha-ville is a London based non-profit organisation exploring the intersection between arts, technology and society. The organisation presents an annual festival that operates as an online and live platform for creativity, innovation and forward thinking. Running from 22-25 September, the 2011 edition presents social media and interactive art, open labs, meet-ups, talks, workshops, screenings, live music, AV performances and a one-day Symposium on Post-digital culture.

event.long_description: A night of pyche and nu-gaze bands featuring London's brightest new stars of the scene Lola Colt plus Horse Brothers who feature the former drummer from Adam & The Ants and Bow Wow Wow. Lola Colt somehow marry the best bits of louche Americana with shoegazing and deliver a sonic punch that is menacing and oozing with cool, imbued with the sounds of Link Wray and the Velvet Underground and Ennio Morricone. A tantalising cacophony of unfettered sexual energy.

event.name: Metamorphic
event.tags: Camden, camden, Metamorphic, metamorphic, Laura Cole, laura cole, Jazz, jazz folk
event.short_description: Laura Cole's contemporary jazz/folk sextet make their debut at The Forge
event.long_description: Doors open 7:30pm, music begins at 8pm Loyalty Card Holders - this concert does apply to our loyalty card scheme Metamorphic are a contemporary jazz/folk sextet based in London. Their debut album, The Rock Between, was released on the F-ire label in April 2011. The instrumentalists in the group all met while studying on the Jazz Degree at Middlesex University in London; vocalist Kerry Andrew became involved with the group through the promoter Moose Factory. Kerry also sings with the highly respected vocal trio Juice, who won second prize at the prestigious Tampere Vocal Festival in June 2007; alto sax player Chris Williams is also part of 2009 Mercury Prize nominated group Led Bib. Tenor/soprano sax player John Martin is a successful bandleader in his own right; his band The John Martin Quartet have a new album out on the F-ire label this May. Drummer Tom Greenhalgh also plays in the acclaimed group World Sanguine Report, led by Andrew Plummer, and double bass player Paul Sandy has worked with various groups such as Hey Negrita. BBC New Generation Artist Shabaka Hutchings guests on the title track of the album on bass clarinet. The composer and arranger of the music on the album, pianist Laura Cole, draws heavily on her experience of RSI as a musician, and the subsequent depression that she battled with as a result. Now fully recovered, The Rock Between is an attempt to chart this journey through music and words. The album is a collection of largely song-based emotional journeys, juxtaposing original material and arrangements of well-known pieces, and comprises of tightly composed writing offset by improvised passages. The background to this music also draws from an interest in textures, music in dreams and the translation of transformative emotional experiences through composition and performance.

event.name: Rise To Remain @ The Underworld Camden
event.artists: Rise To Remain, Bleed From Within, A Safety Fire
event.tags: Rock, Music, Metal, Hardcore, Metalcore, Live, Gig, Worlds End
event.short_description:
Rise To Remain
Plus: Bleed From Within A Safety Fire
Rise To Remain are a London-based 5 piece metal band.
event.long_description: Rise To Remain are a London-based 5 piece metal band. They were formed in late 2006/early 2007 by Ben Tovey, Will Homer and Austin Dickinson under the name “Halide” as a side project to several of the band’s members other endeavours in music. Within a few months the band solidified their line-up and began playing local shows as well as travelling across the UK, seeking out shows. Halide recorded two EP’s, both of which saw a viral release through their Myspace, which eventually garnered attention from more legitimate local promoters, who granted the band further exposure by putting the band on at slightly higher profile shows. This opportunity lead to the band changing members and their name, switching from Halide, to Rise To Remain. Since then the band has been at its most active, and have toured with the likes of Shadows Fall, Five Finger Death Punch, The Haunted and Trivium, as well as appearing at Sonisphere Festival and Download Festival. On 14 June 2010, Rise to Remain were given the Metal Hammer Golden God Award, for “Best New Band, an award that was voted for by over 400,000 people across the globe.” The band has also been voted in to the shortlist for “Best British Newcomer” at the Kerrang! Awards. Recently signed to EMI.

event.name: Sarah Jane Morris Live
event.artists: Sarah Jane Morris, Kevin Armstrong, Martyn Barker, Alastair Gavin, Tony Remy, Henry Thomas
event.tags: Sarah Jane Morris , Live music, mass, brixton, gigs
event.short_description: Sarah Jane Morris Live
event.long_description: "Leave your preconceptions at home," begins one critic's assessment of sensual singer-songwriter Sarah Jane Morris, who straddles blues, rock, jazz and soul with a goosebump-raising four octave range that rumbles from the heels of her size nine shoes to the tips of her flame-red mane. Famed for her association with the Communards in the mid-80s and infamous for her banned cult rendition of the classic 'Me and Mrs Jones', Sarah Jane Morris has always attracted as much attention for her outspoken politics as for her soul-driven, seismic voice. Seven solo albums later, pop stardom on the continent, and a diverse set of musical collaborations on record, film and stage, Morris continues to steer her unorthodox career to greater heights. Some hear Sarah Vaughan or Billie Holliday in her voice, others cite Macy Gray and Erykah Badu, although Morris herself likes to say: "Nina Simone meets Janis Joplin." Yet always her own woman, Sarah Jane Morris is a truly independent spirit with a stunningly expressive voice who's been making exciting music for twenty-five years. Sarah Jane has recently released a stunning co-written and co-produced album entitled “Where it hurts”. The tracks are co-written with Dominic Miller (Sting’s right hand man and co-writer of ‘Shape My Heart’) and Martyn Barker (Billy Bragg and The Blokes). The Album was launched at Ronnie Scotts (London) and Blue Note (Milan). Her one woman show was previewed at the Edinburgh Festival to rave reviews in August, also called 'Where It Hurts' which is co-written with Michael Crompton (Silent Witness ) with Dominic Miller accompanying on guitar. This show is now touring the UK theatres and Arts Centres. It includes stories and songs from her childhood through to her collaboration on the song ‘Coal Not Dole’ with Matt Fox (Happy End) and Kay Sutcliffe (a Kent Miners wife) for the miners strike, The Communards, nearly playing the part of Janis Joplin in the Paramount movie and beyond. Sarah Jane has just finished recording an incredible album live with 14 Cellos, nylon string guitar and voice which is going to be launched at the Auditorium in Rome this Summer.

event.name: Albert Ball's Flying Aces
event.artists: Albert Ball's Flying Aces, MEMBERS: Nicholas D. Ball - Drums/Spoons/Vocals, Simon Marsh - Reeds, Miss Ellie Smith - Trombone/Spoons/Whistling, Jonathan Butterfield - Piano, Matthew Redman - Banjo/Guitar, Dickie Evans - Sousaphone
event.tags: Albert Ball's at The Forge, albert ball's forge, forge camden ragtime, 1910 jazz and blues, ragtime, forge blues jazz, Albert Ball's Camden
event.short_description: Albert Ball's Flying Aces perform a wide repertoire from naive 1910s pop songs, early ragtime, jazz and blues, to exotic dance numbers and laments
event.long_description: Performance details: Doors open at 7pm for diners, music starts at 8pm Albert Ball’s Flying Aces was originally formed in 1916 by the aviators of 266 Squadron RFC. To relieve the stress and horror of their daily aerial dog-fights high above the trenches, they used to gather in the evenings to play then-popular music on whatever instruments they could find, naming themselves after a famous airman of the time. Having settled in Paris following the 1918 Armistice, they now use their music and their wartime experiences to try to bring peace and understanding to a 1920s world, performing a wide repertoire ranging through naive 1910s pop songs, very early ragtime, jazz and blues, French and German polkas and chansons, exotic dance numbers and laments, Great War propaganda songs, music hall rabble-rousers and sentimental ballads - music which epitomises the spirit of that lost generation, resolutely jaunty and upbeat in the face of terrible loss and adversity... Dine with this event? There are a limited number of tables available for dining during this event. Purchasing a ticket for the music does not automatically reserve a table to dine. To book a table, please ring Caponata Restaurant on 020 7387 5959 or click here Please note that you MUST book tickets in advance for this event if you are booking a table to dine. It is possible to dine during this performance. Diners and non-diners welcome contact@forgevenue.org

event.name: Around The Decades: 1950's feat The Piccadilly Bullfrogs
event.artists: The Piccadilly Bullfrogs, Voola and the Jayhawks
event.tags: live music, 1950s, ritzy, brixton
event.short_description: Sputnik is in orbit, passenger jets are a bit ropey, but kinda ready, Chuck Berry is setting up the guitar solo for Marty McFly and we made it through WWII…hurrah!
event.long_description: So, it’s time to celebrate our victory in style hepcats. Your pants best be tight and your hair best be defying the laws of gravity. Rock ‘n’ Roll has landed, and if you ain’t sweatin’ it, you ain’t gettin’ it. Vintage rockers have never come as energised as THE PICCADILLY BULLFROGS, and they leave no choice but to jive-it-up, like crazy twistin' tadpoles. Lovingly hand crafted from only the finest vintage components, this may be a small band, but it has a powerful, compelling sound - and a remarkable pedigree. 1950s Memphis Rock’nRoll is coming thick & fast on what is destined to be a night of heated hip swinging mayhem, kickin’ off with the explosive VOOLA & THE JAYHAWKS. Screamin’ Jay Hawkins himself would be proud to be backed by this musically-endowed get-up. The 1950s are upon us. Be ready. Upstairs at the Ritzy is the lovely bar and exciting venue above the Ritzy Cinema. We're open 7 nights a week and we pride ourselves on being a well-known & well-loved cultural hub for Brixton. Our stage show-cases a consistently high standard of live music, from Reggae, Afro-beat & Vintage-Swing, to World-Jazz, Folk, Blues, Balkan & beyond! Plus we bring a monthly comedy feast, open mic, performance, workshops & all sorts of exciting group activities. Full menu served all day till 8.30pm – so there’s eats to be had too! event.name: Denys Baptiste Quartet
event.tags: Jazz, Denys Baptiste, Black British Jazz, Improvisation, Swing
event.costs: £12 , Concessions: £10, Under 19s free with an accompanying adult
event.short_description: The multi award-winning saxophonist and his superb quartet of Gary Crosby, Andrew McCormack and Rod Youngs perform an energetic and eclectic collection of new repertoire from the recent album release Identity By Subtraction
event.long_description: Born in Hounslow, West London of St Lucian parents in 1969, Denys Baptiste is an award-winning jazz artist, composer and educator. An outstanding saxophonist of international acclaim, Denys is renowned for his ability to make complex music accessible, creating mature, melodic, and highly memorable compositions that lodge in the memory on first hearing. Be Where You Are – his 1999 debut album on independent jazz label, Dune Records – earned him a Mercury Music Prize for An Album Of The Year and a MOBO award for Best Jazz Act. He followed this in 2001 with his second album, Alternating Currents (Dune Records DUNECD05) also receiving great critical acclaim. 2003 saw the release of his third, and most ambitious, recording/touring project to date: Let Freedom Ring! (Dune Records DUNECD010), an inspirational, uplifting suite combining contemporary jazz, gospel, blues, and Afro-Cuban music with extracts of the epic poem, Mental Fight by Booker Prize-winning author, Ben Okri who narrates on this piece. Commissioned by the Cheltenham Jazz Festival/Jerwood Foundation, Let Freedom Ring! commemorated the 40th anniversary of the historic ‘I Have A Dream’ oration by American black civil rights activist, Dr Martin Luther King and was nominated for Best Album and Best New Work in the BBC Jazz Awards, for Best Jazz Act in the MOBO (Music Of Black Origin) Awards and Best Album in the UK Parliamentary Jazz Awards. Identity By Subtraction is Baptiste’s latest studio recording first released in December 2010 with a CD release in January 2011, and is a collage of thoughts and improvisations that together create an image that represent the artist's responses to life's experience as a black man of Caribbean descent playing jazz music in the UK today. This is his first release in quartet format since his Mercury-nominated debut, Be Where You Are, and alongside him on tenor and soprano saxophone are pianist Andrew McCormack, double bassist Gary Crosby and drummer Rod Youngs. Awards: Mercury Music Prize - Album of The Year 1999, MOBO Awards - Best Jazz Act 1999, British Jazz Awards - Rising Star 2000 Nominations: BBC Jazz Awards - Best Album 2004, BBC Jazz Awards - Best New Work 2004, MOBO Awards - Best Jazz Act 2004, Parliamentary Jazz Awards - Best Album 2004

event.name: Sarabeth Tucek & Urusen
event.tags: folk, Bath, British indie-folk , Live music
event.short_description: A very special double-headline night of music with two rapidly upcoming acts, one homegrown and one from the other side of the Atlantic, both promoting new singles. Impress your friends by saying you were here!
event.long_description: SARABETH TUCEK Brooklyn-based singer Sarabeth Tucek comes to Bath with her hauntingly beautiful dusky, desert folk. Influenced by Dylan and Cat Stevens, her singing voice has been compared to Karen Carpenter and her style to Cat Power and Neil Young. Her first single, “Something For You”, became single of the week twice on Steve Lamacq’s influential BBC radio show, and was also famously covered by The Brian Jonestown Massacre. Produced by Ethan Johns (Kings Of Leon) and Luther Russell (Richmond Fontaine, Noah & The Whale), her eponymous debut album received rapturous reviews, leading to shows with Bob Dylan himself. Sarabeth comes to Bath as part of her UK tour promoting her “luminescent” (NME) second album, also produced by Luther Russell, and fresh of the back of releasing her new single ‘Smile for no one’ via Sonic Cathedral Recordings. www.sarabethtucek.wordpress.com www.facebook.com/sarabethtucek “Something for you – the most beautiful single of the year” - NME “All hail the new queen of folky torchsong” - MOJO “Amazingly accomplished” – Sunday Times URUSEN Returning to their roots in Bath for this single release tour, Urusen are a band beginning to make waves on the UK music scene. Described as one of BBC Introducing’s festival highlights, and predicted by the music industries magazine Music Week as “destined to make an impact” Urusen combine the best of the current British indie-folk with great contemporary American bands like Midlake and The National, as they shift effortlessly between something intrinsically English, yet akin to the epic Midwest. With an eclectic array of mostly acoustic instruments and a lyrical, story-telling signature to their songs, Urusen’s gigs will take you on an epic music journey. The band were spotted in 2010 by renowned UK producer Steve Osborne (KT Tunstall, Elbow, Cat’s Eyes) and have since recorded an album at Peter Gabriel’s Realworld Studios. This event marks their first single release from this forthcoming album, and a very limited edition double A-side vinyl will be available to buy, as well as a free download from their website. www.urusen.co.uk www.facebook.com/urusen “One to watch” - The Metro “Great act, a stunning show” - James Shepard, Festival Director, Larmer Tree “Alongside Stornorway, my favorite act on the Avalon Café Stage. Great music, the crowds loved them, and surely only a matter of time until they are on Jules Holland” - Lisa Pickering, Avalon Stage Coordinator, Glastonbury Festival TICKETS http://www.chapelarts.org/events/?regevent_action=register&event_id=122&name_of_event=Sarabeth+Tucek+&Urusen___support WEBSITE http://www.chapelarts.org/

event.short_description: Slipnot are the most ultimate Tribute to Slipknot in Europe. This professional 9 Peice Band started in 2006 touring the UK from top to bottom bringing all the Slipknot Maggots Closer.
event.long_description: Outdoor Heated Pavillion BBQ DJs Shot Girls Drink Offers Jagerbomb £2.05 fisk Shot £1 Revolver is situated near the heart of Birkenhead on The Wirral. This grand building has enough space for 3 stages and 5 music zones; including a smoking area consisting of a large heated outdoor pavillion. It also has Accomodation and free parking available. Revolver is the Premier live music venue on The Wirral. It prides itself on providing high quality tribute acts of all varieties; including rock, metal, punk, indie, soul and even disco; and also on showcasing original and local talent. Although Revolver has always given opportunities to local bands, they have recently teamed up with 7Waves Radio station and also the Vendetta Records Label, and host a monthly event dedicated to the showcasing and promotion of original talent. Revolver also prides itself on the quality and variety of drinks available; from a wide choice of international beers, both bottled and on draught, to a selection of bourbons and rums. And if youre not fussy about your tipple there are always drink offers available! Whether you are looking to dance, chill, rock out or just listen to some great live music, you'll find yourself at home here.

event.name: The Monto Presents: Bruce Lok
event.artists: Bruce Lok, Shura, Hiatus, Candytree, Sunday Night Club, 308, Mercury Rising
event.tags: The Monto, Bruce Lok, Cargo, East London, live music, Candytree, Shura, Hiatus
event.short_description: This band finally formed into Bruce LOK in 2010. According to Bruce, the name “Bruce LOK” came from “John Locke” and lead singer used Locke’s theories of mind as he was questioning life and was finding difficulty of knowing who he was as an artist
event.long_description: In 2009, at age 20, vocalist Mitchell Bruce moved to London where he met manager Rebecca Pink-Hayes while he was attending a private school. Shortly after arriving, he began taking vocal lessons with Nick Charters. Prior to forming Bruce Lok, Bruce and the lead guitarist were both in separate bands, one listed as the Gina Sykes project and Mitchell Bruce was in a experimental rock and metal band as a solo artist . The band eventually formed in 2010 as Bruce LOK. According to Bruce, the name “Bruce LOK” came from “John Locke” and lead singer used Locke’s theories of mind as he was questioning life and was finding difficulty of knowing who he was as an artist which came in to play with John Locke’s origin of modern conceptions of identity and the self , he then experimented with abstract and alternative and experimental music to portray Locke’s continuity of consciousness and wanted to convey the idea that the mind was a blank state or tabula rasa having the idea that music and knowledge is instead determined only by experience and derived from sense perceptions. Over the following year , Bruce LOK performed at various venue Inside of greater london area . Bruce lok are currently in the process of recording there official album with producer John Henry Poole (Cinematic orchestra, Jack Panate, ladyhawke). Members: Mitchell Bruce: Lead Vocals and Keyboard, Tom Eatherton: Backing vocals and Lead guitar, Daniel Voysey: Rhythm Guitar, Joey Rossi: Bass, Reuben Humphries: Drums, Elliot Lyte: Violin, Mikey Cooper: Viola, Sophie English: Cello With Guests: SHURA // HIATUS , Candytree, Sunday Night Club, 308, Mercury Rising Doors: 6:30 p.m. Tickets: £8 on the door

event.name: Claire Martin & Richard Bennett
event.tags: The Irving Berlin songbook, Let’s face the Music and Dance
event.short_description: Claire Martin & Richard Rodney Bennett - 'The Irving Berlin songbook.' One of the foremost jazz singers of her generation and the legendary classical and screen composer have played to packed houses and rave reviews in New York & London.
event.long_description: Claire Martin & Richard Rodney Bennett, ‘A couple of swells - The Irving Berlin songbook.' The long running partnership of one of the foremost jazz singers of her generation and the legendary classical and screen composer have played to packed houses and rave reviews in New York, London and elsewhere since 2000.... Claire and Richard both share a great love of the American composer and lyricist Irving Berlin, widely considered to be one of the greatest songwriters of all time. Berlin wrote hundreds of songs, many becoming major hits, which made him a legend before he turned thirty. This brand new show, with classy arrangements by Richard, will include such classics as ‘Let’s face the Music and Dance’, ‘How deep is the Ocean’, ‘What’ll I do?’, ‘Cheek to Cheek’ and ‘Let yourself go’, all delivered with the style and panache that you would expect from these two great friends and world-class artists. ’World-class’ The Times ‘Style does not go out of style’ The Daily Telegraph ‘A class act’ Jazz UK ‘A voice of pure quality’ The Sunday Times TICKETS http://www.chapelarts.org/events/?regevent_action=register&event_id=23&name_of_event=Claire+Martin+&Richard_Bennett_sing_Irving_Berlin WEBSITE http://www.chapelarts.org

event.name: 4 Poofs and a Piano: Back in Business
event.artists: 4 Poofs and a Piano, Ian Parkin, Stephen De Martin, David Roper, David Wickenden
event.tags: 4 Poofs and a Piano, cabaret, gay men
event.short_description: After three sell-out successes at the Edinburgh Festival and direct from their 60-date UK tour 'More hairdresser than barbershop', 4 Poofs and a Piano are making a welcome return to the stage with a brand-new show entitled Back in Business.
event.long_description: Presented by Sam Joseph After three sell-out successes at the Edinburgh Festival and direct from their 60-date UK tour 'More hairdresser than barbershop', 4 Poofs and a Piano - Ian Parkin, Stephen De Martin, David Roper and David Wickenden - are making a welcome return to the stage with a brand-new show entitled Back in Business. Having filmed 16 series as the house band on the BBC, BAFTA and comedy award-winning Friday Night with Jonathan Ross, 4 Poofs and their piano have introduced guests ranging from Meryl Streep, Lionel Richie and Tom Jones to Will Young, Tom Hanks and John Travolta. They sang with Neil Diamond on ITV's An Audience with Neil Diamond and also with Jimmy Osmond on Richard and Judy’s New Position. In December 2005 they released their first CD Screaming Party Anthems with Virgin EMI and make regular appearances at the world-famous Glastonbury Festival. In this fabulous new show the famous foursome are back with another helping of frisky footwork and musical madness. Back in Business sees the boys returning with their popular brand of irreverent humour together with lush harmonies. "Fun, outrageous and rarely in the best possible taste" "There could be five poofs and two pianos soon" Elton John "Great band" Enrique Iglesias "Very impressive" Anastasia "These boys have enough panache to fill an entire jewel box... innovative, funny, genuine talent... don't miss" The Scotsman "Riotous exuberance of this standard comes but once a year" The Scotsman "Has you crossing your legs with delight" Mail on Sunday

event.name: Keys and Coffee Concert Series - Consortium 5
event.tags: Keys & Coffee, Forge Coffee, Keys, camden , camden forge, forge, north london forge
event.costs: £9.00/£7.00 online £10.00/£8.00 on the door (includes tea & coffee)
event.short_description: Award-winning all-girl recorder group return to The Forge!
event.long_description: This concert runs from 11am-12pm with no interval Tea and coffee will be available in the glazed courtyard from 10:30-11:00am Brunch after the concert at Caponata?...(see details below) It is not possible to dine during this event Programme: Fantasia No.3 (John Ward (1589-1638)) 'The Image of Melancholy’ Pavan (Anthony Holborne (1545 - 1602)) Fairie Round Tangled Pipes (Richard Lannoy) Dots (Kim Ashton) Fantasia in F (Giovanni Coperario (1570 - 1626)) Galliard (Augustine Bassano (? - 1604)) The Honeysuckle (Anthony Holborne (1545 - 1602)) Galliard (Anthony Holborne) Coranto (William Brade (1560 – 1630)) In Nomine a 5, (William Byrd (1540 - 1623)) Consortium5 Biography Consortium5 formed in 2005 when its founding members were students at the Royal Academy of Music. They have since established themselves as one of the foremost recorder consorts of their generation, and an ensemble of unique appeal to a wide range of audiences. Founded out of a shared love of consort music and recorders, Consortium have performed in Europe and the UK at major festivals and concert series. In 2010 they recorded their debut album on the Nonclassical Label, voted the best album of 2010 by Chicago Time Out. Working with composers has formed a central part of Consortium5's activity over the past four years, and this album features works commissioned especially for and by the group. A recent review from the influential blog Sequenza21 concludes that the album ‘suggests a new frontier for chamber ensembles’. Winners of numerous prizes and awards, Consortium5 made their Purcell Room debut in 2009 as part of the Park Lane Group Young Artists Series. In 2007-2009 they were Joan Greenfield Junior Fellows at Trinity College of Music and in 2006 they were awarded the Deutsche Bank Pyramid Award for performance, a prize that allowed them to invest in a set of 10 matching consort instruments. Equally committed to performance on the concert platform and in the community, Consortium5 spent several years resident on the Live Music Now scheme, and have performed numerous concerts for London based music services, reaching over 7000 children, many of whom had never attended a professional music concert before. Since forming, Consortium5 have combined historically informed and contemporary performance to great effect in both concerts and educational work. Consortium5 enjoy working closely with composers throughout the composition process and it has been their great delight to discover the fascination these instruments hold for composers and the richness and variety with which their language speaks through the consort. Consortium5 are particularly interested in the bridges that these compositions build; new consorts from the archaic consort form, new works for ancient instruments, a contemporary dimension to the recorder that concentrates without compromise on both its simplicity and its myriad complexities. Dine at Caponata....... Please ring 02073875959 to book a table or click here. Please note that it is not possible to dine during this performance..

event.name: Errol Linton
event.artists: Errol Linton, Adam Blake, Neal Charles , Kenrick Rowe
event.tags: Live music, Blues, Errol Linton, Errol and Co.
event.short_description:
Errol Linton is a harmonica player and vocalist.
"A friend sold me a harmonica, I picked it up one day, started blowing on it, never stopped," says Linton. "The harmonica lead me to the blues."
event.long_description: In 1991 a chance meeting with John Walters, BBC Radio 2 producer led to a radio session on the Andy Kershaw Show and in 1993 Errol was featured along side Big Bill Broonzy in BBC 2’s Arena documentary (Rhythms of the World) called Two Generations of the Blues. Linton released his first album Vibin’ It (Ruby Records) in 1998. Across the UK BBC Radio DJs Charlie Gillett, Paul Jones, John Peel and Andy Kershaw all played the album. In 2001 Linton returned to the studio to cut Roots Stew (Ruby Records). Roots Stew shows Errol’s song writing developing alongside the band’s organic blues-reggae groove. You can hear Linton’s harmonica on Channel 4’s documentary ’Mr. Rock and Roll’ Transglobal Underground albums ‘Rejoice Rejoice’ (Nations Records 1998) and ‘Yes Boss Food Corner’ (Ark 1 Records 2001) double CD compilation Beyond Mississippi (Manteca 2002) and Abram Wilson’s album Ride! Ferris Wheel To The Modern Day Delta’ (Dune Records 2007). Live, Errol and Co. play with a ragged, fluid grace. The Band constitute guitarist Adam Blake, bass player Neal Charles and drummer Kenrick Rowe. Lead by Linton they create an urban sound with rural roots. Some songs are tough rockers designed to get crowds dancing. Others have a soulful ska and reggae vibe his songs have a slangy, street poetry that stick in your head, long after they finish. Linton’s has opened the show for Screaming Jay Hawkins, Bo Diddley, Dr John and Blind Boys of Alabama. Linton’s new material ’Mama Said’ has contributions from noted New Orleans trumpeter Abram Wilson and Serb pianist Pete Zivkovic. The resulting songs range from ‘Stressed Out’ – a blues every Londoner can relate to – to the beautiful acoustic reflections of ‘Roll On Tomorrow’. On these recordings Linton demonstrates how his song writing has matured into a remarkable original vision.

event.name: Philharmonia Orchestra / Brahms Violin Concerto in D
event.artists: Esa-Pekka Salonen - conductor, Viktoria Mullova - violin, Monica Groop - mezzo-soprano, Jukka Rasilainen - bass-baritone, Orphei Drängar
event.tags: classical
event.short_description: Esa-Pekka Salonen opens the Philharmonia's 2011/12 season with Sibelius's epic and rarely-performed 'choral symphony' Kullervo, followed by Johannes Brahms' Violin Concerto in D.
event.long_description: Esa-Pekka Salonen opens the Philharmonia's 2011/12 season with Sibelius's epic and rarely-performed 'choral symphony' Kullervo. Sibelius's epic 'choral symphony' Kullervo was written some eight years before his conventional First Symphony, when the composer was just 27 years old. Its five movements depict the exploits of the hero of the great Finnish mythic poem, the Kalevala, and chronicle different parts of his complex, tragic personality and of his life, including his childhood in slavery, his seduction of his own sister and his atonement on the battlefield for her subsequent suicide. Scored for male chorus, soloists and orchestra, this is an extraordinary piece of choral writing of dramatic power, rarely heard in the concert hall due to its sheer size and scale. FREE Pre-concert recital by Orphei Dränger in the Royal Festival Hall at 6pm. Ticket link: http://ticketing.southbankcentre.co.uk/find/music/classical/tickets/philharmonia-orchestra-56421 For more details, visit our website http://www.southbankcentre.co.uk/

event.short_description: Conor Owen is an exciting maturing UK singer songwriter who combines an acoustic melodic style with a powerful lyrical prowess. This is show celebrates the launch of ‘The Observationalist’ – his debut solo album.
event.long_description: Conor Owen is an exciting maturing UK singer songwriter who combines an acoustic melodic style with a powerful lyrical prowess. The singer’s key influences are both contemporary and classic including John Martyn, Damien Rice, Nick Drake and Ray LaMontagne – and this is the launch show for his debut single ‘There’s Only You’. Conor follows this with the release of ‘The Observationalist’ – his debut solo album. The album is an honest and heart felt interpretation of life, family and relationships as Conor sees them. The album has a distinctly anthemic feel to it featuring lavish string sections in songs such as ’Softly Softly’ and ‘There’s Only You’.

event.name: The Dead Lay Waiting @ The Underworld Camden
event.artists: The Dead Lay Waiting, Silent Descent, Death Of A Salesman, Fall To The Frontline
event.tags: Metal, Music, Rock, Hardcore, Live, Gig, Worlds End, Camden
event.short_description:
The Dead Lay Waiting
Plus: SIlent Descent Death Of A Salesman Fall To The Frontline
The Dead Lay Waiting are a 5 piece Metal band from Swindon.
event.long_description: The Dead Lay Waiting are a 5 piece band from Swindon. They started writing music together in 2007, almost immediately making an instant impact on the local scene opening and supporting bands such as: Aborted, Abagail Williams, Argent Dawn and Eternal Lord. The band went to record their first E.P "Memories Of A Massacre" at "Studio 6" in late 2007 which was then followed by a self-titled E.P in early 2008. They then started to get recognised out of their local scene due to the release of their self titled E.P and started touring the U.K. Mid 2008 The Dead Lay Waiting performed in Ipswich and spotted by the well acclaimed "Rising Records" (Trigger The Bloodshed, Bleed From Within, Mendeed) and signed a U.K and Europe 5 year contract; which saw the band to record their debut album "We Rise" in Jan 2009. Their debut album was released in Jan 2010 and produced the sound the band had worked very hard to achieve. After playing a major festival every year (Bloodstock 2008, Hammerfest 2009, Download Festival 2010) and playing to packed out crowds every year, has proven the band are more than capable playing on the big stage. With a fan base growing worldwide the band have hit the studio in 2010 to record their follow up to "We Rise" and are ready to take on anything anywhere, and perform their bone crushing live performance across the world.

event.name: Society
event.tags: society band, country rock in surrey, country music in surrey, rock in surrey, live music in surrey, live music in london, live music in godalming, live music in guildford
event.short_description: Society are a three piece country rock band from West Sussex who specialize in gorgeous three part harmonies that set them apart from the current crop of Americana or West Coast rock wanabees in the UK.
event.long_description: Society are a three piece country rock band from West Sussex who specialize in gorgeous three part harmonies that set them apart from the current crop of Americana or West Coast rock wanabees in the UK. Society comprise of guitarist Matt Wise, bassist Ben Lancaster and on all things percussive F.Scott Kenny. Their recorded and live sound has echoes of C.S.N.Y, The Band, The Heartbreakers, The Jayhawks and the late great Ronnie Lane and Slim Chance. Matt Wise composes most if not all of their material and when all three sing in harmony the result is simply stunning. Since forming in 2004 Society have supported many great visiting artistes when they toured the UK, opening for notable musicians and performers such as Eve Selis, Deadstring Brothers, Corb Lund, Luke Doucet and The Wailin' Jennys. Apart from their own UK headline shows, Society have completed two tours of Canada along with a string of dates in the American mid-west gaining a whole new legion of fans in the USA. This constant touring has honed both their musical and vocal chops and in the winter of 2008 Society left their disused stable that served as their rehearsal space and spent time at The Brickhouse Studios near Brighton recording their debut release entitled Songs From The Brickhouse.

event.name: The Sizzle Suite
event.tags: Pop, rock, indie, The Sizzle Suite, Dirty jazz, jump-jive, rock-a-billy, nasty blues, bop, early soul, funk, latin, Di’Zain, The Shoestrung, Count Sizzle
event.short_description: The Sizzle Suite comes at you on the last Friday of every month with vintage voodoo, killer live acts and vintage 45′s playing dirty jazz, jump-jive, rock-a-billy, nasty blues, bop, early soul, funk, latin and old time moonshine madness!
event.long_description: The Sizzle Suite comes at you on the last Friday of every month with vintage voodoo, killer live acts and vintage 45′s playing dirty jazz, jump-jive, rock-a-billy, nasty blues, bop, early soul, funk, latin and old time moonshine madness!! Hosted by Count Sizzle, who will be spinning killer vintage 45′s from sleazy old time jazz to early heavy funk and everything in between (and we do mean everything!) Di’zain Exploding onto the London music scene, four-piece band, di’zain, are really turning heads with their tight, energetic and innovative mix of pop/rock and indie. Founded whilst studying at Guildford’s Academy of Contemporary Music, the band are really turning heads with their tight, energetic and innovative mix of pop/rock hip hop and indie and are tipped as one of the one’s to watch this year! The Shoestrung Although only young, they have long since sold their collective souls to the Devil, who almost gave up waiting at the crossroads, as no lost souls had past for many moons. That is however, until these young fellas rocked up and asked him to re-tune their guitars in the darkness…….With a rich heritage of music flowing through their collective DNA, The Shoestrung sound collides Howlin’ Wolf, The Small Faces, Muddy Waters & The Stones (to name just a few!!) with their raw energy and youthful exuberance to devastating effect!! www.myspace.com/theshoestrung DJ Count Sizzle is a Dj/compare/promoter/compiler and collector of Antique Afro-American & Vintage Voodoo Music from the 1920′s-1960′s. Spinning cool underground bygone-boppers on 78 and 45rpm. All Killers, No fillers! The Devil makes work for idle hands, feet, fingers & toes…. www.myspace.com/countsizzle

event.name: Shared Festival
event.artists: Dan Donnelly, Jim Bob, Miles Hunt, Erica Nockalls, Ian Prowes, Dirty Ray, Timothy Parkes, Smokes Feathers, Dolittle (ange)
event.tags: Shared 2, festival, Half Moon, Miles Hunt, Erica Nockalls, Dirty Ray, Jim Bob, Carter USM, Dan Donnelly, Smokes Feathers
event.short_description: This event is over two nights. Starting Friday 30th and finishing Saturday 1st October.
event.long_description: Line up Friday: Dirty Ray - After disbanding Immaculate Fools in 1995, having released six albums over an eleven year period, Ray headed for Spain, returning to a people that had already taken his poetic song writing well and truly to their collective heart. Ray spent several years immersing himself in Spain’s traditional music, the Flamenco of the south and further North, in Galicia, he wrestled with the complicated acoustic guitar rhythms of the chant based alalas songs, fusing these styles with his already deeply ingrained love of Delta Blues, (think; better dressed Seasick Steve with a passion for Tapas) until perfecting his now peculiarly individual style of treating the acoustic guitar. Dan Donnelly is a guitarist and singer/songwriter from New York, originally from Belfast. A contemporary Irish songwriter in the style of Paul Brady, Van Morrison and Bono. Ian Prowse, the vocalist and guitarist from Amsterdam. He formed Amsterdam in 1999 with cousin Johnny Barlow and former Blow Monkeys drummer Tony Kiley but didn't secure a record deal until September 2004 when the band were signed to new label Beat Crazy. During this time Amsterdam struck up a friendship with Elvis Costello who used Amsterdam[3] as his backing band on the Jonathan Ross television show as well as opening act on several occasions. The relationship was blessed on record when Prowse performed a duet with Costello on a cover of The Searchers 1964 hit 'Don't throw your love away' for the Liverpool Number Ones Project on EMI Records in 2008. Tonight performing solo. Jim Bob (Carter USM). After years of pop struggle Jim would release his first records with the band Jamie Wednesday, whose horn section Jim would work with again fumfty years later when Jim was reading a book about learning to play the recorder and discovered it was written by Jamie Wednesday sax player Simon. After Jamie Wednesday Jim Bob formed Carter The Unstoppable Sex Machine with guitarist Fruitbat. Together as Carter they would have 14 top 40 singles and a number one album, selling over a million records and touring the world. With Carter, Jim Bob would become known for his socially aware pop lyrics and in particular his use of puns. and last but by no means least The Wonderstuff's Miles Hunt & Erica Nockalls Saturday Night Line up: Special guests to be annouced Timothy Parkes - Guitarist and singer songwriter featured on the Shared Album. Smoke Feathers - Check out their new album on myspace The Wonderstuff's Miles & Erica Dolittle (Ange) - playing acoustic versions of old and new material.

event.name: Calima - Flamenco Trio & La Ambar(dancer)
event.tags: flamenco , bath, Live music
event.short_description:
Mixing traditional Flamenco with dazzling solo improvisation and soulful rhythms, Kevin Byrne, Cuffy and Ivan Moreno make each performance a unique and exciting event.
Joined by La Ambar - a Flamenco Dancer trained in the heart of Andalusia.
event.long_description: An exciting and dynamic flamenco trio. Their unique sound, while based on the core of two guitars and cajon, is endlessly varied by the use of vocals, palmas bouzouki & percussion. Be transported to hot southern climes and bask in the seductive rhythms of Flamenco with “the best guitar-led band going” – Calima. Mixing traditional Flamenco with dazzling solo improvisation and soulful rhythms, Kevin Byrne, Cuffy and Ivan Moreno make each performance a unique and exciting event. Joined at the Chapel Arts Centre by La Ambar, a Flamenco Dancer trained in the heart of Andalusia, Dance, Guitar and Cajón percussion come together as one. The cajón creates the heartbeat of the music, lending an extra depth and complexity, with percussive improvisation to perfectly accompany and complement the complexities of the guitar. The guitars perform dazzling displays of flamenco's intricate rhythms and thrilling changes of pace, moving from fast and furious beats to lyrical, almost pensive moods with beautiful fluidity. Finally the dancer, with all the passion born of her love for this art form, lays bare her soul and brings the music to a dramatic climax of fast footwork and proud expression. Join us for Anochecer Flamenco – an evening of Flamenco not to be forgotten! TICKETS http://www.chapelarts.org/events/?regevent_action=register&event_id=112&name_of_event=Calima+-+Flamenco+Trio+&La_Ambardancer WEBSITE http://www.chapelarts.org/

event.name: NICK SMART'S "JAZZ MATANZAS"
event.artists: Nick Smart - Trumpet , Chris Montague - Guitar , Kishon Khan - Piano , Denny "Jimmy" Martinez - Bass , Dave Hamblett - Drum, Kit Oreste Noda - Congas
event.tags: Live Music, Nick Smart, Jazz, Afro-Cuban , Camden Live Music, Forge Camden, North London
event.short_description: If you missed their knockout debut at The Forge last season, don’t make the same mistake twice!
event.long_description: This exciting new project from trumpeter Nick Smart has been thrilling audiences around London and makes a welcome return to Forge. The band brings together three of the most engaging and innovative jazz musicians on the current scene, with three of the most dynamic performers from the Afro-Cuban and World music scene. The "Jazz Matanzas" project is named after the region of Cuba famed for traditional Afro-Cuban music, and from where bassist Martinez and conga player Noda originally hail. The music brings together the influences from these two musical approaches, fusing jazz harmony with different rhythmic concepts. The programme is a combination of originals by Smart and Khan, and compositions of his closest musical friends and influences, including pieces by Kenny Wheeler and Stan Sulzmann in new arrangements for "Jazz Matanzas". Performance details: Doors open at 7pm for diners, music starts at 8pm Loyalty Card Holdlers - this concert applies to our loyalty card scheme Dine with this event? There are a limited number of tables available for dining during this event. Purchasing a ticket for the music does not automatically reserve a table to dine. It is possible to dine during this performance. Diners and non-diners welcome

event.name: Denys Baptiste Quartet
event.tags: Jazz, Black British Jazz, Swing, Improvisation, Denys Baptiste, Dune
event.costs: Full £13, Concessions £10, 15 – 17 year olds £2, Under 15s FREE.
event.short_description: The multi award-winning saxophonist and his superb quartet featuring pianist Andrew McCormack, double bassist Gary Crosby and drummer Rod Youngs
event.long_description: Denys Baptiste is an award-winning jazz artist, composer and educator. An outstanding saxophonist of international acclaim, Denys is renowned for his ability to make complex music accessible, creating mature, melodic, and highly memorable compositions that lodge in the memory on first hearing. Be Where You Are – his 1999 debut album on independent jazz label, Dune Records – earned him a Mercury Music Prize for An Album Of The Year and a MOBO award for Best Jazz Act. He followed this in 2001 with his second album, Alternating Currents (Dune Records DUNECD05) also receiving great critical acclaim. 2003 saw the release of his third, and most ambitious, recording/touring project to date: Let Freedom Ring! (Dune Records DUNECD010), an inspirational, uplifting suite combining contemporary jazz, gospel, blues, and Afro-Cuban music with extracts of the epic poem, Mental Fight by Booker Prize-winning author, Ben Okri who narrates on this piece. Commissioned by the Cheltenham Jazz Festival/Jerwood Foundation, Let Freedom Ring! commemorated the 40th anniversary of the historic ‘I Have A Dream’ oration by American black civil rights activist, Dr Martin Luther King and was nominated for Best Album and Best New Work in the BBC Jazz Awards, for Best Jazz Act in the MOBO (Music Of Black Origin) Awards and Best Album in the UK Parliamentary Jazz Awards. Identity By Subtraction is Baptiste’s latest studio recording first released in December 2010 with a CD release in January 2011, and is a collage of thoughts and improvisations that together create an image that represent the artist's responses to life's experience as a black man of Caribbean descent playing jazz music in the UK today. This is his first release in quartet format since his Mercury-nominated debut, Be Where You Are, and alongside him on tenor and soprano saxophone are pianist Andrew McCormack, double bassist Gary Crosby and drummer Rod Youngs. Awards: Mercury Music Prize - Album of The Year 1999, MOBO Awards - Best Jazz Act 1999, British Jazz Awards - Rising Star 2000 Nominations: BBC Jazz Awards - Best Album 2004, BBC Jazz Awards - Best New Work 2004, MOBO Awards - Best Jazz Act 2004, Parliamentary Jazz Awards - Best Album 2004
